[He]847-the captain smiled .

" That 's what [women]3203-women always say , and -- excuse [me]129-rachel -- [they]3203-women ca n't ! "[129-rachel]

[She]129-rachel laughed .

" Oh , yes , [we]3396-we can -- [the modern woman]3397-the modern woman . "[129-rachel]

" [I]847-the captain do n't see much difference between [the modern woman]3397-the modern woman and [the old - fashioned woman]3399-the old - fashioned woman , "[847-the captain] [he]847-the captain said obstinately . " It is n't dress or working at [munitions]3400-munitions that makes the difference . "[847-the captain]

" No , but -- what [they]3203-women signify . "[129-rachel]

" What?--a freer life , getting [your]3401-your own way , seeing more of [the world]474-the world ? "[847-the captain] The tone was a trifle antagonistic .

" _ Knowing _ more of [the world]474-the world , "[129-rachel] [she]129-rachel said , quietly . " [We]3396-we 're not [the ignorant babes [[our]3396-we grandmothers]3405-our grandmothers were at [our]3396-we age]3404-the ignorant babes our grandmothers were at our age . And again [he]847-the captain was aware of something sharp or bitter in [her]129-rachel -- some note of disillusionment -- that jarred with the soft , rather broad face and dreamy eyes . It stirred [him]847-the captain , and [they]870-they presently found [themselves]870-they plunged in a free and exciting discussion of the new place and opportunities of [women in [the world]474-the world]871-women in the world , [the man from the more conservative]873-the man from the more conservative , [the women from the more revolutionary point of view]874-the women from the more revolutionary point of view . Secretly , [he]847-the captain was a good deal repelled by some of [[his]847-the captain companion]287-his companion 's opinions , and [her]129-rachel expression of them . [She]129-rachel quoted [Wells]152-wells and [Shaw]153-shaw , and [he]847-the captain hated both . [He]847-the captain was [an idealist]876-an idealist and [a romantic]877-a romantic , with a volume of poems in [his]847-the captain pocket . [She]129-rachel , it seemed , was still on a rising wave of rebellion , moral and social , like [so many women]878-so many women ; while [his]847-the captain wave had passed , and [he]847-the captain was drifting in the trough of it . [He]847-the captain supposed [she]129-rachel had dropped religion , like everything else . Well , the type did n't attract [him]847-the captain . [He]847-the captain believed [the world]474-the world was coming back to the old things . The war had done it -- made [people]880-people think . No doubt [this girl]881-this girl had rushed through a lot of things already , and thought [she]129-rachel knew everything . But [she]129-rachel did n't .

Then , as [their]882-them talk went on , this first opinion dropped in confusion . For instead of presenting [him]847-the captain with [a consistent revolutionist]883-a consistent revolutionist , [[his]847-the captain companion]287-his companion was , it appeared , full of the most unexpected veins and pockets of something much softer and more appealing . [She]129-rachel had astonishing returns upon [herself]129-rachel ; and after some sentiment that had seemed to [him]847-the captain silly or even outrageous , a hurried " Oh , [I]129-rachel dare say that 's all nonsense ! "[129-rachel] would suddenly bewilder or appease a marked trenchancy of judgment in [himself]847-the captain which was not accustomed to be so tripped up .

The upshot of it was that both [Rachel]129-rachel and [[her]129-rachel new acquaintance]885-her new acquaintance enjoyed an agreeable , an adventurous half hour . [They]882-them got rapidly beyond conventionalities . One moment [she]129-rachel thought [him]847-the captain rude , the next delightful ; just as [she]129-rachel alternately appeared to [him]847-the captain feminist and feminine . Above [them]882-them the doomed beech trees , still green in the late August afternoon , spread their canopy of leaf , and through their close stems ran dark aisles of shadow . Below [them]882-them was [the tree - strewn hill - side]886-the tree - strewn hill - side . In [the hollow]813-the hollow [Rachel]129-rachel could see [Janet Leighton]131-janet and [Mrs. Fergusson]143-mrs. fergusson among [the measuring girls]888-the measuring girls ; the horses moving to and fro ; [the Canadian lumber - men]889-the canadian lumber - men catching at and guiding the logs ; the trolleys descending [the valley]775-the valley ; while just opposite to [them]882-them trunk after trunk was crashing down [the hill]369-the hill , the line of the steel cable gleaming now and then in a fitful sunshine which had begun to slip out below a roof of purple cloud . [Only one prisoner was left to look after the slide]892-only one prisoner was left to look after the slide . [The others]893-the others had just gone down [the hill]369-the hill , at a summons from below . [Suddenly Ellesborough]149-ellesborough sprang to [his]847-the captain feet .

" [Good Heavens]154-good heavens ! what 's that ? "[847-the captain] For a loud cry had rung out , accompanied by what sounded like a report . [The man who had been standing among the dead brushwood on the other side of the descending timber , about a hundred yards away]895-the man who had been standing among the dead brushwood on the other side of the descending timber , about a hundred yards away , had disappeared ; and the huge beech just launched from above had ceased to move .

Another cry for help .

" The cable 's broken ! "[149-ellesborough] said [Ellesborough]149-ellesborough , starting at full speed for the slide . [Rachel]129-rachel rushed after [him]149-ellesborough , and presently caught [him]149-ellesborough up where [he]149-ellesborough knelt beside [a man lying on the ground]896-a man lying on the ground , and writhing in great pain . [The prisoner]897-the prisoner 's cap had fallen off , and revealed [a young German lad of nineteen or twenty , hardly conscious , and groaning pitifully at intervals]898-a young german lad of nineteen or twenty , hardly conscious , and groaning pitifully at intervals . As [he]898-a young german lad of nineteen or twenty , hardly conscious , and groaning pitifully at intervals lay crouched on [his]898-a young german lad of nineteen or twenty , hardly conscious , and groaning pitifully at intervals face , the red patches on [his]898-a young german lad of nineteen or twenty , hardly conscious , and groaning pitifully at intervals back , intended to guide the aim of [an armed guard]899-an armed guard in case of any attempt to escape , showed with a sinister plainness .

" The cable snapped , and has caught [him]898-a young german lad of nineteen or twenty , hardly conscious , and groaning pitifully at intervals round the body , "[149-ellesborough] [Ellesborough]149-ellesborough explained . With skilled and gentle fingers [he]149-ellesborough began to explore the injury .

[He]149-ellesborough gave [her]900-you a swift , investigating glance .

[She]900-you interrupted [him]149-ellesborough .

" Tell [me]149-ellesborough what to do , and [I]149-ellesborough 'll do it . "[149-ellesborough]

[He]149-ellesborough loosened [the boy]901-the boy 's collar and very gently tried to ease [his]901-the boy position .

" [Mamma]3408-mamma ! "[901-the boy] murmured [the boy]901-the boy , with the accent of [a miserable child in a bad dream]903-a miserable child in a bad dream . [Her]129-rachel glance answered . By this time there was commotion below , the engine had stopped working and [men]3205-men were running up [the hill]369-the hill . [Ellesborough]149-ellesborough went bounding down [the steep slope]907-the steep slope to meet [them]3205-men . [They]3205-men turned back with [him]149-ellesborough , and [Rachel]129-rachel supposed [they]3205-men had gone to fetch a stretcher , and if possible [a doctor]908-a doctor , from [the small camp hospital which [Mrs. Fergusson]143-mrs. fergusson had pointed out to [her]129-rachel near the gate]909-the small camp hospital which mrs. fergusson had pointed out to her near the gate . Meanwhile , for a few minutes , [she]129-rachel was alone with [this suffering lad]910-this suffering lad . Was [he]910-this suffering lad fatally hurt -- dying ? [She]129-rachel managed to get some brandy down , and then [he]910-this suffering lad lay groaning and unconscious , murmuring incoherent words . [She]129-rachel caught " [Mamma]155-mamma "[129-rachel] again , then " [Lisa]141-betty , "[129-rachel] " [Hans]156-hans , "[129-rachel] and broken phrases that meant nothing to [her]129-rachel . Was [his]910-this suffering lad mind back in [some German home]911-some german home , which , perhaps , [he]910-this suffering lad would never see again ?

All sorts of thoughts passed through [her]129-rachel : vague memories gathered from the newspapers , of what [the Germans]157-the germans had done in [Belgium]35-belgium and [France]27-france -- horrible , indescribable things ! Oh , not [this boy]912-this boy , surely ! [He]910-this suffering lad could not be more than nineteen . [He]910-this suffering lad must have been captured in the fighting of [July]8-july , perhaps in [his]910-this suffering lad first action . [Captain Ellesborough]149-ellesborough had said to [her]129-rachel that there was no fighting spirit among [any of [the prisoners]914-the prisoners]913-any of the prisoners . [They]913-any of the prisoners were thankful to find [themselves]913-any of the prisoners out of [it]915-it , ' safely captured , " as one of [them]913-any of the prisoners had had the bravado to say , and with enough to eat . No doubt [this boy]912-this boy had dreamt day and night of peace , and getting back to [Germany]29-germany , to "[155-mamma] [Mamma]155-mamma " and "[141-betty] [Lisa]141-betty " and "[156-hans] [Hans]156-hans . " To die , if [he]149-ellesborough was to die , by this clumsy accident , in [an enemy country]3410-an enemy country , was hard ![156-hans]

Pity , passionate pity sprang up in [her]129-rachel , and it warmed [her]129-rachel heart to remember the pity in the face of [Captain Ellesborough]149-ellesborough . [She]129-rachel would have hated [him]149-ellesborough if [he]149-ellesborough had shown any touch of a callous or cruel spirit towards [this helpless creature]916-this helpless creature . But there had been none .

In a few more minutes [she]129-rachel was aware of [Mrs. Fergusson]143-mrs. fergusson and [Janet]131-janet climbing rapidly towards [her]129-rachel . And behind [them]917-them came [stretcher - bearers]918-stretcher - bearers , [the captain]847-the captain , and possibly [a doctor]908-a doctor .

* * * * *

The accident broke up the working afternoon . [The injured lad]921-the injured lad was carried to [hospital]922-hospital , where [the surgeon]923-the surgeon shook [his]923-the surgeon head , and refused to prophesy till twenty - four hours were over .

[Captain Ellesborough]149-ellesborough disappeared , while [Rachel]129-rachel and [Janet]131-janet were given tea at [[the woman]924-the woman 's hostel]925-the woman 's hostel and shown [the camp]3224-the camp . [Rachel]129-rachel took an absorbed interest in it all . This world of [the new woman]927-the new woman , with its widening horizons , its atmosphere of change and discovery , its independence of [men]3205-men , soothed some deep smart in [her]129-rachel that [Janet]131-janet was only now beginning to realize . And yet , [Janet]131-janet remembered [the vicar]3228-the vicar , and had watched the talk with [Ellesborough]149-ellesborough . Clearly to be [the professed enemy of man]930-the professed enemy of man did not altogether disincline [you]931-you for [his]149-ellesborough company !

At any rate it seemed quite natural to [Janet]131-janet Leighton that , when it was time to go , and [a charming girl in khaki with green facings]932-a charming girl in khaki with green facings caught the pony , and harnessed [it]933-it for [[Mrs. Fergusson]143-mrs. fergusson 's parting guests]934-mrs. fergusson 's parting guests , [Ellesborough]149-ellesborough should turn up , as soon as the farewells were over ; and that [she]131-janet should find [herself]131-janet driving [the pony - carriage]935-the pony - carriage up [the hill]369-the hill , while [Ellesborough]149-ellesborough and [Rachel]129-rachel walked behind , and at a lengthening distance . Once or twice [she]131-janet looked back , and saw that [the captain]847-the captain was gathering some of the abounding wild flowers which had sprung up on the heels of [the retreating forest]938-the retreating forest , and that [Rachel]129-rachel had fastened a bunch of them into [her]129-rachel hat . [She]131-janet smiled to [herself]131-janet , and drove steadily on . [Rachel]129-rachel was young and pretty . Marriage with [some man]939-some man -- some day -- was certainly [her]131-janet fate . The kind , unselfish [Janet]131-janet intended to " play up . "[131-janet]

Then , with a jerk , [she]131-janet remembered there was a story . Nonsense ! An unhappy love affair , no doubt , which had happened in [her]131-janet first youth , and in [Canada]13-canada . Well , such things , in the case of [a girl with the temperament of Rachel]940-a girl with the temperament of rachel , are only meant to be absorbed in another love affair . They are the leaf mould that feeds the final growth . [Janet]131-janet cheerfully said to [herself]131-janet that , probably , [her]131-janet partnership with [Rachel]129-rachel would only be a short one .

[The pair behind]941-the pair behind were , indeed , much occupied with [each other]460-each other . The tragic incident of the afternoon seemed to have carried [them]941-the pair behind rapidly through the preliminary stages of acquaintance . At least , it led naturally to talk about things and feelings more real and intimate than generally haunt the first steps . And in this talk [each]541-each found [the other]283-the other more and more congenial . [Ellesborough]149-ellesborough was now half amused , half touched , by the mixture of childishness and maturity in [Rachel]129-rachel . One moment [her]129-rachel ignorance surprised [him]149-ellesborough , and the next , some shrewd or cynical note in what [she]129-rachel was saying scattered the _ ingÃ©nue _ impression , and piqued [his]149-ellesborough curiosity afresh . [She]129-rachel was indeed crassly ignorant about many current affairs in which [he]149-ellesborough [himself]149-ellesborough was keenly interested , and of which [he]149-ellesborough supposed [all educated women]945-all educated women must by now have learnt the ABC . [She]129-rachel could not have given [him]149-ellesborough the simplest historical outline of the great war ; [he]149-ellesborough saw that [she]129-rachel was quite uncertain whether [Lloyd George]158-lloyd george or [Asquith]159-asquith were [Prime Minister]946-prime minister ; and as to politics and public persons in [Canada]13-canada , where [she]129-rachel had clearly lived some time , [her]129-rachel mind seemed to be a complete blank . None the less [she]129-rachel had read a good deal -- novels and poetry at least -- and [she]129-rachel took a queerly pessimistic view of life . [She]129-rachel liked [her]129-rachel farm work ; [she]129-rachel said so frankly . But on a sympathetic reply from [him]149-ellesborough to the effect that [he]149-ellesborough knew [several other women who had taken to it]947-several other women who had taken to it , and [they]947-several other women who had taken to it all seemed to be " happy "[129-rachel] in it , [she]129-rachel made a scornful mouth .

" Oh , well--'happy'?--that 's a different thing . But it does as well as anything else . "[129-rachel]

The last thing [she]129-rachel wanted , apparently , was to talk about [Canada]13-canada . [He]149-ellesborough , [himself]149-ellesborough , as [a temporary settler in [the Great Dominion]949-the great dominion]948-a temporary settler in the great dominion , cherished an enthusiasm for [Canada]13-canada and a belief in the Canadian future , not , perhaps , very general among [Americans]160-americans ; but although [her]129-rachel knowledge of [the country]950-the country gave [them]951-they inevitably some common ground , [she]129-rachel continually held back from it , [she]129-rachel entered on it as little as [she]129-rachel could . [She]129-rachel had been in [the Dominion]952-the dominion , [he]149-ellesborough presently calculated , about seven or eight years ; but [she]129-rachel avoided names and dates , how adroitly , [he]149-ellesborough did not perceive till [they]951-they had parted , and [he]149-ellesborough was thinking over [their]951-they walk . [She]129-rachel must have gone out to [Canada]13-canada immediately after leaving [school]953-school . [He]149-ellesborough gathered that [[her]129-rachel father]735-her father had been [a clergyman]955-a clergyman , and was dead ; that [she]129-rachel knew [the prairie]956-the prairie life , but had never been in [British Columbia]36-british columbia , and only a few days in [Montreal]37-montreal and [Toronto]38-toronto . That was all that , at the end of [their]951-they walk , [he]149-ellesborough knew ; and all apparently [she]129-rachel meant [him]149-ellesborough to know . Whereas [she]129-rachel on [her]129-rachel side showed a beguiling power of listening to all [he]149-ellesborough had to say about the mysterious infinity of [the Canadian forest - lands]957-the canadian forest - lands and the wild life that , winter or spring , [a man]3155-a man may live among them , which flattered the very human conceit of a strong and sensitive nature .

But at last [they]951-they had climbed [the tree - strewn slope]959-the tree - strewn slope , and were on [the open ridge]960-the open ridge with [the northern plain]961-the northern plain in view . The sun was now triumphantly out , just before [his]149-ellesborough setting ; the clouds had been flung aside , and [he]149-ellesborough shone full upon [the harvest world]962-the harvest world -- [such a harvest world as [England]2-england]963-such a harvest world as england had not seen for a century . There [they]951-they lay , [the new and golden fields]964-the new and golden fields , where , to north and south , to east and west , the soil of [England]2-england , so long unturned , had joyously answered once more to [its]2-england old comrade the plough .

" ' [An enemy]3411-an enemy hath done this , ' "[149-ellesborough] quoted [Ellesborough]149-ellesborough , with an approving smile , as [he]149-ellesborough pointed towards [the plain]288-the plain . " But there was [a God]3412-a god behind [him]149-ellesborough ! "[149-ellesborough]

[Rachel]129-rachel laughed . " Well , [I]129-rachel 've got [three fields]3413-three fields still to get in , "[129-rachel] [she]129-rachel said . " And they 're the best . Goodnight . "[129-rachel]

[She]129-rachel gave [him]149-ellesborough [her]129-rachel hand , standing transfigured in the light , the wind blowing [her]129-rachel beautiful hair about [her]129-rachel .

" May [I]149-ellesborough come and see [you]129-rachel ? "[149-ellesborough] [he]149-ellesborough asked , rather formally .

[She]129-rachel smiled assent .

" Next week _ everything _ will be in , and some of it threshed . [I]129-rachel shall be freer then . [You]129-rachel 'll like [[our]3414-our place]3415-our place . "[129-rachel]

[He]149-ellesborough pressed [her]129-rachel hand , and [she]129-rachel was off , running like a fawn after [the retreating pony carriage]966-the retreating pony carriage .

[He]149-ellesborough turned away , a little dazzled and shaken . The image of [her]129-rachel on [the ridge]967-the ridge remained ; but what perhaps had struck deepest had been the sweetness of [her]129-rachel as [she]129-rachel hung above [the injured boy]968-the injured boy . [He]149-ellesborough went slowly towards [the camp]3224-the camp , conscious that the day now departing had opened a new door in [the House of Life]970-the house of life .

[IV

Ellesborough]161-ellesborough allowed a week to pass before making the call at [Great End]15-great end [he]149-ellesborough had arranged with [Rachel]129-rachel . But at last , when [he]149-ellesborough thought that [her]129-rachel harvesting would be really over , [he]149-ellesborough set out on [his]149-ellesborough motor bicycle , one fine evening , as soon as work at [the camp]3224-the camp was over . According to summer time it was about seven o'clock , and the sun was still sailing clear above [the western woods]972-the western woods .

Part of [his]149-ellesborough way lay over a broad common chequered with fine trees and groups of trees , some of [them]973-them of great age ; for the rest [he]149-ellesborough ran through a world where harvest in its latest stages was still the governing fact . In [some fields]974-some fields the corn was being threshed on the spot , without waiting for the stacks ; in others , the last loads were being led ; and everywhere in [the cleared fields]975-the cleared fields there were scattered figures of [gleaners , casting long shadows on the gold and purple carpet of the stubble]976-gleaners , casting long shadows on the gold and purple carpet of the stubble . For [Ellesborough]149-ellesborough the novelty of [this garden [England]2-england]977-this garden england , so elaborately combed and finished in comparison with [[his]149-ellesborough own country]978-his own country , was by no means exhausted . There were times when [the cottage gardens]979-the cottage gardens , the endless hedge - rows , and [miniature plantations]980-miniature plantations pleased [him]149-ellesborough like the detail in those early Florentine pictures in [the Metropolitan Museum]981-the metropolitan museum , for which , [business man]982-business man as [he]149-ellesborough was , and accustomed to the wilds , [he]149-ellesborough had once or twice , on visits to [New York]40-new york , discovered in [himself]149-ellesborough a considerable taste . [He]149-ellesborough was [a man , indeed , of many aptitudes , and of a loyal and affectionate temper]983-a man , indeed , of many aptitudes , and of a loyal and affectionate temper . [[His]149-ellesborough father]984-his father , [a country doctor]985-a country doctor , now growing old , [[his]149-ellesborough mother]986-his mother , still pretty at sixty , and [[his]149-ellesborough two unmarried sisters]987-his two unmarried sisters were all very dear to [him]149-ellesborough . [He]149-ellesborough wrote to [them]988-their constantly , and received many letters from [them]988-their . [They]988-their belonged to one of the old Unitarian stocks still common in [New England]41-new england ; and such stocks are generally conspicuous for high standards and clean living . " Discipline "[991-mother] was among the chief marks of [the older generation]989-the older generation . [A father]990-a father or [mother]991-mother dreaded [an " undisciplined "[991-mother] child]992-an " undisciplined " child , and the word was often on [their]988-their lips , though in no Pharisaical way ; while the fact was evident in [their]988-their lives , and in those private diaries which [they]988-their were apt to keep , wherein , up to old age , [they]988-their jealously watched [their]988-their own daily thoughts and actions from the same point of view .

And though [the younger generation]993-the younger generation , like [the younger generation of [Quakers]162-quakers]994-the younger generation of quakers , shows change and some disintegration , the old Puritan traditions and standards are still , as [we]995-we all know , of great effect among [them]988-their . Especially with regard to [women]3203-women , and all that concerns [them]3203-women . Among [the Ellesborough clan]997-the ellesborough clan , which was a large one , there prevailed , along with the traditional American consideration for [women]3203-women , and especially among [the women of [the family]1000-the family [themselves]999-the women of the family themselves]999-the women of the family themselves -- a strict and even severe standard of sexual morals . There was no hypocrisy in it ; [they]988-their talked of it but little , but [they]988-their lived by it ; and [[their]988-their men]1001-their men were brought up in the atmosphere created by it . And as affection and tenderness and self - sacrifice were freely mixed with the asceticism , there was no rebellion -- at any rate no open rebellion -- among [[their]988-their men folk]1002-their men folk . The atmosphere created led , no doubt , to certain evasions of the hard problems of life ; and to some quiet revaluations of things and [persons]503-persons when [the sons of [the family]1000-the family]1004-the sons of the family came to [[men]3205-men 's estate]1007-men 's estate . But in general the " ape and tiger , "[1008-the normal human being] still surviving in [the normal human being]1008-the normal human being , had been really and effectively tamed in [the Ellesborough race]1009-the ellesborough race . There was also a sensitive delicacy both of thought and speech among [them]3203-women ; answering to more important and tested realities . [Their]988-their marriages were a success ; [[their]988-their children]1010-their children were well brought up , under light but effective control ; and , if it be true , as [Americans]160-americans are ready to say , that the old conception of marriage is being slowly but profoundly modified over large sections of [[their]988-their great Commonwealth]1011-their great commonwealth , towards a laxity undreamt of half a century ago , [the Ellesboroughs]163-the ellesboroughs could neither be taxed nor applauded in the matter . [They]988-their stood by the old ways , and [they]988-their stood by [them]3203-women whole - heartedly .

[Ellesborough]161-ellesborough [himself]161-ellesborough , no doubt , had knocked about [the world]474-the world more than most of [[his]161-ellesborough kindred]1013-his kindred , and had learnt to look at many things differently . But essentially , [he]161-ellesborough was [the son of [his]161-ellesborough race]1014-the son of his race . [His]161-ellesborough attitude towards [women]3203-women was at once reverential and protective . [He]161-ellesborough believed [women]3203-women were better than [men]3205-men , because practically [he]161-ellesborough had found it so in [his]161-ellesborough own circle ; but [he]161-ellesborough held also very strong beliefs , seldom expressed , as to [their]988-their social disadvantages and [their]988-their physical weakness . The record of [the Germans towards women in [France]27-france and [Flanders]42-flanders]1018-the germans towards women in france and flanders , a record [he]161-ellesborough had verified for [himself]161-ellesborough , had perhaps done more than anything else to feed the stern flame of war in [his]161-ellesborough own soul . At thirty - two , [he]161-ellesborough would probably have already been [a married man]1019-a married man , but for the war . [He]161-ellesborough rather fiercely held that it was [a man]3155-a man 's duty to marry and have [children]1021-children . But beyond a few passing fancies [he]161-ellesborough had never been in love ; and since the American declaration of war , [he]161-ellesborough had been , like [[his]161-ellesborough President]1022-his president , out to " make [the world]474-the world safe for democracy "[1022-his president] ; and the ardour of the struggle had swept [his]161-ellesborough private interests out of sight .

All the same here [he]161-ellesborough was , walking [his]161-ellesborough motor cycle up [the field road leading to [Great End Farm]1-great end farm]1023-the field road leading to great end farm , and looking eagerly about [him]161-ellesborough . A lonely position , but beautiful ! On [the woods behind [the house]337-the house]1024-the woods behind the house [he]161-ellesborough turned a professional eye . Fine timber ! [The man who was to succeed [him]161-ellesborough at [Ralstone]20-ralstone]1026-the man who was to succeed him at ralstone would no doubt have the cutting of [it]1027-it . [The farm quadrangle]1028-the farm quadrangle , with [[its]1028-the farm quadrangle sixteenth century barn]1029-its sixteenth century barn , out of which the corn seemed to be actually bursting from various open doors and windows , appeared to [him]161-ellesborough through that glamour which , for [the intelligent American]164-the intelligent american , belongs to everything that [medieval and Elizabethan England]1030-medieval and elizabethan england has bequeathed to [the England of the present]1031-the england of the present . [He]161-ellesborough will back [himself]161-ellesborough , [he]161-ellesborough thinks , to plan and build [a modern town]1032-a modern town better than [the Britisher]1033-the britisher -- in any case quicker . But the mosses and tiles of [an old Brookshire barn]1034-an old brookshire barn beat [him]161-ellesborough .

[Ellesborough]161-ellesborough paused at the gate to watch [two land lassies]1035-two land lassies carrying pails of milk across [the yard]610-the yard towards a prolongation of [the farm - house]675-the farm - house , which [he]161-ellesborough supposed was [the dairy]1038-the dairy . Just beyond [the farm - yard]430-the farm - yard , two great wheat - stacks were visible ; while in the hayfields running up to [the woods]485-the woods , large hay - stacks , already nearly thatched , showed dimly in the evening light . And all this was run by [women]3203-women , worked by [Women]3203-women ! Well , [American women]1043-american women , so [he]161-ellesborough heard from [home]3185-home , were doing the same in [the fields and farms of [the States]3376-the states]1045-the fields and farms of the states . It was all part , [he]161-ellesborough supposed , of [a world movement , by which , no less than by]1047-a world movement , by which , no less than by the war itself , these great years would be for ever remembered .

[The farm - house]675-the farm - house itself , however , seemed to [him]161-ellesborough from the outside a poor , flimsy thing , unworthy of [the old farm buildings]1049-the old farm buildings . [He]161-ellesborough could see that the walls of [it]675-the farm - house were only a brick thick , and in spite of the pretty curtains , [he]161-ellesborough was struck by the odd feature of the two large windows exactly opposite each other , so that [a spectator on either side of [the house]337-the house]1050-a spectator on either side of the house might look right through [it]675-the farm - house .

" Seems like being in [the street]3417-the street . However , if there 's [nobody]3230-nobody to look at [you]3419-you , [I]161-ellesborough suppose it do n't matter . "[161-ellesborough]

Then [he]161-ellesborough laughed , for just as [he]161-ellesborough led [his]161-ellesborough motor cycle into [the yard]610-the yard , and passed the sitting - room window , [he]161-ellesborough was struck by the appearance of two large sheep , who seemed to be actually in the sitting - room , at its farther end . [They]1053-they were standing , [he]161-ellesborough presently perceived , upon the steep down beyond [the house]337-the house , on [the slope of which [the farm]345-the farm was built]1055-the slope of which the farm was built ; which on [the southern side of [the farm quadrangle]1028-the farm quadrangle]1057-the southern side of the farm quadrangle came right up to the house wall . But when [Jenny Harberton]142-janet had admitted [him]161-ellesborough , and [he]161-ellesborough was waiting in [the sitting - room]447-the sitting - room , from which [the woman [he]161-ellesborough had seen]1061-the woman he had seen had disappeared , [he]161-ellesborough was in the mood to admire everything . How nice [the two women]763-the two women had made it ! [His]161-ellesborough own rough life , both before and since the war , had only increased a natural instinct for order and seemliness . The pretty blue paper , the fresh drugget , the photographs on the wall , the flowers , and the delicate neatness of everything delighted [him]161-ellesborough . [He]161-ellesborough went round looking at the pictures and the few books , perfectly conscious that everything which [he]161-ellesborough saw had a more than common interest for [him]161-ellesborough . [The room]431-the room seemed to be telling a story -- opening points of view .

" Ah ! "[161-ellesborough]

[He]161-ellesborough paused , a broad smile overspreading [his]161-ellesborough bronzed face .

For [he]161-ellesborough had perceived a popular History of the War lying open and face downwards on the table , one that [he]161-ellesborough had recommended to [the mistress of [the farm]345-the farm]1064-the mistress of the farm . And there was actually a piano ! [He]161-ellesborough wondered whether [she]1064-the mistress of the farm played , or [[her]1064-the mistress of the farm friend]519-her friend .

Meanwhile [Rachel]129-rachel was changing [her]129-rachel dress [upstairs]439-upstairs -- rather deliberately . [She]129-rachel stood now before the glass , [a radiant daughter of air and earth]1072-a radiant daughter of air and earth ; [her]129-rachel veins , as it were , still full of the sheer pleasure of [her]129-rachel long day among the stubbles and [the young stock]1073-the young stock . [She]129-rachel was tired , of course ; and [she]129-rachel knew very well that the winter , when it came , would make a great difference , and that much of the work before [her]129-rachel would be hard and disagreeable . But for the moment , [her]129-rachel deep satisfaction with the life [she]129-rachel had chosen , the congruity between it and [her]129-rachel , gave [her]129-rachel a peculiar charm . [She]129-rachel breathed content , and there is no more beautifying thing .

[She]129-rachel had thought a good deal about [Ellesborough]161-ellesborough since [their]1074-their meeting ; yet not absorbingly , for [she]129-rachel had [her]129-rachel work to do . [She]129-rachel was rather inclined to quarrel with [him]161-ellesborough for having been so long in making [his]161-ellesborough call ; and this feeling , perhaps , induced [her]129-rachel to dawdle a little over the last touches of [her]129-rachel toilet . [She]129-rachel had put on a thin , black dress , which tamed the exuberance of [her]129-rachel face and hair , and set off the brilliance and fineness of [her]129-rachel skin where the open blouse displayed it . The beautiful throat was sunburnt , indeed , but not unbecomingly so ; and [she]129-rachel was about to fasten round it a slender gold chain , when [she]129-rachel suddenly dropped the chain . Some association had passed through [her]129-rachel mind which made [her]129-rachel shrink from it .

[She]129-rachel chose instead a necklace of bluish - green beads , long , and curiously interwoven , which gave a touch of dignity to the plain dress . Then [she]129-rachel paused to consider the whole effect , in a spirit of meditation rather than mere vanity . " _ [I]129-rachel wish [he]3420-he knew _ ! "[129-rachel] [she]129-rachel thought , and the glass reflected a frown of perplexity . Had [she]129-rachel been wise , after all , to make such a complete mystery of the past ? [Rachel]129-rachel was in the mood to feel a certain childish exultation in the plenty of [the farm]345-the farm , amid the general rationing . [He]149-ellesborough had both elbows on the table , and was playing with a cigarette . There was nothing the least patronizing or arrogant in [his]149-ellesborough manner . But there was a male note in it -- perhaps a touch of self - confidence -- which ruffled [her]129-rachel .

" Oh , [I]129-rachel am [a bad letter - writer]3440-a bad letter - writer , "[129-rachel] [she]129-rachel said , as [she]129-rachel got up from the table . " Shall [we]1166-we go and look at the cows ? "[129-rachel]

[They]1166-we all went out into the warm September night . [Ellesborough]149-ellesborough followed [Rachel]129-rachel , cigarette in hand , [his]149-ellesborough strong mouth twisting a little . The night was almost cloudless . The pale encircling down , patched at intervals with [dark hanging woods]1167-dark hanging woods , lay quiet under a sky full of faint stars . The scent of [the stubblefields]1168-the stubblefields , of the great corn - stack just beyond [the farmyard]426-the farmyard , of [the big barn]1170-the big barn so full that the wide wooden doors could not be closed , was mingled with the strong ammonia smells of [the farm - yard]430-the farm - yard , and here and there with the sweetness left in the evening air by the chewing cows on [their]1172-their passage to [the cow - house on the farther side of [the yard]610-the yard]1173-the cow - house on the farther side of the yard .

[Rachel]129-rachel led the way to [the cow - house]1175-the cow - house -- [a vast fifteenth - century barn]1176-a vast fifteenth - century barn , with an interlacing forest of timber in [its]1175-the cow - house roof , where the six cows stood ranged , while [Janet]131-janet and [the two land lassies]1177-the two land lassies , with [[Hastings]127-miss henderson [the bailiff]398-the bailiff to help [them]1177-the two land lassies]1178-hastings the bailiff to help them , were changing the litter and filling up the racks with hay . [Rachel]129-rachel went along the line pointing out the beauties of each separate beast to [Ellesborough]149-ellesborough , and caressing two little calves whom [Jenny]131-janet was feeding by hand . [Ellesborough]149-ellesborough was amused by [her]129-rachel technical talk and [[her]129-rachel proprietor]1180-her proprietor 's airs . It seemed to [him]149-ellesborough a kind of play - acting , but it fascinated [him]149-ellesborough . [Janet]131-janet had brought in a lantern , and the light and shade of it seemed to have been specially devised to bring into relief [Rachel]129-rachel 's round and tempting beauty , the bright brown of [her]129-rachel hair where it curled on the temples , and the lovely oval of the cheeks . [Ellesborough]149-ellesborough watched [her]129-rachel , now passing into deep shadow , and now brilliantly lit up , as the light of the lantern caught [her]129-rachel ; overhead , the criss - cross of the arching beams as of [some primitive cathedral]1181-some primitive cathedral , centuries old ; and on either side the dim forms of [the munching cattle]1182-the munching cattle , and the pretty movements of [the girls]3326-the girls busy with [their]3326-the girls work .

" Take care , "[129-rachel] laughed [Rachel]129-rachel as [she]129-rachel passed [him]149-ellesborough . " There are horrid holes in this floor . [I]129-rachel have n't had time to mend them . "[129-rachel]

As [she]129-rachel spoke , [she]129-rachel slipped and almost fell . [Ellesborough]149-ellesborough threw out a quick hand and caught [her]129-rachel by the arm . [She]129-rachel smiled into [his]149-ellesborough face .

" Neatly done ! "[129-rachel] [she]129-rachel said composedly , submitting to be led by [him]149-ellesborough over a very broken bit of pavement near the door . [His]149-ellesborough hand held [her]129-rachel firmly . Nor did [she]129-rachel make any effort to release [herself]129-rachel till [they]1184-they were outside . Here were [the vicar]3228-the vicar and [[his]149-ellesborough sister]1186-his sister waiting to say good - night -- [the vicar]3228-the vicar much chagrined that [he]149-ellesborough had seen so little of [[his]149-ellesborough chief hostess]1188-his chief hostess , and inclined to feel that [his]149-ellesborough self - sacrificing attention to [Miss Leighton]133-miss leighton at supper had been but poorly rewarded . [Rachel]129-rachel , however , saw that [he]149-ellesborough was out of humour , and at once set [herself]129-rachel to appease [him]149-ellesborough . And in the few minutes which elapsed before [she]129-rachel parted with [him]149-ellesborough at the gate [she]129-rachel had quite succeeded .

Then [she]129-rachel turned to [Ellesborough]149-ellesborough .

" Shall [we]1189-we go up [the hill]369-the hill a little ? "[129-rachel]

[They]1189-we slipped through a side gate of [the farmyard]426-the farmyard , crossed [a field]1191-a field , and found [themselves]1189-we on [an old grass road]1192-an old grass road leading gently upward along the side of the down into the shadow of [the woods]485-the woods . The still , warm night held [them]1189-we enwrapped . [Rachel]129-rachel had thrown a white scarf over [her]129-rachel head and throat , which gave a mysterious charm to the face within it . As [she]129-rachel strolled beside [[her]129-rachel hew friend]1194-her hew friend [she]129-rachel played [him]149-ellesborough with all the arts of [a woman resolved to please]1195-a woman resolved to please . And [he]149-ellesborough allowed [himself]149-ellesborough to be handled at [her]129-rachel will . [He]149-ellesborough told [her]129-rachel about [[his]149-ellesborough people]1196-his people , and [[his]149-ellesborough friends]1197-his friends , about the ideas and ambitions , also , with which [he]149-ellesborough had come to [Europe]46-europe , which were now in abeyance , but were to spring to active life after the war . [He]149-ellesborough talked shrewdly , but also with ardour and imagination ; [she]129-rachel was stirred , excited even ; and all the time [she]129-rachel liked the foreignness of [his]149-ellesborough voice , the outline of [his]149-ellesborough profile against the sky , and all the other elements of [his]149-ellesborough physical presence .

But in the midst of [[his]149-ellesborough castle - building]1199-his castle - building [he]149-ellesborough broke off .

" However , [I]129-rachel 'm [a silly fool]3442-a silly fool to talk like this . [I]129-rachel 'm going out to the front directly . Perhaps [my]129-rachel bullet 's waiting for [me]129-rachel . "[129-rachel]

" Oh , no ! "[129-rachel] [she]129-rachel said involuntarily--"no ! "[129-rachel]

" [I]129-rachel hope not . [I]129-rachel do n't want to die just yet . [I]129-rachel want to get married , for one thing . "[129-rachel]

[He]149-ellesborough spoke lightly , and [she]129-rachel laughed .

" Well , that 's easy enough . "[129-rachel]

[He]149-ellesborough shook [his]149-ellesborough head , but said nothing . [They]1200-they walked on till [they]1200-they reached [the edge of [the hill]369-the hill]1201-the edge of the hill , when [Rachel]129-rachel , out of breath , sat down on a fallen log to rest a little . " [We]1200-they have n't seen [the ghost]3443-the ghost ! "[129-rachel]

[He]149-ellesborough asked [her]129-rachel for the story , and [she]129-rachel told it . By now [she]129-rachel had pieced it all together ; and it seemed to [Ellesborough]149-ellesborough that it had a morbid fascination for [her]129-rachel .

" [He]149-ellesborough dragged [himself]149-ellesborough down [this very path]3444-this very path , "[129-rachel] [she]129-rachel said . "[129-rachel]

[He]149-ellesborough could n't help laughing gently at [her]129-rachel foolishness .

" Why , it 's a great distinction to have [a ghost]3449-a ghost ! "[149-ellesborough]

" [Any one]3450-any one can have [my]149-ellesborough ghost that wants . [I]149-ellesborough 'm awfully easily scared . "[149-ellesborough]

" Are [you]129-rachel ? "[149-ellesborough] There was a deep note in [his]149-ellesborough voice . " No , [I]149-ellesborough do n't believe that . " How do [you]129-rachel know ? "[149-ellesborough]

" Fear of what ? "[129-rachel]

" [I]129-rachel do n't know . "[129-rachel]

[She]129-rachel spoke in a sombre , shrinking tone , which struck [him]149-ellesborough uncomfortably . * * * * *

On this same September afternoon , [a dark - eyed , shabby woman]1214-a dark - eyed , shabby woman , with [a little girl]1215-a little girl , alighted at [Millsborough Station]47-millsborough station . V

[The little town of Millsborough]1239-the little town of millsborough was _ en fÃªte _ . There was a harvest festival going on , and [the County Agricultural Committee]1240-the county agricultural committee had taken the opportunity to celebrate the successful gathering of the crops , and the part taken in it by [the woman land - workers under [their]1240-the county agricultural committee care]1241-the woman land - workers under their care . [They]1240-the county agricultural committee had summoned the land lasses from far and wide ; in a field on [the outskirts of [the town]3456-the town]1242-the outskirts of the town competitions had been in full swing all the morning , and now there were to be speeches in [the market - place]1244-the market - place , and a final march of [land girls]1245-land girls , [boy scouts]1246-boy scouts , and decorated wagons to [the old Parish Church]1247-the old parish church , where a service was to be held .

All [Millsborough]43-millsborough , indeed , was in [the streets]1248-the streets to look at the procession , and [the crowd]1249-the crowd was swelled by [scores of cadets from [a neighbouring camp]1251-a neighbouring camp , who were good - heartedly keeping the route , and giving a military air to the show]1250-scores of cadets from a neighbouring camp , who were good - heartedly keeping the route , and giving a military air to the show . But the flower - decked wagons were the centre of interest . The first in the line was really a brilliant performance . It was an old wagon of Napoleonic days , lent by [a farmer]1252-a farmer , whose forebears had rented [the same farm]1253-the same farm since [William]170-william and [Mary]171-marianne . Every spoke of the wheels blazed with red geraniums ; there was a fringe of heather along the edge of [the cart]1254-the cart , while vegetables , huge marrows , turnips , carrots , and onions dangled from its sides , and [the people inside]1255-the people inside sat under a nodding canopy of tall and splendid wheat , mixed with feathery barley . But [the passengers]1256-the passengers were perhaps the most attractive thing about it . [They]1256-the passengers were [four old women in lilac sunbonnets]1257-four old women in lilac sunbonnets . [They]1256-the passengers were all over seventy , and [they]1256-the passengers had all worked bravely in the harvest . [The crowd]1249-the crowd cheered [them]1256-the passengers vociferously , and [they]1256-the passengers sat , looking timidly out on the scene with smiling eyes and tremulous lips , [their]1256-the passengers grey hair blowing about [their]1256-the passengers wrinkled , wholesome faces .

[Lady Alicia]173-lady alicia was [a thin woman , with an excitable temperament]1281-a thin woman , with an excitable temperament , to judge from [her]173-lady alicia restless mouth and eyes , which were never still for a moment . " [[My]173-lady alicia husband]3480-my husband says [they]1295-the new tenants 'll simply crush the life out of farming . [We]3481-we shall all be ruined , and where will [the labourer]465-the labourer be then ? "[173-lady alicia]

And [Miss Henderson]127-miss henderson had looked quite unpleasant . [The wagons]1306-the wagons drew up in the centre of [the market - place]1244-the market - place , and the band which [the cadets]1308-the cadets had brought with [them]1306-the wagons struck up " [God Save the King]176-god . "[173-lady alicia] [Lady Alicia]173-lady alicia rose at once and nudged [[her]173-lady alicia little boy]1309-her little boy , whom [she]173-lady alicia had brought with [her]173-lady alicia , to take off [his]1309-her little boy cap . Meanwhile , the speaking was beginning from the first cart . [A land girl who had played a rousing part in the recruiting campaign of the early summer]1315-a land girl who had played a rousing part in the recruiting campaign of the early summer was speaking in a high voice , clearly heard by [the crowd]1249-the crowd . [She]1315-a land girl who had played a rousing part in the recruiting campaign of the early summer was tall and pretty , and spoke without a sign of hesitation or self - consciousness . [She]1315-a land girl who had played a rousing part in the recruiting campaign of the early summer gloried in the harvest , in the splendid news from the war , in the growth of [[the Woman]177-the woman 's Land Army]1317-the woman 's land army . " [We]1314-we 've just been proud to do [our]1314-we bit at [home]3185-home while [[our]1314-we boys]3484-our boys have been fighting over [there]377-there . [They]3484-our boys 'll be [home]3185-home soon , perhaps , and wo n't [we]1314-we give [them]3484-our boys a welcome ! And [we]1314-we 'll show [them]3484-our boys the harvest that [we]1314-we 've helped to reap -- the biggest harvest that [England]2-england 's ever known!--the harvest that 's going to beat the Boche . "[1318-the young simple voice] [The young simple voice]1318-the young simple voice flowed on , with its simple story and its note of enthusiasm , and sometimes of humour . " It 's hard work , but [we]1314-we love it ! It 's cold work often , but [we]1314-we love it ! The horses and the cows and the pigs -- [they're]3487-they're naughty often , but [they]3487-they're 're [nice!---yes]3488-nice!---yes , the pigs , too . " [We]1249-the crowd 've tightened [our]1249-the crowd own belts already ; [we]1249-the crowd can tighten them , [I]847-the captain dare say , a few holes more . [He]292-the old man could hear [them]1456-them singing , the harvest hymn : " [We]1456-them plough [the fields]3144-the fields and scatter -- The good seed on [the land]334-the land . "[1456-them] But [he]292-the old man did not stop to listen . [He]292-the old man walked on rapidly in [the direction of [Ipscombe]12-ipscombe]1457-the direction of ipscombe .

[Delane]179-delane found the main line from [Millsborough]43-millsborough to [Ipscombe]12-ipscombe dotted at intervals with [groups of [persons returning from the harvest festival]1459-persons returning from the harvest festival]1458-groups of persons returning from the harvest festival -- [elderly women with [children]1021-children]1460-elderly women with children , [a few old labourers]1462-a few old labourers , [a few [soldiers on leave]1464-soldiers on leave , with a lively fringe of [noisy boys]1465-noisy boys and [girls]3223-girls skirmishing round and about [[their]1456-them elders]1467-their elders , like so many young animals on the loose]1463-a few soldiers on leave , with a lively fringe of noisy boys and girls skirmishing round and about their elders , like so many young animals on the loose . The evening light was failing . The pools left by a passing shower , gleamed along [the road]3145-the road , and the black elms and oaks , scarcely touched as yet by autumn gold , stood straight and sharp against a rainy sky .

[The tall , slouching man]1469-the tall , slouching man scrutinized [the various groups]1470-the various groups as [he]1469-the tall , slouching man passed [them]1470-the various groups , as though making up [his]1469-the tall , slouching man mind whether to address [them]1470-the various groups or not . [He]1469-the tall , slouching man wore a shabby greatcoat , warmer than the day demanded , and closely buttoned across the chest . The rest of [his]1469-the tall , slouching man dress , felt hat , dark trousers , and tan boots , had all of it come originally from [expensive shops]1471-expensive shops , but was now only just presentable . The one thing in good condition about [him]1469-the tall , slouching man was the Malacca cane [he]1469-the tall , slouching man carried , which had a carved jade handle , and was altogether out of keeping with [his]1469-the tall , slouching man general appearance .

All the same there was something striking in that appearance . Face , figure and dress represented the wreck of more than one kind of distinction . The face must once have been exceptionally handsome , before an underlying commonness and coarseness had been brought out or emphasized by developments of character and circumstance . The mouth was now loose and heavy . The hazel eyes had lost [their]1472-their youth , and were disfigured by the premature wrinkles of either ill - health or dissipation . None the less , [a certain carriage of the head and shoulders]1473-a certain carriage of the head and shoulders , a certain magnificence in the whole general outline of [the man]3153-the man , especially in the defiant eyes and brow , marked [him]1469-the tall , slouching man out from [the crowd]1249-the crowd , and drew attention of [strangers]1476-strangers .

[Many persons]1477-many persons looked at [him]1469-the tall , slouching man , as [he]1469-the tall , slouching man at [them]1477-many persons , while [he]1469-the tall , slouching man swung slowly along [the road]3145-the road . At last [he]1469-the tall , slouching man crossed over towards [an elderly man in company with [a young soldier]1480-a young soldier , who was walking lamely with a stick]1479-an elderly man in company with a young soldier , who was walking lamely with a stick .

" That [you]1482-the stranger are , [muster]3537-muster . The next turnin ' to the right'll bring [yer]1482-the stranger to it . "[182-betts] [Peter Betts]182-betts looked [the stranger]1482-the stranger over as [he]182-betts spoke , with an inquisitive eye .

" [You]1482-the stranger 've come from the meeting , [I]182-betts suppose ? "[182-betts]

" Ay . [We]3538-we did n't go to the service . That worn't in [our]3538-we line . But [we]3538-we heerd the speeches out o ' doors . "[182-betts]

" [The carts]3539-the carts were fine!--especially the second one . "[182-betts]

" [Ay]183-ay -- that 's [[our]3538-we missis]3540-our missis . [She]3540-our missis and [the two girls]729-the two girls done the dressin ' o ' [the cart]1254-the cart . "[182-betts]

" What 's [her]3540-our missis name ? "[182-betts]

" Well , [her]3540-our missis name 's [Henderson]127-miss henderson , "[292-the old man] said [the old man]292-the old man , speaking with an amiable , half careless detachment , the manner rather of [a philosopher than a gossip]1484-a philosopher than a gossip .

" [She]3540-our missis 's [[the farmer]3543-the farmer 's wife]3544-the farmer 's wife ? "[182-betts]

" Noa , [she]3540-our missis ai n't . [She]3540-our missis 's [the farmer]3543-the farmer herself--'at 's what [she]3540-our missis is . [She]3540-our missis 's took [the farm]345-the farm from [Colonel Shepherd]3547-colonel shepherd -- [she]3540-our missis did -- all on [her]3540-our missis own . " _ [Miss _ Henderson]127-miss henderson ? [She]3540-our missis 's not married ? "[182-betts]

" Not [she]3540-our missis ! "[182-betts] said [old Betts]182-betts emphatically . " [She]3540-our missis 's like [a lot o ' women]3550-a lot o ' women nowadays , [I]182-betts guess . [They]3550-a lot o ' women doan't want to be married . "[182-betts]

[Delane]179-delane followed all these remarks with close attention , and continued a rather skilful examination . [The lane on [the farther side of [the village]304-the village]1496-the farther side of the village]1495-the lane on the farther side of the village was dark under branching trees . [[Rachel]129-rachel 's place]1502-rachel 's place ! " [DEAR ROGER,--I]185-dear roger,--i can do nothing for [you]185-dear roger,--i . [Your]185-dear roger,--i demands are simply insatiable . If [you]185-dear roger,--i write [me]179-delane any more begging letters , or if [you]185-dear roger,--i attempt again to force [your]185-dear roger,--i way into [[my]179-delane house]3556-my house as [you]185-dear roger,--i did last week , [I]179-delane shall tell [the bank]3557-the bank to cancel [your]185-dear roger,--i allowance , and wash [my]179-delane hands of [you]185-dear roger,--i altogether . [[My]179-delane husband]3480-my husband 's determined to stop this kind of thing . Do n't imagine [you]185-dear roger,--i can either threaten [us]3559-us , or come round [us]3559-us . [We]3559-us have tried again and again to help and reform [you]185-dear roger,--i . It is no good -- and now [we]3559-us give [you]185-dear roger,--i up . "[179-delane]

That was a nice letter to get from [[a man]3155-a man 's only sister]1519-a man 's only sister ! Allowance ! What was Â£ 100 a year to [a woman as rich as [Marianne]171-marianne]1520-a woman as rich as marianne ? And what was the use of Â£ 100 a year to [him]3155-a man , with living at the price it was now ? [His]3155-a man wretched pittance besides , doled out to [him]3155-a man by [[[his]3155-a man father]984-his father 's trustees]1522-his father 's trustees under [[his]3155-a man father]984-his father 's will , brought [his]3155-a man whole income up to Â£ 300 a year . How was [a man to live on that]1524-a man to live on that , and support [a woman]3156-a woman and [child]1526-child ?

And here was [Rachel]129-rachel -- free -- bursting with health -- and possessed of " lots of money . "[129-rachel] [She]129-rachel thought , no doubt , that [she]129-rachel had done with [him]3155-a man -- thrust [him]3155-a man out of [her]129-rachel life altogether . [He]3155-a man 'd let [her]129-rachel see ! Whose fault was it that [he]3155-a man had taken up with [Anita]186-anita ? Nagging , impossible creature!--with [her]186-anita fine ladyisms and [her]186-anita tempers , and [her]186-anita insolent superior ways !

[He]3155-a man walked on , consumed with a bitterness which held [him]3155-a man like a physical anguish . By now [he]3155-a man had reached [the farm]345-the farm gate . The sunset had cleared and deepened . Great rosy thunder - clouds topped the down , and strong lights were climbing up the bronzed masses of wood behind [the house]337-the house . [No one]570-no one to be seen . At [Millsborough]43-millsborough [they]1530-they could hardly be out of [church]3267-church yet . [He]3155-a man had time before [him]3155-a man . [Delane]179-delane could hear the movements of [the labourer]465-the labourer , and the munching of the cows . [Delane]179-delane peered into [the stable]488-the stable with the eye of [one to whom all farming matters were familiar]1542-one to whom all farming matters were familiar . Three fine horses -- d --- d fine horses!--must have cost Â£ 100 a piece at least . No doubt the cows were equally good stuff . And [he]3155-a man had noticed under [the outer cart]1543-the outer cart - shed a brand - new reaper and binder , and other farm implements and machines of the best quality . [Rachel]129-rachel was doing the thing in style .

But where was [the farm - house]675-the farm - house ? Then as [he]3155-a man crept round the third side of [the rough quadrangle]1545-the rough quadrangle , [he]3155-a man became aware of a large window with white curtains . Looking through [it]1546-it with [his]3155-a man face against the glass , [he]3155-a man was startled to find that [he]3155-a man was looking straight into [the farm - yard]430-the farm - yard through another window of equal size on the other side of [the room]431-the room . And at the moment [Halsey]114-halsey came out of [the cow - shed]1549-the cow - shed carrying a pail of milk in either hand . [Delane]179-delane drew hastily back into the shelter of an old holly that grew against the wall , till [the old man]292-the old man had disappeared . Then [he]3155-a man eagerly examined [the room]431-the room , which was still suffused by the sunset . Its prettiness and comfort were so many fresh exasperations . [He]3155-a man contrasted it inwardly with [the wretched lodging from which [he]3155-a man had just come]1552-the wretched lodging from which he had just come . Why , [he]3155-a man knew the photographs on the walls -- [[her]1553-her father]735-her father , [the old parson]1555-the old parson , and [[her]1553-her puritanical mother]1556-her puritanical mother , whom [Rachel]129-rachel had always thrown in [his]3155-a man teeth . [[Her]1553-her eldest brother]1557-her eldest brother , too , who had been drowned at [sea]1558-sea . And that engraving -- that sentimental thing by [Watts]187-watts , " Love and Death , "[187-watts] that [Rachel]129-rachel had bought once on a visit to [Toronto]38-toronto , and [he]3155-a man had scolded [her]129-rachel for buying . There it was , as large as life . How did it come there ? Was it [[her]1553-her property]1559-her property or [his]3155-a man ? [He]3155-a man believed [he]3155-a man could claim it , if [he]3155-a man chose . [Gad!--what]188-gad!--what would [she]129-rachel say if [she]129-rachel knew where [he]3155-a man was at that moment , and what [he]3155-a man was doing !

For eighteen months [she]129-rachel had hidden [herself]129-rachel so cleverly that [he]3155-a man had entirely lost sight of [her]129-rachel . When [[her]129-rachel lawyers]1560-her lawyers communicated with [him]3155-a man in the spring [they]1560-her lawyers had been careful to give no address . On the whole [he]3155-a man had believed [her]129-rachel to be still in [Canada]13-canada . [She]129-rachel , on the other hand , unless [she]129-rachel were [a greater fool]1561-a greater fool than [he]3155-a man thought [her]129-rachel , _ must _ have guessed that [he]3155-a man would get back to [England]2-england somehow . Why , [the farm]345-the farm had ended in bankruptcy , and what else was there to do but to come [home]3185-home and dun [[his]3155-a man relations]1564-his relations ! Yet [she]129-rachel had not been afraid to come [home]3185-home [herself]129-rachel , and set up in this conspicuous way . [She]129-rachel supposed , of course , that [she]129-rachel had done with [him]3155-a man for good -- kicked [him]3155-a man off like an old shoe ! The rage in [his]3155-a man blood set [his]3155-a man heart beating to suffocation . Then [his]3155-a man cough seized [him]3155-a man again . [He]3155-a man stifled it as best [he]3155-a man could , flattened against the wall , in the shadow of a yew - tree .

The sound , however , was apparently heard , for there were rapid steps across [the farm - yard]430-the farm - yard , and a gate opened . " [Hallo]189-hallo -- who 's there ? "[503-persons] The voice was , no doubt , that of [the labourer]465-the labourer [he]3155-a man had seen . [Delane]179-delane slipped noiselessly along the wall , and to the back of [the stables]417-the stables , till all was quiet again within [the farm]345-the farm .

But outside in [the road]3145-the road there were [persons]503-persons approaching . [He]3155-a man mounted [the hill]369-the hill a little way into the shelter of the trees which covered [the steep face of the down]1573-the steep face of the down , and ran up into [the great woods along [the crest]1575-the crest]1574-the great woods along the crest . Through the gathering dusk [he]3155-a man saw [the large farm - cart]1576-the large farm - cart clattering up [the lane]1516-the lane with several figures in [it]1576-the large farm - cart . [The cart]1254-the cart carried lamps , which sent shafts of light over the stubbles . [A man in uniform]1381-a man in uniform . [The American]1090-the american , no doubt !

[The cart]1254-the cart drew up at [the farm - yard]430-the farm - yard gates , and [the old labourer]1587-the old labourer came to open them . [Everybody]404-everybody dismounted , except [one of [the girls]3326-the girls , who , standing in [the wagon]1259-the wagon]1589-one of the girls , who , standing in the wagon , drove the horses . Then , for a time , [Delane]179-delane could see nothing more . [The farm quadrangle]1028-the farm quadrangle had absorbed [the party]1593-the party . Occasionally a light flashed , or a voice could be heard calling , or laughter came floating up [the hill]369-the hill through an open door or window . But in a little while all was silence .

[Delane]179-delane sat down on a fallen trunk , and watched . All kinds of images were rushing through [his]3155-a man brain -- [wide wheat fields with a blazing sun on the stooks]1595-wide wheat fields with a blazing sun on the stooks -- [a small frame house set nakedly on [the flat prairie]1597-the flat prairie with a bit of untidy garden round [it]1596-a small frame house set nakedly on the flat prairie with a bit of untidy garden round it]1596-a small frame house set nakedly on the flat prairie with a bit of untidy garden round it -- [[its]1596-a small frame house set nakedly on the flat prairie with a bit of untidy garden round it living room]1598-its living room in winter , with a huge fire , and [a woman]3156-a woman moving about -- [the creek]1600-the creek behind [it]1596-a small frame house set nakedly on the flat prairie with a bit of untidy garden round it , and [himself]179-delane taking horses down to [water]1601-water . They were images of something that had once meant happiness and hope -- a temporary break or interlude in a dismal tale which had closed upon it before and after .

Darkness came down . [The man on]1602-the man on [the hill]369-the hill said to [himself]1602-the man on , " Now [they]3560-they are having supper , "[1602-the man on] and [he]1602-the man on crept down again to [the farm]345-the farm , and crouching and wriggling along [he]1602-the man on made [his]1602-the man on way again to the big window , over which the curtains had been drawn . There was [no one]570-no one in [the sitting - room]447-the sitting - room , however , to judge from the silence , but from [the kitchen]3239-the kitchen across [the passage]1608-the passage came a rush of voices , together with a clatter of plates . [The kitchen]3239-the kitchen looked out on the front of [the farm]345-the farm , and a wooden shutter had been fastened across the window . But the wood of the shutter was old and full of chinks , and [Delane]179-delane , pressing [his]1602-the man on face to the window , was able to get just a glimpse of the scene within -- [Rachel]129-rachel at the head of the table , [the man in uniform beside [her]129-rachel]1611-the man in uniform beside her -- [three other women]1612-three other women . A paraffin lamp threw the shadow of [the persons at the table]1613-the persons at the table sharply on the white distempered wall . There were flowers on the table , and the meal wore a home - like and tempting air to [the crouching spy outside]1614-the crouching spy outside . [Rachel]129-rachel smiled incessantly , and it seemed to [Delane]179-delane that [the handsome man beside [her]129-rachel]1615-the handsome man beside her could not take [his]1602-the man on eyes from [her]129-rachel . Nor could [Delane]179-delane . [Her]129-rachel brown head and white throat , [her]129-rachel soft , rose - tinted face emerging from the black dress , were youth itself -- a vision of youth and lusty - hood brilliantly painted on the white wall .

[Delane]179-delane looked [his]1602-the man on fill . Then [he]1602-the man on dropped down the bank on which [the farm]345-the farm stood , and avoiding [the open track through [the fields]3144-the fields]1617-the open track through the fields , [he]1602-the man on skirted a hedge which led down to [the road]3145-the road , and was lost in the shadows of advancing night .

VI

Rain!--how it pelted [the September fields]1620-the september fields day after day and week after week , as though to remind [a world still steeped in , still drunk with the most wonderful of harvests , that [the gods]1622-the gods had not yet forgotten [their]1622-the gods old jealousy of [men]3205-men]1621-a world still steeped in , still drunk with the most wonderful of harvests , that the gods had not yet forgotten their old jealousy of men , and [men]3205-men 's prosperity . Whenever a fine day came the early ploughing and seeding was in full swing , and [Rachel]129-rachel on one side of [the largest field]1625-the largest field could watch the drill at work , and on the other the harrow which covered in the seed . In [the next field]1626-the next field , perhaps , [she]129-rachel would find [Betty]141-betty and [Jenny]131-janet lifting potatoes , and would go to help with them , digging and sorting , till every limb ached and [she]129-rachel seemed to be a part [herself]129-rachel of the damp brown earth that [she]129-rachel was robbing of its treasure . For a time when the harvest was done , when the ricks were thatched ready for threshing , there had been a moment of ease . But with the coming of October , the pressure began again . The thought of the coming frost and of all those greedy mouths of cattle , sheep , and horses to be filled through the winter , drove and hunted [the workers on [Great End Farm]3152-great end farm]1627-the workers on great end farm , as [they]1627-the workers on great end farm have driven and hunted [the children of earth]1629-the children of earth since tilling and stock - keeping began . Under the hedges near [the house]337-the house , [the long potato caves]1631-the long potato caves had been filled and covered in ; the sheep were in the turnips , and every two or three days , often under torrents of rain , [Rachel]129-rachel and [the two girls]729-the two girls must change the hurdles , and put the hungry , pushing creatures on to fresh ground . On the top of the down , there was fern to be cut and carted for the winter fodder , and fallen wood to be gathered for fuel , under the daily threats of the coal - controller .

[Rachel]129-rachel worked hard and long . How [she]129-rachel loved the life that once under other skies and other conditions [she]129-rachel had loathed ! Ownership and command had given [her]129-rachel a new dignity , in a sense a new beauty . [[Her]129-rachel labourers]1633-her labourers and [[her]129-rachel land girls]1634-her land girls admired and obeyed [her]129-rachel , while -- [perhaps!--Janet Leighton]131-janet had [their]1635-their hearts . [Rachel]129-rachel 's real self seemed to be something that [no one]570-no one knew ; [[her]129-rachel companions]1117-her companions were never quite at ease with [her]129-rachel ; and yet [her]129-rachel gay , careless ways , the humanity and natural fairness of [her]129-rachel mind , carried a spell that made [her]129-rachel rule sit light upon [them]1635-their .

Yes!--after all these weeks together , not even [Janet]131-janet knew [her]129-rachel much better . The sense of mystery remained ; although the progress of the relation between [her]129-rachel and [Ellesborough]149-ellesborough was becoming very evident , not only indeed to [Janet]131-janet , but to [everybody at [the farm]345-the farm]1638-everybody at the farm . [His]149-ellesborough departure for [France]27-france had been delayed owing to the death in action of [the officer who was to have been sent [home]3185-home to replace [him]149-ellesborough]1640-the officer who was to have been sent home to replace him . It might be a month now before [he]149-ellesborough left . Meanwhile , every Sunday [he]149-ellesborough spent some hours at [the farm]345-the farm , and generally on a couple of evenings in the week [he]149-ellesborough would arrive just after supper , help to put the animals to bed , and then stay talking with [Rachel]129-rachel in [the sitting - room]447-the sitting - room , while [Janet]131-janet tidied up in [the kitchen]3239-the kitchen . [Janet]131-janet , the warm - hearted , had become much attached to [him]149-ellesborough . [He]149-ellesborough had been at no pains to hide the state of [his]149-ellesborough feelings from [her]131-janet . Indeed , though [he]149-ellesborough had said nothing explicit , [his]149-ellesborough whole attitude to [[Rachel]129-rachel 's friend]1645-rachel 's friend and [partner]1646-partner was now one of tacit appeal for sympathy . And [she]131-janet was more than ready to give it . [Her]131-janet uprightness , and the touch of austerity in [her]131-janet , reached out to similar qualities in [him]149-ellesborough ; and the intellectual dissent which [she]131-janet derived from [[her]131-janet East Anglican forbears]1647-her east anglican forbears , from the circles which in eighteenth - century [Norwich]52-norwich gathered round [Mrs. Opie]190-mrs. opie , [the Martineaus]191-the martineaus , and [the Aldersons]192-the aldersons , took kindly to the same forces in [him]149-ellesborough ; forces descended from that New England Puritanism which produced [half [the great men]1649-the great men -- and [women]3203-women -- of an earlier [America]33-america]1648-half the great men -- and women -- of an earlier america . [Rachel]129-rachel laughed at [them]1651-they for ' talking theology , ' not suspecting that as the weeks went on [they]1651-they talked -- whenever [they]1651-they got a chance -- less and less of theology , and more and more of [herself]131-janet , through the many ingenious approaches that [a lover]1652-a lover invents and [the amused and sympathetic friend]1653-the amused and sympathetic friend abets .

For clearly [Ellesborough]149-ellesborough was in love . [Janet]131-janet read the signs of it in the ease with which [he]149-ellesborough had accepted the postponement of [his]149-ellesborough release from [the camp]3224-the camp , eager as [he]149-ellesborough was to get to the fighting line . [She]131-janet heard it in [his]149-ellesborough voice , saw it in [his]149-ellesborough eyes ; and [she]131-janet was well aware that [Rachel]129-rachel saw it . What [Rachel]129-rachel thought and felt was more obscure . [She]131-janet watched for [Ellesborough]149-ellesborough ; [she]131-janet put on [her]131-janet best frocks for [him]149-ellesborough ; [she]131-janet was delighted to laugh and talk with [him]149-ellesborough . But [she]131-janet watched for [Mr. Shenstone]137-mr. shenstone , too , and would say something caustic or impatient if [he]149-ellesborough were two or three days without calling . And when [he]149-ellesborough called , [Rachel]129-rachel very seldom snubbed [him]149-ellesborough , as at first . [She]129-rachel was all smiles ; the best frocks came out for [him]149-ellesborough , too ; and [Janet]131-janet , seeing the growing beatitude of [the poor vicar]1655-the poor vicar , and the growing nervousness of [[his]149-ellesborough sister]1186-his sister , was often inclined to be really angry with [Rachel]129-rachel . But [they]1657-they were not yet on such terms as would allow [her]131-janet to remonstrate with what seemed to [her]131-janet a rather unkind bit of flirtation ; seeing that [she]131-janet did not believe that [Rachel]129-rachel had , or ever would have , a serious thought to give [the shallow , kindly little man]1658-the shallow , kindly little man .

But though [she]131-janet held [her]131-janet tongue , [Janet]131-janet showed [her]131-janet feeling sometimes by a tone , or a lifted eyebrow , and then [Rachel]129-rachel would look at [her]131-janet askance , turning [the vicar]3228-the vicar 's head none the less on the next occasion . The progress of the affair with [Ellesborough]149-ellesborough made on [Janet]131-janet a curious and rather sinister impression , which [she]131-janet could hardly explain to [herself]131-janet . [She]131-janet seemed to see that [Ellesborough]149-ellesborough 's suit steadily advanced ; that [Rachel]129-rachel made no real attempt to resist [his]149-ellesborough power over [her]129-rachel . [Rachel]129-rachel seemed to take [her]129-rachel increasing subjection hardly , to be fighting obscurely against it all the time , as though [she]129-rachel were hampered by thought and motives unknown to [the other two]1661-the other two .
