" It all began to happen three years ago , "[1719-her] [she]1719-her said hurriedly , hiding [her]1719-her face from [him]1722-he with [her]1719-her hand while [she]1719-her hung over the fire . " [I]1735-i was living with [[my]1735-i brother]3372-my brother , who was then near [Winnipeg]55-winnipeg . [He]3372-my brother offered [me]1735-i a home after [[my]1735-i father]3612-my father died . But [he]3372-my brother was married , and [I]1735-i did n't get on with [[his]3372-my brother wife]466-his wife . [I]1735-i dare say it was [my]1735-i fault , but [I]1735-i was n't happy , and [I]1735-i wanted to get away . Then [a man]3155-a man -- [an Englishman]3615-an englishman -- bought the next section to [us]3616-we , and [we]3616-we began to know [him]3155-a man . [He]3155-a man was [a gentleman]3617-a gentleman -- [he'd]3155-a man been to [Cambridge]17-cambridge -- [[his]3155-a man father]984-his father had [some land]3619-some land and [a house]3620-a house in [Lincolnshire]56-lincolnshire . But [he]3155-a man was [the third son]3621-the third son , and [he]3155-a man 'd been taught land agency , [he]3155-a man said , as a training for [the colonies]3622-the colonies . That was all [we]3616-we knew . [He]3155-a man was very good - looking , and [he]3155-a man began courting [me]1735-i . [I]1735-i suppose [I]1735-i was proud of [his]3155-a man being [a University man]3623-a university man -- [a public school boy]3624-a public school boy , and all that . [He]3155-a man told [me]1735-i a lot of stories about [[his]3155-a man people]1196-his people , and [his]3155-a man money -- most of which were lies . But [I]1735-i was [a fool]3626-a fool -- and [I]1735-i believed [them]3627-them . [[My]1735-i brother]3372-my brother tried to stop it . Well , [you]1735-i know from [his]3155-a man letters what sort of [man]3629-man [he]3155-a man is , "[1735-i] and again [she]1735-i brushed the sudden tears away . " But [[his]3155-a man wife]466-his wife made mischief , and [I]1735-i was set on having [a place of [my]1735-i own]3631-a place of my own . So [I]1735-i stuck to it -- and married [him]3155-a man . "[1735-i]

[She]1735-i rose abruptly from [her]1735-i seat and began to move restlessly about [the room]431-the room , taking up a book or [her]1735-i knitting from the table , and putting them down again , evidently unconscious of what [she]1735-i was doing . [Ellesborough]149-ellesborough waited . [His]149-ellesborough lean , sharply - cut face revealed a miserable , perhaps an agonized suspense . This crisis into which [she]1735-i had plunged [him]149-ellesborough so suddenly was bringing home to [him]149-ellesborough all that [he]149-ellesborough had at stake . That [she]1735-i mattered to [him]149-ellesborough so vitally [he]149-ellesborough had never known till this moment .

" What 's the good of going into it ! "[1735-i] [she]1735-i said at last desperately . " [You]149-ellesborough can guess -- what it means"--a[1735-i] sudden crimson rushed to [her]1735-i cheeks--"to be tied to [a man]3155-a man -- without honour -- or principle -- or refinement -- who presently seemed to [me]1735-i vile all through -- in what [he]3155-a man said -- or what [he]3155-a man did . And [I]1735-i was at [his]3155-a man mercy . [I]1735-i had married [him]3155-a man in such a hurry [he]3155-a man had a right to despise [me]1735-i , and [he]3155-a man used it ! And when [I]1735-i resisted and turned against [him]3155-a man , then [I]1735-i found out what [his]3155-a man temper meant . "[1735-i] [She]1735-i raised [her]1735-i shoulders with a gesture which needed no words . " Well -- [we]3633-we got on somehow till [[my]1735-i little girl]3634-my little girl was born-- "[1735-i]

[Ellesborough]149-ellesborough started . [Rachel]129-rachel turned on [him]149-ellesborough [her]129-rachel sad , swimming eyes . But the mere mention of [[her]129-rachel child]1737-her child had given [her]129-rachel back [her]129-rachel dignity and strength to go on . [She]129-rachel became visibly more composed , as [she]129-rachel stood opposite to [him]149-ellesborough , [her]129-rachel beautiful dark head against the sunset clouds outside .

" [She]1735-i only lived a few weeks . [Her]1735-i death was largely owing to [him]3155-a man . But that 's a long story . And after [her]1735-i death [I]129-rachel could n't stand it any more . [I]129-rachel ran away . And soon [I]129-rachel heard that [he]3155-a man had taken up with [an Italian girl]3635-an italian girl . [I]129-rachel got [my]129-rachel divorce eighteen months ago . The decree was made absolute last February . So , of course , [I]129-rachel 'm quite free -- quite--_quite _ free ! "[129-rachel]

[She]1738-i spoke the last words almost savagely , and after them [she]1738-i moved away to the window looking on the down , and stood gazing through it , as though [she]1738-i had forgotten [Ellesborough]149-ellesborough 's presence .

" The action was not defended ? "[149-ellesborough] [he]149-ellesborough asked , in a low voice .

[She]1738-i shook [her]1738-i head without speaking . But after a minute [she]1738-i added,--

" [I]1738-i can show [you]149-ellesborough the report . "[1738-i]

There was silence . [Ellesborough]149-ellesborough turned round , put [his]149-ellesborough hands on the mantelpiece , and buried [his]149-ellesborough face on them . Presently [she]1738-i approached [him]149-ellesborough , looked at [him]149-ellesborough with a quivering lip , and said in broken sentences,--

" It has all come so suddenly -- hasn't it ? [I]1738-i had been in such good spirits to - day , not thinking of those horrible things at all . [I]1738-i do n't know what [I]1738-i meant to do , if [you]149-ellesborough did ask [me]1738-i -- for of course [I]1738-i knew [you]149-ellesborough _ might _ . [I]1738-i suppose [I]1738-i intended to put off telling [you]149-ellesborough -- so as to be sure first--_certain_--that [you]149-ellesborough loved [me]1738-i . And then -- somehow -- when [you]149-ellesborough looked down on [me]1738-i like that , [I]1738-i felt -- that _ [I]1738-i _ cared -- much more than [I]1738-i had thought [I]1738-i cared -- too much to let [you]149-ellesborough speak -- before [you]149-ellesborough knew -- before [I]1738-i 'd told [you]149-ellesborough . It 's always been [my]1738-i way -- to -- put off disagreeable things . And so [I]1738-i thought [I]1738-i could put this off . But every night [I]1738-i have been awake thinking--'if only [he]1740-he knew!'--and [I]1738-i was wretched -- for a while -- because [you]149-ellesborough did n't know . But then it went away again -- and [I]1738-i forgot it . [One]279-one does forget things -- everything -- when [one]279-one is hard at work . But [I]1738-i 'm awfully sorry . And now -- [I]1738-i think -- we'd better say good - bye . "[1738-i]

[Her]1739-i voice faltered against [her]1739-i will . [He]1740-he raised [himself]1740-he quickly .

" No -- no , "[1740-he] [he]1740-he said passionately , " [we]3645-we wo n't say good - bye . But [you]1739-i must let [me]1740-he think -- for [you]1739-i , as well as for [myself]1740-he . "[1740-he]

" It would be better to say good - bye , "[1739-i] [she]1739-i persisted . " [I]1739-i 'm afraid -- [you]149-ellesborough expect in [me]1739-i -- what [I]1739-i have n't got . [I]1739-i see that now . Because [I]1739-i 'm keen about this work , and [I]1739-i can run [this farm]356-this farm , [you]149-ellesborough think -- perhaps -- [I'm]1739-i a strong character . But [I]1739-i 'm not . [I]1739-i 've no judgment -- not in moral things . [I]1739-i give in -- [I'm]1739-i weak -- and then -- [I]1739-i could kill [myself]1739-i ! "[1739-i]

[She]1739-i had grown very white again -- and [her]1739-i eyes were strangely fixed on [him]1741-he . The words seemed to [him]1741-he incoherent , out of touch somehow even with [their]1742-their tragic conversation . But [his]1741-he first passing bewilderment was lost in pity and passion . [He]1741-he stopped , took [her]1739-i hand , and kissed it . [He]1741-he came nearer .

But again [she]1739-i drew back .

" There 's [Janet]131-janet ! "[1739-i] [she]1739-i said , " [we]1742-their ca n't talk any more . "[1739-i]

For [she]1739-i had caught sight of [Janet]131-janet in [the farm - yard]430-the farm - yard , leading [her]131-janet bicycle .

[She]1739-i frowned a little .

" Is it worth while ? "[1739-i]

" But , of course , [I]131-janet 'll tell [you]1739-i more -- if [you]1739-i wish . "[131-janet]

[Janet]131-janet 's voice and step were heard in [the passage]1608-the passage . How [Ellesborough]149-ellesborough got through the next ten minutes [he]149-ellesborough never remembered . When [they]1745-they were over , [he]149-ellesborough found [himself]149-ellesborough rushing through the cool and silence of the autumn night , thankful for this sheltering nature in which to hide [his]149-ellesborough trouble , [his]149-ellesborough deep , deep distress .

VII

The October night rang stormily round [Great End Farm]3152-great end farm . The northwest wind rushing over the miniature pass just beyond [the farm]345-the farm , where [the road]3145-the road dropped from the level of [the upland in which [Ipscombe]12-ipscombe lay]1749-the upland in which ipscombe lay , to [the level of [the plain]288-the plain]1750-the level of the plain , was blowing fiercely on the square of buildings which stood naked and undefended against weather from [that quarter of [the heaven]1753-the heaven]1752-that quarter of the heaven , while protected by [the hills]3216-the hills and [the woods]485-the woods from the northeast . And mingled with the noisy or wailing gusts came the shrieking from time to time of one of the little brown owls that are now multiplying so fast in [the English midlands]756-the english midlands .

The noise of the storm and the clamour of the owl were not the cause of [Rachel]129-rachel 's wakefulness ; but they tended to make it more feverish and irritable . Every now and then [she]129-rachel would throw off the bed - clothes , and sit up with [her]129-rachel hands round [her]129-rachel knees , a white and rigid figure lit by the solitary candle beside [her]129-rachel . Then again [she]129-rachel would feel the chill of the autumn night , and crouch down shivering among the bed - clothes , pining for a sleep that would not come . Instead of sleep , [she]129-rachel could do nothing but rehearse the scene with [Ellesborough]149-ellesborough again and again . [She]129-rachel watched the alterations in [his]149-ellesborough face -- [she]129-rachel heard the changes in [his]149-ellesborough voice -- as [she]129-rachel told [her]129-rachel story . [She]129-rachel was now as sorry for [him]149-ellesborough as for [herself]129-rachel ! The tears came flooding into [her]129-rachel eyes as [she]129-rachel thought of [him]149-ellesborough . In [her]129-rachel selfish fears of [his]149-ellesborough anger [she]129-rachel had forgotten [his]149-ellesborough suffering . But the first true love of [her]129-rachel life was bringing understanding . [She]129-rachel realized the shock to [him]149-ellesborough , and wept over it . [She]129-rachel saw , too , that [she]129-rachel had been unjust and cowardly in letting the situation go so far without speaking ; and that there was no real excuse for [her]129-rachel .

Would [he]149-ellesborough give [her]129-rachel up ? [She]129-rachel had told [him]149-ellesborough that all was at an end between [them]1757-them ; but that was only pride -- making a virtue of a necessity . Oh , no , no , [he]149-ellesborough must not give [her]129-rachel up ! It was only six weeks since [their]1757-them first meeting , and though it would be untrue to say that since the meeting [he]149-ellesborough had wholly possessed [her]129-rachel thoughts , [she]129-rachel had been capable all through them of that sort of dallying with [the vicar which [Janet]131-janet thought unkind]1758-the vicar which janet thought unkind . [She]129-rachel had been able to find plenty of mind for [her]129-rachel work , and for the ambitions of [her]129-rachel new profession , and had spent many a careless hour steeped in the sheer physical pleasure of the harvest . Yet , from the beginning , [his]149-ellesborough personality had laid its grip on [hers]129-rachel . [She]129-rachel had never been able to forget [him]149-ellesborough for long . One visit from [him]149-ellesborough was no sooner over than [she]129-rachel was calculating on and dreaming of the next . And as the consciousness of some new birth in [her]129-rachel had grown , and sudden glimpses had come to [her]129-rachel of some supreme joy , possibly within [her]129-rachel grasp , so fear had grown , and anxiety . [She]129-rachel looked back upon [her]129-rachel past , and knew it stained -- knew that it must at some point rise as an obstacle between [her]129-rachel and [him]149-ellesborough .

But how great an obstacle ? [She]129-rachel was going to tell [him]149-ellesborough , faithfully , frankly , all the story of [her]129-rachel marriage -- accuse [her]129-rachel own rash self - will in marrying [Delane]179-delane , confess [her]129-rachel own failings as [a wife]1759-a wife ; [she]129-rachel would tell no hypocritical tale . [She]129-rachel would make it plain that [Roger]179-delane had found in [her]129-rachel no mere suffering saint , and that probably [her]129-rachel intolerance and impatience had contributed to send [him]149-ellesborough to damnation . But , after all , when it was told , what could [Ellesborough]149-ellesborough do but pity her?--take [her]129-rachel in [his]149-ellesborough arms -- and comfort [her]129-rachel -- for those awful years -- and [[her]129-rachel lost child]1760-her lost child ?

The tears rained down [her]129-rachel cheeks . [He]149-ellesborough loved [her]129-rachel ! [She]129-rachel was certain of that . When [he]149-ellesborough had once heard the story , [he]149-ellesborough could not forsake [her]129-rachel ! [She]129-rachel already saw the pity in [his]149-ellesborough deep grey eyes ; [she]129-rachel already felt [his]149-ellesborough honest , protecting arms about [her]129-rachel .

Ah--_but then _ ? Beyond that imagined scene , which rose , as though it were staged , before [her]129-rachel , [Rachel]129-rachel 's shrinking eyes , in the windy darkness , seemed to be penetrating to another -- a phantom scene in a dim distance -- drawn not from the future , but the past . [Two figures]1761-two figures moved in it . One was [herself]129-rachel . [The other]283-the other was not [Roger Delane]179-delane .

The brown owl seemed to be shrieking just outside [her]129-rachel window . [Her]129-rachel nerves quivered under the sound as though it were [her]129-rachel own voice . Why was life so cruel , so miserable ? Why can not even [the gods themselves]1763-the gods themselves make undone what is done ? [She]129-rachel was none the worse -- permanently -- for what had happened in that distant scene -- that play within a play ? How was [she]129-rachel the worse ? [She]129-rachel was " not a bad woman!"--as[129-rachel] [she]129-rachel had said so passionately to [Janet]131-janet , when [they]1764-they joined hands . There was no lasting taint left in mind and soul -- nothing to prevent [her]129-rachel being [a pure and faithful wife to [George Ellesborough]198-ellesborough]1765-a pure and faithful wife to george ellesborough , and [a good mother to [[his]198-ellesborough children]1728-his children]1766-a good mother to his children . It was [another Rachel to whom all that had happened]1768-another rachel to whom all that had happened , [a Rachel [she]129-rachel had a right to forget]1769-a rachel she had a right to forget ! [She]129-rachel was weak in will -- [she]129-rachel had confessed it . But [George Ellesborough]198-ellesborough was strong . Leaning on [him]198-ellesborough , and on [kind Janet]131-janet , [she]129-rachel could be all , [she]129-rachel would be all , that [he]198-ellesborough still dreamed . The past--_that _ past -- was dead . [It]1770-it had no existence . Nothing -- neither honour nor love -- obliged [her]129-rachel to disclose it . Except in [her]129-rachel own mind it was dead and buried -- as though it had never been . [No human being]1771-no human being shared [her]129-rachel knowledge of it , or ever would .

And yet [the Accuser]1772-the accuser came closer and closer , wrestling with [her]129-rachel shrinking heart . " [You]129-rachel ca n't live a lie beside [him]198-ellesborough all [your]129-rachel life ! "[1772-the accuser] " It wo n't be a lie . All that matters to [him]198-ellesborough is what [I]1772-the accuser am now -- not what [I]1772-the accuser was . And it was n't [I!--it]1772-the accuser was [another woman]3651-another woman -- a miserable , battered creature who could n't help [herself]3651-another woman . "[1772-the accuser] " It will rise up between [you]129-rachel , and perhaps -- after all -- in some way -- [he]198-ellesborough will discover it . "[1772-the accuser] " How can [he]198-ellesborough ? [Dick]199-dick and [I]1772-the accuser -- who in all [the world]474-the world knew , but [us]3653-us two?--and [Dick]199-dick is dead . "[1772-the accuser] " Are [you]129-rachel sure that [no one]570-no one knew:--that [no one]570-no one saw [you]129-rachel ? Think ! "[1772-the accuser]

A pale face grew paler in the dim light , as thought [hesitated:--]200-hesitated:--

" There was [that wagon]3656-that wagon -- and [the boy]901-the boy -- in the storm . "[1772-the accuser] " Yes -- what then ? "[1772-the accuser] " Well -- what then ? [The boy]901-the boy scarcely saw [me]1772-the accuser . "[1772-the accuser] " [He]198-ellesborough did see [you]129-rachel . "[1772-the accuser] " And if [he]198-ellesborough did -- it is the commonest thing in a [Canadian]21-canadian winter to be caught by a storm , to ask shelter from [a neighbour]3659-a neighbour . "[1772-the accuser] " Still -- even if [he]198-ellesborough drew no malicious conclusion , [he]198-ellesborough saw [you]129-rachel -- alone in [that farm]3660-that farm with [Dick Tanner]201-tanner , and [he]198-ellesborough probably knew [your]129-rachel name . "[1772-the accuser] " How should [he]198-ellesborough know [my]1772-the accuser name ? "[1772-the accuser] " [He]198-ellesborough had seen [you]129-rachel before -- [you]129-rachel had seen [him]198-ellesborough before . "[1772-the accuser] " [I]1772-the accuser did n't know [his]198-ellesborough name -- [I]1772-the accuser do n't know it now . "[1772-the accuser] " No -- but in passing [[your]129-rachel farm]3661-your farm once , [he]198-ellesborough had dropped a parcel for [a neighbour]3659-a neighbour -- and [you]129-rachel had seen [him]198-ellesborough once -- at [a railway station]3663-a railway station . "[1772-the accuser] " Is it the least likely that [I]1772-the accuser shall ever see [him]198-ellesborough again -- or that [he]198-ellesborough remembers seeing [me]1772-the accuser at [Dick Tanner]201-tanner 's door ? "[1772-the accuser] " Not likely , perhaps -- but possible -- quite possible . "[1772-the accuser]

And while this question and answer passed through the brain , [the woman sitting up in bed]1773-the woman sitting up in bed seemed to be transported to a howling wintry scene of whirling snow -- a November twilight -- and against that background , the hood of [a covered wagon]1774-a covered wagon , [a boy holding the reins]1775-a boy holding the reins , the heavy cape on [his]1775-a boy holding the reins shoulders white with snow , the lamps of [the wagon]1259-the wagon shining dimly on [him]1775-a boy holding the reins , and making a kind of luminous mist round [the cart]1254-the cart . [She]1773-the woman sitting up in bed heard [a parley]1778-a parley , saw [a tall and slender man with fair hair]1779-a tall and slender man with fair hair go out to [the boy with hot milk and bread]1780-the boy with hot milk and bread , caught directions as to [the road]3145-the road , and saw [herself]1773-the woman sitting up in bed as a half - hidden figure in the partially open door .

And then afterwards -- [the warm farm kitchen]1782-the warm farm kitchen shutting out the storm -- [a man at [her]1773-the woman sitting up in bed knees]1783-a man at her knees -- [his]1783-a man at her knees arms round [her]1773-the woman sitting up in bed -- [his]1783-a man at her knees kisses on [her]1773-the woman sitting up in bed cheek .

And again the irrevocableness of it closed down upon [her]1773-the woman sitting up in bed . It could _ never _ be undone : that was the terrible commonplace which held [her]1773-the woman sitting up in bed in its grasp . It could never be wiped out from one human mind , which must bear the burden of it as best it could , till gradually -- steadily -- the life , had been killed out of the ugly , haunting thing , and it had been buried -- drowned , out of sight and memory .

But the piteous dialogue began again .

" How _ could _ [I]129-rachel have resisted ? [I]129-rachel was so miserable -- so lonely -- so weak ! "[129-rachel] " [You]129-rachel did n't love [him]1775-a boy holding the reins ! "[129-rachel] " No -- but [I]129-rachel was alone in [the world]474-the world . "[129-rachel] " Well , then , tell [George Ellesborough]198-ellesborough -- [he]198-ellesborough is [a reasonable man]3665-a reasonable man -- [he]198-ellesborough would understand . "[129-rachel] " [I]129-rachel ca n't --I _ ca n't _ ! [I]129-rachel have deceived [him]1775-a boy holding the reins up till now by passing as unmarried . If [I]129-rachel confess this , too , there will be no chance for [me]129-rachel . [He]1775-a boy holding the reins 'll never trust [me]129-rachel in anything!--he'll suspect everything [I]129-rachel do or say -- even if [he]1775-a boy holding the reins goes on loving [me]129-rachel . And [I]129-rachel could n't bear it!--nor could [he]1775-a boy holding the reins . "[129-rachel]

And so at last the inward debate wore itself out , and sleep , sudden and deep , came down upon [Rachel Henderson]129-rachel . When [she]129-rachel woke in the morning it was to cleared skies both in [her]129-rachel own mind and in the physical world . The nightmare through which [she]129-rachel had passed seemed to [her]129-rachel now unreal , even a little absurd . [Her]129-rachel nerves were quieted by sleep , and [she]129-rachel saw plainly what [she]129-rachel had to do . That " old , unhappy , far - off thing "[129-rachel] lurking in the innermost depth of memory had nothing more to do with [her]129-rachel . [She]129-rachel would look it calmly in the face , and put it finally -- for ever -- away . But of [her]129-rachel marriage [she]129-rachel would tell everything -- everything!--to [George Ellesborough]198-ellesborough , and [he]198-ellesborough should deal with [her]129-rachel as [he]198-ellesborough pleased .

* * * * *

The day was misty and still . October , the marvellous October of this year , was marching on . Every day , [Foch]147-foch on [the battlefield of [France]27-france and [Belgium]35-belgium]1784-the battlefield of france and belgium was bringing down [the old Europe]1785-the old europe , and clearing the ground for the new . In [English villages]1786-english villages and [English farms]1787-english farms , no less than in [the big towns]1788-the big towns , there was ferment and excitement , though it showed but little . Would [the boys]1789-the boys be [home]3185-home by Christmas -- [the sons]1791-the sons , [the brothers]1792-the brothers , [the husbands]1793-the husbands ? What would the change be like -- the life after the war ? If there were [those who yearned and prayed for it]1794-those who yearned and prayed for it -- there were [those who feared it]1795-those who feared it . The war had done well for [some]1796-some , and hideously for [others]1797-others . And all through the play of individual interests and desires , and even in the dullest minds there ran the intoxicating sense of Victory , of an [England]2-england greater and more powerful than [even [[her]1799-herself own sons]1800-her own sons and [daughters]1801-daughters had dared to dream]1798-even her own sons and daughters had dared to dream -- [an [England]2-england which knew [herself]1799-herself now , by the stern test of the four years ' struggle , to be possessed of powers and resources , spiritual , mental , physical , which amazed [herself]1799-herself]1802-an england which knew herself now , by the stern test of the four years ' struggle , to be possessed of powers and resources , spiritual , mental , physical , which amazed herself . In [all conscious minds]1803-all conscious minds , brooding on the approaching time , there rose the question : " What are [we]3666-we going to do with it ? "[131-janet] and even in the unconscious , the same thought was present , as a vague disturbing impulse .

[Janet]131-janet had just read the war telegrams to [Rachel]129-rachel , who had come down late , complaining of a headache ; but when [Janet]131-janet -- [the reserved and equable Janet]1804-the reserved and equable janet -- after going through the news of the recapture of [Ostend]58-ostend , [Zeebrugge]59-zeebrugge , and [Bruges]60-bruges , broke into the passionate , low - spoken comment : " [The Lord]3667-the lord is [King]3668-king -- be [the people]3669-the people never so unquiet ! "[131-janet] or could not , for tears , finish the account of the entry into recaptured [Lille]61-lille , and the joy of [[its]61-lille inhabitants]1805-its inhabitants , [Rachel]129-rachel sat irresponsive -- or apparently so .

How would it affect [Ellesborough]198-ellesborough -- this astounding news ? Would it take [him]198-ellesborough from [her]129-rachel the sooner , or delay [his]198-ellesborough going ? That was all [she]129-rachel seemed capable of feeling .

[Janet]131-janet was troubled by [her]131-janet look and attitude , and being well aware that [the two]1806-the two had had a long _ tÃªte- -tÃªte _ the day before , wondered how things were going . But [she]131-janet said nothing ; and after breakfast [Rachel]129-rachel joined [the two girls]729-the two girls in [the potato - field]1808-the potato - field , and worked as hard as [they]729-the two girls , hour after hour . But [her]129-rachel usual gaiety was gone , and [the girls]3326-the girls noticed at once the dark rims under [her]129-rachel eyes . [They]3326-the girls wondered secretly what [[Miss Henderson]127-miss henderson 's " friend]3670-miss henderson 's " friend "[127-miss henderson] had been doing . For that [the " Cap'n]3671-the " cap'n "[3671-the " cap'n] was courting [[their]729-the two girls employer]1810-their employer had long been plain to [them]729-the two girls . [Betty]141-betty , of course , had [a " friend]3672-a " friend , "[1811-the young soldier whose sick leave was nearly up] [the young soldier whose sick leave was nearly up]1811-the young soldier whose sick leave was nearly up , and [the child]662-the child 's deep velvety eyes were looking nearly as tired as [Miss Henderson]127-miss henderson 's . Then [she]131-janet had seen [him]1813-a young fellow belonging to ellesborough 's forestry camp whom she had met in millsborough the day of the harvest festival in [the village]304-the village once or twice . [He]1813-a young fellow belonging to ellesborough 's forestry camp whom she had met in millsborough the day of the harvest festival had some relations [there]377-there -- there was some talk of [him]1813-a young fellow belonging to ellesborough 's forestry camp whom she had met in millsborough the day of the harvest festival , and that old murder at [the farm]345-the farm -- [she]131-janet did n't know rightly what it was . But [her]131-janet raw , childish mind was full of [him]1813-a young fellow belonging to ellesborough 's forestry camp whom she had met in millsborough the day of the harvest festival , and the ferments of sex were stirring . In the secret opinion of [both girls]1820-both girls , " [friends]3434-friends "[1822-them] were quite as much pain as pleasure . [No girl]1821-no girl could do without [them]1822-them ; but [they]1822-them were pretty certain to cause heart - aches , to make [a girl]670-a girl wish at some time or other that [she]670-a girl had never been born . [A London factory - girl]1824-a london factory - girl would have expressed it in the Cockney way : " [Blokes]3674-blokes are no good -- but [you]3675-you must have [a bloke]3676-a bloke ! "[1824-a london factory - girl]

[The two girls]729-the two girls then concluded that [Captain Ellesborough]149-ellesborough had been causing trouble , as [all men]1826-all men did , at some point ; and being [sympathetic little souls]1827-sympathetic little souls , [they]729-the two girls worked especially hard in the potato - field , and would not allow [Rachel]129-rachel to carry the heavier baskets to the " clamp . "[729-the two girls]

Meanwhile [Janet]131-janet had been wrestling with [old Halsey]114-halsey , till [he]114-halsey had very reluctantly yielded to [her]131-janet persuasion , and returned to work .

" [I]114-halsey 'm not [the man [I]114-halsey wor]3677-the man i wor , "[114-halsey] [he]114-halsey confided to [Peter Betts]182-betts , as [they]729-the two girls were eating [their]729-the two girls dinner under a hedge in the damp October sunshine . " What do ? "[182-betts] said [Peter Betts]182-betts , with a mouthful of cold bacon . [He]182-betts was still greatly in the dark as to why [Halsey]114-halsey had left work so early in the afternoon the day before , and why [he]114-halsey was now in such a gruff and gloomy mood . " Why -- ghostisses ! "[114-halsey] said [Halsey]114-halsey , with a frown , removing [his]114-halsey pipe for a moment to give emphasis to the word . "[114-halsey]

" What did [yer]182-betts see ? "[182-betts] said [Betts]182-betts , after a few ruminating pulls .

" Well , [I]114-halsey saw [old Watson]202-old watson , [the keeper]3685-the keeper , as was murdered sixty years since , ' at 's what [I]114-halsey saw , "[114-halsey] said [Halsey]114-halsey with slow decisiveness .

" An ' what might be like ? "[182-betts] asked [Betts]182-betts , with equal deliberation . The day was mild and sunny ; [the half - ploughed field on which [they]1830-they had been working]1829-the half - ploughed field on which they had been working lay alternatively yellow in the stubbles and a rich brown purple in the new turned furrows under the autumn noon . A sense of well - being had been diffused in [the two old men]299-the two old men by food and rest . [Halsey]114-halsey 's tongue grew looser .

" Well , [I]202-old watson saw [a man]3155-a man come creepin ' an ' crouchin ' down [yon]3687-yon grass road"--(it[202-old watson] was visible from where [they]1830-they sat , as a green streak on the side of the hill)--'same as [several people]1832-several people afore [me]0-i ' as seen ' um -- same as [they]1832-several people allus say [old Watson]202-old watson must ha ' come after [Dempsey]194-dempsey shot ' [i]0-i m. An ' if [ye're]1834-yo shot in the body , [I]0-i understan ' , [yo]1834-yo naterally double up a bit if [yo]1834-yo try to walk . An ' [I]0-i wor much puzzled by the look on ' [i]0-i m. [I]0-i did n't think nothink about [old Watson]202-old watson , fust of all -- [I]0-i did n't know what to think . [Halsey]114-halsey looked round suddenly on [[his]114-halsey companion]287-his companion as though daring [him]287-his companion to mock .

" [Ghostisses]3688-ghostisses do n't cough , as ever [I]182-betts ' eered on . "[182-betts]

" Never ' eered on it , "[182-betts] [he]182-betts said , with conviction .

" Well , anyways [I]292-the old man seed [him]287-his companion come down to [that shed]3689-that shed , an ' then [I]292-the old man lost ' [i]292-the old man m. " Well ? "[182-betts] said [Betts]182-betts eagerly , [his]182-betts philosophic attitude giving way a little .

[Betts]182-betts whistled softly . [Halsey]114-halsey resumed,--

"[1847-old man]

" [You]114-halsey might as well tell [John Dempsey]194-dempsey . Why , it 's [his]194-dempsey business , is [old Watson]202-old watson ! Have n't [yer]182-betts seen ' [i]182-betts m at all ? "[182-betts]

[Halsey]114-halsey said " No , "[114-halsey] holding [his]114-halsey handsome old head rather high . Had [he]114-halsey belonged to a higher station in life , [his]114-halsey natural reticence , and a fastidious personal dignity would have carried [him]114-halsey far . To [a modern statesman]1853-a modern statesman [they]1854-they are at least as valuable as brains . In [the small world of [Ipscombe]12-ipscombe]1855-the small world of ipscombe [they]1854-they only meant that [Halsey]114-halsey [himself]114-halsey held rather scornfully aloof from [the current village gossip]1856-the current village gossip , and got mocked at for [his]114-halsey pains . The ordinary human instinct revenged itself , however , when [he]114-halsey was _ tÃªte- -tÃªte _ with [his]114-halsey old chum [Peter Betts]182-betts . [Betts]182-betts divined at any rate from the expression in [the old man]292-the old man 's eyes that _ [he]114-halsey _ might talk , and welcome .

So [he]114-halsey poured out what [he]114-halsey knew about [John Dempsey]194-dempsey , [a Canadian lad working in the Forestry Corps at [Ralstone]20-ralstone , who turned out to be the grandson of [the Dempsey who had always been suspected of the murder of [Richard Watson]202-old watson in the year 1859]1859-the dempsey who had always been suspected of the murder of richard watson in the year 1859]1858-a canadian lad working in the forestry corps at ralstone , who turned out to be the grandson of the dempsey who had always been suspected of the murder of richard watson in the year 1859 . [This young Dempsey]1860-this young dempsey , [he]114-halsey said , had meant to come to [Ipscombe]12-ipscombe after the war , and put what [he]1860-this young dempsey knew before [the police]1861-the police . But finding [himself]1860-this young dempsey sent to [Ralstone]20-ralstone , which was only five miles from [Ipscombe]12-ipscombe , [he]1860-this young dempsey saw no reason to wait , and [he]1860-this young dempsey had already given all the information [he]1860-this young dempsey could to [the superintendent of police at [Millsborough]43-millsborough]1862-the superintendent of police at millsborough . [[His]1860-this young dempsey grandfather]3590-his grandfather had signed a written confession before [his]3590-his grandfather death , and [John Dempsey]194-dempsey had handed it over . [The old man]292-the old man , it appeared , had " turned pious "[292-the old man] during a long illness before [his]292-the old man death , and had wished to square matters with [his]292-the old man conscience and [the Almighty]1865-the almighty . When [[his]292-the old man grandson]1866-his grandson had volunteered for the war , and was about to sail for [Europe]46-europe , [old Dempsey]194-dempsey had sent for [him]3590-his grandfather , had told [him]3590-his grandfather the story , and charged [him]3590-his grandfather , when [he]3590-his grandfather was able , to place [his]3590-his grandfather confession in the proper hands . And having done that , [he]292-the old man died " very quiet and comfortable"--so[194-dempsey] [John Dempsey]194-dempsey reported .

" Which is more than poor [Jem Watson]204-watson did , "[114-halsey] growled [Halsey]114-halsey . [He]114-halsey felt neither respect nor sympathy for [a man who , having set up a secret , could n't keep it]1867-a man who , having set up a secret , could n't keep it ; and the confession itself , rather than the crime confessed , confirmed the poor opinion [he]114-halsey had always held of [the elder Dempsey]1868-the elder dempsey when [they]1869-they were [young men in [the village]304-the village together]1870-young men in the village together . But [he]114-halsey agreed to let [Betts]182-betts bring " [young John]194-dempsey "[114-halsey] to see [him]114-halsey . And thereupon [they]1869-they went back to the sowing of one of [[Miss Henderson]127-miss henderson 's big fields]1872-miss henderson 's big fields with winter wheat .

When the milking was done , and work was nearly over for the day , a note brought by [messenger]1873-messenger arrived at [the farm]345-the farm for [Miss Henderson]127-miss henderson . It was from [Ellesborough]149-ellesborough -- a few scribbled words . " [I]129-rachel am prevented from coming this evening . [The Chief Forestry Officer of [[my]129-rachel district]3717-my district]3716-the chief forestry officer of my district has just arrived , and stays the night . [I]129-rachel hope to come over to - morrow between six and seven . Shall [I]129-rachel find [you]131-janet ? "[129-rachel]

[Rachel]129-rachel scribbled an answer , which [a small boy]1875-a small boy on [a bicycle]1876-a bicycle carried off . Then [she]129-rachel went slowly back to [the sitting - room]447-the sitting - room , so disappointed and unnerved that [she]129-rachel was on the brink of tears . [Janet]131-janet who had just come in from milking , was standing by the table , mending a rent in [her]131-janet waterproof . [She]131-janet looked up as [Rachel]129-rachel entered , and the needle paused in [her]131-janet hand .

" [I]131-janet say , [Rachel!--you]205-rachel!--you do look overdone ! [You]205-rachel!--you 've been going at it too hard . "[131-janet]

For all day long [Rachel]129-rachel had been lifting , and sorting , and carrying , in the potato - field , finding in the severe physical exertion the only relief from restlessness . [She]129-rachel shook [her]129-rachel head irritably and came to stand by the wood fire which [Janet]131-janet had just lit , a welcome brightness in [the twilight room]1878-the twilight room .

" Suppose [you]205-rachel!--you knock up-- "[131-janet] began [Janet]131-janet in a tone of remonstrance . [Rachel]129-rachel cut [her]131-janet short .

" [I]129-rachel want to speak to [you]131-janet -- please , [Janet]131-janet . "[129-rachel]

[Janet]131-janet looked round in astonishment and put down [her]131-janet work . [Rachel]129-rachel was standing by the fire , with [her]129-rachel hands behind [her]129-rachel back , [her]129-rachel eyes fixed on [Janet]131-janet . [She]131-janet was still in the graceful tunic and knee - breeches , in which [her]131-janet young and splendid youth seemed always most at [home]3185-home . But [she]131-janet had taken off [her]131-janet cap , and [her]131-janet brown hair was falling round a pale face .

" [Janet]131-janet -- [you]131-janet know [Captain Ellesborough]149-ellesborough and [I]131-janet had a long talk last night ? "[131-janet]

[Janet]131-janet smiled .

" Of course [I]131-janet do . And of course [I]131-janet have [my]131-janet own thoughts about it ! "[131-janet]

" [I]129-rachel do n't know what they are , "[129-rachel] said [Rachel]129-rachel slowly . " But -- [I'd]129-rachel better tell [you]131-janet -- [Captain Ellesborough]149-ellesborough asked [me]129-rachel to marry [him]149-ellesborough . "[129-rachel]

[She]129-rachel paused .

" Did [you]131-janet think that would be news to [any of [us]3719-us]3718-any of us ? "[131-janet] said [Janet]131-janet , laughing , and then stopped . The sudden contraction of pain in [Rachel]129-rachel 's face , and something like a sob startled [her]131-janet .

" Do n't , [Janet]131-janet , please . [I]129-rachel told [him]149-ellesborough something -- which made [him]149-ellesborough wonder -- whether [he]149-ellesborough did want to marry [me]129-rachel after all . "[129-rachel]

[Janet]131-janet 's heart gave an uncomfortable jump . A score of past conjectures and misgivings rushed back upon [her]131-janet .

" What did [you]131-janet tell [him]149-ellesborough ? "[131-janet]

" What [I]131-janet see now [I]131-janet ought to have told [you]131-janet -- as well as [him]149-ellesborough -- long ago . [Henderson]129-rachel is [my]131-janet maiden name . [I]131-janet was [a married woman]3607-a married woman for three years . [I]131-janet had [a child]348-a child which died . [I]131-janet divorced [[my]131-janet husband]3480-my husband , and [he]149-ellesborough 's still alive . "[131-janet]

The colour had flamed back into [her]131-janet cheeks . [Janet]131-janet sat silent , [her]131-janet eyes fixed on [Rachel]129-rachel 's .

" [I]129-rachel did tell [you]131-janet [I]129-rachel had a story , did n't [I]129-rachel ? "[129-rachel] said [Rachel]129-rachel insistently .

" [You]131-janet did . [I]131-janet took [my]131-janet chance . It was [you]131-janet who -- who brought the action ? "[131-janet]

" [I]131-janet brought the action . There was no defence . And [the judge]3723-the judge said -- [I'd]131-janet been awfully badly treated -- it was no wonder [I]131-janet wanted -- to get free . Well , there it is . [I]131-janet 'm sorry [I]131-janet deceived [you]131-janet . [I]131-janet 'm sorry [I]131-janet deceived [him]3724-him . "[131-janet]

" [You]131-janet did n't deceive [me]131-janet , "[131-janet] said [Janet]131-janet . " [I]131-janet had practically guessed it . "[131-janet] [She]131-janet rose slowly , and going up to [Rachel]129-rachel , [she]131-janet put [her]131-janet hands on [her]129-rachel shoulders,--

" Why did n't [you]129-rachel tell [me]131-janet , [you]129-rachel poor thing ! "[131-janet] [Her]131-janet voice and eyes were full of emotion -- full of pity . But [Rachel]129-rachel shrank away a little from [her]131-janet touch , murmuring under [her]129-rachel breath , " Because [I]129-rachel wanted never to hear of it -- or think of it again . "[129-rachel] Then , after a pause , [she]129-rachel added , " But if [you]129-rachel want to know more , [I]129-rachel 'll tell [you]129-rachel . It 's [your]129-rachel right . [My]129-rachel married name was [Delane]179-delane . "[129-rachel]

" Do n't tell [me]131-janet any more ! "[131-janet] said [Janet]131-janet peremptorily . " [I]131-janet do n't want to hear it . But [you]129-rachel ought to be -- quite frank -- with _ [him]3725-him _ . "[131-janet]

" [I]131-janet know that . Naturally -- it was a great shock to [him]3725-him . "[131-janet]

There was something very touching in [her]131-janet attitude . [She]131-janet stood there like [a shamefaced boy]1880-a shamefaced boy , in [her]131-janet quasi - male dress ; and the contrast between [her]131-janet strong young beauty , and the humility and depression of [her]131-janet manner appealed with singular force to [Janet]131-janet 's mind , so constantly and secretly preoccupied with spiritual things . [Rachel]129-rachel seemed to [her]131-janet so much cleverer and more vigorous than [herself]131-janet in all matters of ordinary life . Only in the region of religious experience did [Janet]131-janet know [herself]131-janet the superior . But [Rachel]129-rachel had never made any outward sign that [she]129-rachel cared in the least to know more of [that region]1881-that region , whether in [Janet]131-janet or [other people]1882-other people . [She]129-rachel had held entirely aloof from it . But self - reproach -- moral suffering -- are two of the keys that lead to it . And both were evident here . [Janet]131-janet 's heart went out to [[her]131-janet friend]519-her friend .

" When is [he]519-her friend coming ? "[131-janet]

" To - morrow evening . [I]131-janet dare say [he]519-her friend 'll give [me]131-janet up . "[131-janet]

[Janet]131-janet marvelled at the absence of self - assertion -- the touch of despair -- in words and tone . So it had gone as deep as this ! [She]131-janet blamed [herself]131-janet for lack of perception . An ordinary love - affair , about to end in an ordinary way -- that was how it had appeared to [her]131-janet . And suddenly it seemed to [her]131-janet [she]131-janet had stumbled upon what might be tragedy .

No , no -- there should be no tragedy ! [She]131-janet put [her]131-janet arms round [Rachel]129-rachel .

" [[My]131-janet dear]3726-my dear , [he]519-her friend wo n't give [you]129-rachel up ! As if [I]131-janet had n't seen ! [He]519-her friend worships the ground [you]129-rachel tread upon ! "[131-janet]

[Rachel]129-rachel said nothing . [She]129-rachel let [her]129-rachel face rest on [Janet]131-janet 's shoulder . When [she]129-rachel raised it , it was wet . But [she]129-rachel kissed [Janet]131-janet quietly , and went away without another word .

[VIII]206-viii

[Four grown - ups]1884-four grown - ups and [a child]348-a child were gathered in [the living - room of [Halsey]114-halsey 's cottage]1886-the living - room of halsey 's cottage . [The cottage]1887-the cottage was old like [[its]1887-the cottage tenant]1888-its tenant and had all the inconveniences of age ; but [it]1887-the cottage was more spacious than [the modern cottage]1889-the modern cottage often is , since [it]1887-the cottage and [[its]1887-the cottage neighbours]1890-its neighbours represented a surviving fragment from [an old Jacobean house]1891-an old jacobean house -- [a house of [gentlefolks]1893-gentlefolks -- which had once stood on [the site]1894-the site]1892-a house of gentlefolks -- which had once stood on the site . [Most of [the house]337-the house]1895-most of the house had been pulled down , but [[Colonel Shepherd]124-colonel shepherd 's grandfather]1897-colonel shepherd 's grandfather had retained part of [it]337-the house , and turned [it]337-the house into [two cottages]1898-two cottages -- known as [1 and 2 Ipscombe Place]1899-1 and 2 ipscombe place -- which for all [their]1898-two cottages drawbacks were much in demand in [the village]304-the village , and conferred a certain distinction on [[their]1898-two cottages occupants]1901-their occupants . [[Mrs. Halsey]207-mrs. halsey 's living room]1902-mrs. halsey 's living room possessed a Tudor mantelpiece in moulded brick , into which a small modern kitchener had been barbarously fitted ; and three fine beams with a little incised ornament ran across the ceiling .

[Mrs. Halsey]207-mrs. halsey had not long cleared away the tea , and brought in a paraffin lamp , small but cheerful . [She]207-mrs. halsey was [a middle - aged woman , much younger than [[her]207-mrs. halsey husband]1294-her husband -- with an ironic half - dreamy eye , and a native intelligence much superior to [her]207-mrs. halsey surroundings]1903-a middle - aged woman , much younger than her husband -- with an ironic half - dreamy eye , and a native intelligence much superior to her surroundings . [She]207-mrs. halsey was suffering from a chronic abscess in the neck , which had strange periodic swellings and subsidences , all of which were endlessly interesting to [its possessor]631-its possessor . [Mrs. Halsey]207-mrs. halsey , indeed , called the abscess ' [she]207-mrs. halsey , " wrapped it lovingly in red flannel , describing the evening dressing of it as "[207-mrs. halsey] putting [her]207-mrs. halsey to bed , " and talked of "[207-mrs. halsey] [her]207-mrs. halsey " qualities and oddities as though , in the phrase of [[her]207-mrs. halsey next - door neighbour]3727-her next - door neighbour , "[207-mrs. halsey] it 'd a been [a christened child]1906-a christened child . " [She]207-mrs. halsey had decided views on politics , and was a match for [any political agent who might approach [her]207-mrs. halsey with an eye to [her]207-mrs. halsey vote]3728-any political agent who might approach her with an eye to her vote , a commodity which [she]207-mrs. halsey kept , so to speak , like a new shilling in [her]207-mrs. halsey pocket , turning it from time to time to make sure it was there .[1906-a christened child]

But independent as [she]207-mrs. halsey was , [she]207-mrs. halsey rarely interfered with the talk of [Halsey]207-mrs. halsey and [[his]1294-her husband male friends]1907-his male friends . And on this occasion when [the three men]1908-the three men -- [Halsey]207-mrs. halsey , [Peter Betts]182-betts , and [young Dempsey]194-dempsey -- had gathered smoking round the fire , [she]207-mrs. halsey settled [herself]207-mrs. halsey with [her]207-mrs. halsey knitting by the table and the lamp , throwing in every now and then a muttered and generally sarcastic comment , of which [[her]207-mrs. halsey husband]1294-her husband took no notice -- especially as [he]1294-her husband knew very well that the sarcasms were never aimed at [him]1294-her husband , and that [she]207-mrs. halsey was as proud of [him]1294-her husband as [she]207-mrs. halsey was generally contemptuous of the rest of [the world]474-the world .

[Halsey]207-mrs. halsey had just finished a rather grudging description of [his]1294-her husband experiences two days before for [John Dempsey]194-dempsey 's benefit . [He]1294-her husband was conscious that each time [he]1294-her husband repeated them , they sounded more incredible . [He]1294-her husband did n't want to repeat them ; [he]1294-her husband did n't mean to repeat them ; after this , [nobody]3230-nobody should get any more out of [him]1294-her husband at all .

[Young Dempsey]208-young dempsey 's attitude was certainly not encouraging . Attentive at first , [he]208-young dempsey allowed [himself]208-young dempsey , as [Halsey]207-mrs. halsey 's talk developed , a mild , progressive grin , which spread gradually over [his]1294-her husband ugly but honest face , and remained there . In face of it , [Halsey]207-mrs. halsey 's speech became more and more laconic , till at last [he]1294-her husband shut [his]1294-her husband mouth with a snap , and drawing [himself]1294-her husband up in [his]1294-her husband chair , re - lit [his]1294-her husband pipe with the expression that meant , " All right -- [I've]207-mrs. halsey done -- [you]208-young dempsey may take it or leave it . "[1294-her husband]

" Well , [I]194-dempsey do n't see that what [you]208-young dempsey saw , [Mr. Halsey]114-halsey , was so very uncommon ! "[194-dempsey] [Dempsey]194-dempsey began , still smiling , in spite of a warning look from [Betts]182-betts . " [You]182-betts saw [a man]3155-a man come down [that road]1837-that road ? Well , in the first place , why should n't [a man]3155-a man come down [that road]1837-that road -- it 's a reg'lar right of way-- "[194-dempsey]

" It 's the way , mind [ye]208-young dempsey , as the ghost of [old Watson]204-watson has allus come ! "[182-betts] put in [Peter Betts]182-betts , chivalrously anxious to support [[his]182-betts friend]1912-his friend [Halsey]114-halsey , as far as [he]182-betts could , against [a sceptical stranger]1913-a sceptical stranger . " An ' it 's been seen twice on [that road]1837-that road already , as [I]114-halsey can remember : once when [I]114-halsey was [a little boy]3734-a little boy , by [old Dan Holt]210-old dan holt , [the postmaster]3735-the postmaster , and once about ten years ago . "[114-halsey]

[Dempsey]194-dempsey looked at [the speaker]294-the speaker indulgently . To [his]194-dempsey sharpened transatlantic sense , [these old men]1915-these old men , in [this funny old village]1916-this funny old village , seemed to [him]194-dempsey [a curiously dim and feeble folk]1917-a curiously dim and feeble folk . [He]194-dempsey could hardly prevent [himself]194-dempsey from talking to [them]1915-these old men as though [they]1915-these old men were [children]1021-children . [He]194-dempsey supposed [[his]194-dempsey grandfather]3590-his grandfather would have been like that if [he]3590-his grandfather 'd stayed on at [Ipscombe]12-ipscombe . [He]194-dempsey thanked the stars [he]194-dempsey had n't !

But since [he]194-dempsey had been summoned to consult , as [a person who had a vested interest , of a rather blood - curdling sort]1920-a person who had a vested interest , of a rather blood - curdling sort , in the Great End ghost , [he]194-dempsey had to give [his]194-dempsey opinion ; and [he]194-dempsey gave it , while [Halsey]114-halsey listened and smoked in a rather sulky silence . For it was soon evident that [[the murderer]1921-the murderer 's grandson]1922-the murderer 's grandson had no use at all for the supposed ghost - story . [He]1922-the murderer 's grandson tore it ruthlessly to pieces . In the first place , [Halsey]114-halsey described [the man seen on [the grass - road]1924-the grass - road as tall and lanky . But according to [[his]194-dempsey grandfather]3590-his grandfather 's account]1923-the man seen on the grass - road as tall and lanky . but according to his grandfather 's account , [the murdered gamekeeper]1926-the murdered gamekeeper , on the contrary , was [a broadly - built , stumpy man]1927-a broadly - built , stumpy man . In the next place -- the coughing and the bleeding!--he laughed so long and loudly at these points in the story that [Halsey]114-halsey 's still black bushy eyebrows met frowningly over a pair of angry eyes , and [Betts]182-betts tried hurriedly to tame [the young man]598-the young man 's mirth .

" Well , if [yer]182-betts do n't think [that man]3736-that man as [Halsey]114-halsey saw _ was _ [the ghost]3443-the ghost , what do [you]182-betts s'pose ' [ee]182-betts was doin' there ? "[182-betts] asked [Betts]182-betts , " and where did [he]3736-that man go ? [Halsey]114-halsey went right round [the farm]345-the farm . [The hill]369-the hill just there is as bare as [my]182-betts hand . [He]114-halsey must ha ' seen [the man]3153-the man -- if it _ wor _ [a man]3155-a man -- an ' [he]114-halsey saw nothin' . There is n't a tree or a bush where [that man]3736-that man could ha ' hid hisself -- if [he]3153-the man _ wor _ [a man]3155-a man . "[182-betts]

[Dempsey]194-dempsey declared [he]194-dempsey should have to go and examine [the ground]1929-the ground [himself]194-dempsey before [he]194-dempsey could answer the question . But of course there was an answer to it -- there must be . As to [the man]3153-the man -- why [Millsborough]43-millsborough , and [Ipscombe]12-ipscombe too , had been full of [outlandish East Enders]1931-outlandish east enders , flying from the raids , [Poles]212-poles and [Russians]213-russians , and [such like -- thievin ' fellows]1932-such like -- thievin ' fellows by all accounts . Why could n't it be [one of [them]1932-such like -- thievin ' fellows]776-one of them -- prowling round [the farm]345-the farm for anything [he]3153-the man could pick up -- and frightened off , when [he]3153-the man saw [Halsey]114-halsey ?

[Betts]182-betts , smoking with prodigious energy , inquired what [he]114-halsey made of the _ blood _ . Did n't [he]114-halsey know the old story of how [Watson]204-watson was tracked down to [the cart - shed]424-the cart - shed ? [Dempsey]194-dempsey laughed again .

" Well , it 's curious , grant [ye]1938-you . It 's real funny ! But where are [you]1938-you going to get blood without a body ? And if a thing 's a body , it is n't a ghost ! "[194-dempsey]

[The two old men]299-the two old men were silent . [Halsey]114-halsey was lost in a hopeless confusion of ideas , and [Betts]182-betts was determined not to give [[his]182-betts pal]1937-his pal away .

But here -- say what [you]1938-you like!--was [a strange man]1939-a strange man , seen , on [the road]3145-the road , which had been used , according to village tradition , on several previous occasions , by [the authentic ghost of [Watson]204-watson]1941-the authentic ghost of watson ; [his]114-halsey course was marked by traces of blood , just as [Watson]204-watson 's path of pain had been marked on the night of the murder ; and on reaching the spot where [Watson]204-watson had breathed [his]204-watson last , the apparition , whatever it was , had vanished . Perplexity , superstition , and common sense fought each other . [Halsey]114-halsey who knew much of [his]114-halsey Bible by heart was inwardly comparing texts . " A spirit hath not flesh and blood"--True[114-halsey] -- but on the other hand what about the " bodies of the saints"--that[114-halsey] " arose "[194-dempsey] ? While , perhaps , the strongest motive of all in [the old man]292-the old man 's mind was the obstinate desire to prove [himself]114-halsey right , and so to confound [young scoffers like [Dempsey]194-dempsey]1943-young scoffers like dempsey .

[Dempsey]194-dempsey , however , having as [he]194-dempsey thought disposed of [Halsey]114-halsey 's foolish tale was determined to tell [his]194-dempsey own , which had already made a great impression in [certain quarters of [the village]304-the village]1944-certain quarters of the village , and ranked indeed as the chief sensation of the day . To be able to listen to the story of a murder told by [the grandson of [the murderer]1921-the murderer]1946-the grandson of the murderer , to whom [the criminal]1948-the criminal [himself]1948-the criminal had confessed it , and that without any fear of unpleasant consequences to [any one]3450-any one , was a treat that [Ipscombe]12-ipscombe had seldom enjoyed , especially as [the village]304-the village was still rich in [kinsfolk of both murdered and murderer]1951-kinsfolk of both murdered and murderer .

[Dempsey]194-dempsey had already repeated the story so often that it was by now perfect in every detail , and it produced the same effect in [this lamplit kitchen]1952-this lamplit kitchen as in other . [Halsey]114-halsey , forgetting [his]114-halsey secret ill - humour , was presently listening open - mouthed . [Mrs. Halsey]207-mrs. halsey laid down [her]207-mrs. halsey knitting , and stared at [the speaker]294-the speaker over the top of [her]207-mrs. halsey spectacles ; while across [Betts]182-betts 's gnome - like countenance smiles went out and in , especially at the more gruesome points of the tale . The light sparkled on [the young Canadian]1954-the young canadian 's belt , the Maple Leaf in the khaki hat which lay across [his]1954-the young canadian knees , on the badge of the Forestry Corps on [his]1954-the young canadian shoulder . [The old English cottage]1955-the old english cottage , with [its]1955-the old english cottage Tudor brick - work , and [its]1955-the old english cottage overhanging beams , [the old English labourers with the stains of English soil upon them]1956-the old english labourers with the stains of english soil upon them , made the setting ; and in the midst , sat [the " new man]3744-the " new man , "[3744-the " new man] from [the New World]62-the new world , holding the stage , just as [Ellesborough]149-ellesborough [the New Englander]1957-the new englander was accustomed to hold it , at [Great End Farm]1-great end farm . All over [England]2-england , all over unravaged [France]27-france and northern [Italy]63-italy similar scenes at that moment were being thrown on the magic sheet of life ; and at any drop in the talk , [the observer]1958-the observer could almost hear , in the stillness , the weaving of the Great Loom on which the Ages come and go .

There was a pause , when [Dempsey]194-dempsey came to a dramatic end with the last breath of [[his]194-dempsey grandfather]3590-his grandfather ; till [Mrs. Halsey]207-mrs. halsey said dryly , fixing [the young man]598-the young man with [her]207-mrs. halsey small beady eyes,--

" And [you]598-the young man do n't mind telling on [[your]598-the young man own grandfather]3745-your own grandfather ? "[207-mrs. halsey]

" Why should n't [I]194-dempsey ? "[194-dempsey] laughed [Dempsey]194-dempsey , " when it 's sixty years ago . [They]3746-they 've lost [their]3746-they chance of hanging [him]3745-your own grandfather anyhow . "[194-dempsey]

[Mrs. Halsey]207-mrs. halsey shook [her]207-mrs. halsey head in inarticulate protest . [Betts]182-betts said reflectively,--

" [I]207-mrs. halsey would n't advise [you]598-the young man to be tellin ' that tale to [Miss Henderson]127-miss henderson . "[207-mrs. halsey]

[Dempsey]194-dempsey 's expression changed at the name . [He]194-dempsey bent forward eagerly .

" By the way , who is [Miss Henderson]127-miss henderson ? Do [you]598-the young man know where [she]1962-she comes from ? "[207-mrs. halsey]

[The others]893-the others stared .

" Last winter , "[182-betts] said [Betts]182-betts at last , ' [she]1962-she wor on [a farm down [Devonshire]64-devonshire way]1963-a farm down devonshire way . And before that [she]1962-she wor at college -- with [Miss Janet]131-janet . "[131-janet]

" Was [she]1962-she ever in [Canada]13-canada ? "[1962-she]

" Yes ! "[207-mrs. halsey] said [Halsey]207-mrs. halsey with sudden decision , ' [she]1962-she wor -- for [she]1962-she told [me]0-i one day when [I]0-i wor mendin ' [the new reaper and binder]1964-the new reaper and binder , that [we]1965-we in [this country]1966-this country did n't know what harvest meant . ' Why , [I]0-i 've helped to reap a field -- in [Canada]13-canada , ' [she]1962-she ses , ' fower miles square , ' [she]1962-she ses , ' six teams o ' horses -- an ' six horses to [the team]1967-the team , ' [she]1962-she ses--'that 's somethin' like . ' So [I]0-i know [she]1962-she 's been in [Canada]13-canada . "[0-i]

" Ah ! "[194-dempsey] said [Dempsey]194-dempsey , staring at the carpet . " And [she]1962-she 's not married ? [You]0-i 're sure [she]1962-she 's not married ? "[194-dempsey]

" Married ? "[1968-all the others] said [all the others]1968-all the others , looking at [him]194-dempsey in disapproving astonishment .

" Well , if [she]1962-she ai n't , [I]194-dempsey saw [[her]1962-she sister]3747-her sister -- or [her]1962-she double -- twice -- about two - and - a - half year ago -- at [a place thirty miles from [Winnipeg]55-winnipeg]3748-a place thirty miles from winnipeg . [I]194-dempsey could ha ' sworn [I]194-dempsey 'd seen [her]1962-she before ! "[194-dempsey]

" Well , [you]0-i ca n't ha ' seen [her]1962-she before , "[182-betts] said [Betts]182-betts positively ; " cause [she]1962-she 's [Miss]3749-miss , not [Missis]215-missis . "[182-betts]

" Ah ! "[194-dempsey] said [Dempsey]194-dempsey again in a non - committal voice , looking hard this time into the fire .

" Where have [you]0-i seen [her]1962-she -- in these parts ? "[207-mrs. halsey] asked [Mrs. Halsey]207-mrs. halsey .

" At the Harvest Festival , t'other day . But [I]207-mrs. halsey must have been mistaken -- that 's all . [I]207-mrs. halsey think [I]207-mrs. halsey 'm going to call upon [her]1962-she some day . "[207-mrs. halsey]

" Whatever for ? "[207-mrs. halsey]

" Why -- to tell [her]1962-she about [[my]194-dempsey grandfather]3501-my grandfather ! "[194-dempsey] said [Dempsey]194-dempsey , looking round at [Mrs. Halsey]207-mrs. halsey , with an air of astonishment that [any one]3450-any one should ask [him]194-dempsey the question .

" [You]0-i wo n't be welcome . "[207-mrs. halsey]

" Why not ? "[207-mrs. halsey]

" Because [she]1962-she do n't want to hear nothin' about [Watson]204-watson 's murder . And whatever 's the good on it , anyhow ? "[207-mrs. halsey] said [Mrs. Halsey]207-mrs. halsey with sudden emphasis . " [You]0-i 've told [us]3751-us a good tale , [I]207-mrs. halsey 'll grant [ye]0-i . But [yer]0-i might as well be pullin ' [the old feller]3752-the old feller ' isself out of [his]3752-the old feller grave , as goin' round killin ' ' [i]207-mrs. halsey m every night fresh , as [you]0-i be doin' . Let ' [i]207-mrs. halsey m be . [Skelintons]65-skelintons is skelintons . "[207-mrs. halsey]

[Dempsey]194-dempsey , feeling rather indignantly that [his]194-dempsey pains had been wasted , and [[his]194-dempsey audience]1970-his audience was not worthy of [him]194-dempsey , rose to take [his]194-dempsey departure . [Halsey]207-mrs. halsey 's face cleared . [He]194-dempsey turned to look at [[his]194-dempsey wife]466-his wife , and [she]466-his wife winked in return . And when [the young forester]1972-the young forester had taken [his]194-dempsey departure , [Mrs. Halsey]207-mrs. halsey stroked the red flannel round [her]466-his wife swollen neck complacently .

" [I]207-mrs. halsey ' ad to pike ' [i]207-mrs. halsey m out soomhow . It 's ' [igh]3753-igh time [she]129-rachel wor put to bed ! "[207-mrs. halsey]

That same evening , [Ellesborough]149-ellesborough left [the Ralstone camp]1973-the ralstone camp behind [him]149-ellesborough about six o'clock , and hurried through the late October evening towards [Great End Farm]1-great end farm . During the forty - eight hours which had elapsed since [his]149-ellesborough interview with [Rachel]129-rachel [he]149-ellesborough had passed through much suffering , and agonies of indecision . [He]149-ellesborough had had to reconstruct all [his]149-ellesborough ideas of [the woman [he]149-ellesborough loved]1974-the woman he loved . Instead of the proud and virginal creature [he]149-ellesborough had imagined [himself]149-ellesborough to be wooing , amid the beautiful setting of [[her]129-rachel harvest fields]1975-her harvest fields , [he]149-ellesborough had to think of [her]129-rachel as [a woman dimmed and besmirched by an unhappy marriage]1976-a woman dimmed and besmirched by an unhappy marriage with [a bad man]1977-a bad man . For [himself]149-ellesborough , [he]149-ellesborough certainly resented the concealment which had been practised on [him]149-ellesborough . Yet at the same time [he]149-ellesborough thought [he]149-ellesborough understood the state of exasperation , of invincible revolt which had led to it . And [he]149-ellesborough kept reminding [himself]149-ellesborough that , after all , [her]129-rachel confession had anticipated [his]149-ellesborough proposal .

Nevertheless [such men as [he]149-ellesborough]1978-such men as he have ideas of marriage , both romantic and austere . [They]1978-such men as he are inclined to claim what [they]1978-such men as he give -- a clean sheet , and the first - fruits of body and soul . In [Rachel]129-rachel 's case the first - fruits had been wasted on a marriage , of which the ugly and inevitable incidents haunted [Ellesborough]149-ellesborough 's imagination . One moment [he]149-ellesborough shrank from the thought of [them]1979-them ; the next [he]149-ellesborough could not restrain the protesting rush of passion -- the vow that [his]149-ellesborough love should put [her]129-rachel back on that pinnacle of honour and respect from which fate should never have allowed [her]129-rachel to fall .

Well , [she]129-rachel had promised to tell [him]149-ellesborough [her]129-rachel story in full . [He]149-ellesborough awaited it . As to [[his]149-ellesborough own people]1980-his own people , [they]1980-his own people were dear , [good women]1981-good women , [[his]149-ellesborough mother]986-his mother and [sisters]1983-sisters -- [saints]1984-saints , but [not Pharisees]1985-not pharisees .

It was a dark and lowering evening , with tempest gusts of wind . But from far away , after [he]149-ellesborough had passed [Ipscombe]12-ipscombe , a light from one of the windows of [the farm]345-the farm shone out , as though beckoning [him]149-ellesborough to [her]129-rachel . Suddenly from [the mouth of [the farm]345-the farm]1987-the mouth of the farm , [he]149-ellesborough saw [a bicycle]1876-a bicycle approaching . [The rider]1990-the rider was [Janet Leighton]131-janet . [She]129-rachel passed [him]149-ellesborough with a wave and a smile .

" Going to a Food meeting ! But [Rachel]129-rachel 's at [home]3185-home . "[129-rachel]

What [a nice woman]1991-a nice woman ! Looking back over the couple of months since [he]149-ellesborough had known [the inmates of [the farm]345-the farm]1992-the inmates of the farm , [he]149-ellesborough realized how much [he]149-ellesborough had come to like [Janet Leighton]131-janet . So unselfish , so full of thought for [others]1797-others , so modest for [herself]131-janet ! There could n't be [a better friend]1995-a better friend for [Rachel]129-rachel ; [her]129-rachel friendship itself was a testimonial ; [he]149-ellesborough reassured [himself]149-ellesborough by the mere thought of [her]129-rachel .

When [he]149-ellesborough drew up at [the farm]345-the farm , [Hastings]127-miss henderson with a lantern in [his]149-ellesborough hand was just disappearing towards [the hill]369-the hill , and [the two girls]729-the two girls , [Betty]141-betty and [Jenny]131-janet , passed [him]149-ellesborough , each with [a young man]3678-a young man , [two members , in fact , of [his]149-ellesborough own Corps]2000-two members , in fact , of his own corps , [John Dempsey]194-dempsey and another . [They]729-the two girls explained that [they]729-the two girls were off to a Red Cross Concert in [the village hall]2001-the village hall . [Ellesborough]149-ellesborough 's pulse beat quicker as [he]149-ellesborough parted from [them]729-the two girls , for [he]149-ellesborough realized that [he]149-ellesborough would find [Rachel]129-rachel alone in [the farm]345-the farm .

Yes , there [she]129-rachel was at the open door , greeting [him]149-ellesborough with a quiet face -- a smile even . [She]129-rachel led the way into [the sitting - room]447-the sitting - room , where [she]129-rachel had just drawn down the blinds and closed the curtains of the window looking on [the farm - yard]430-the farm - yard . But [his]149-ellesborough arrival had interrupted [her]129-rachel before [she]129-rachel could do the same for the window looking on the Down . [Neither of [them]2006-them]2005-neither of them thought of it . [Each]541-each was absorbed in the mere presence of [the other]283-the other .

[Rachel]129-rachel was in [her]129-rachel black Sunday dress of some silky stuff . [Her]129-rachel throat was uncovered , and [her]129-rachel shapely arms showed through the thin sleeves . The black and white softened and refined something overblown and sensuous in [her]129-rachel beauty . [Her]129-rachel manner , too , had lost its confident , provocative note . [Ellesborough]149-ellesborough had never seen [her]129-rachel so adorable , so desirable . But [her]129-rachel self - command dictated [his]149-ellesborough . [He]149-ellesborough took the seat to which [she]129-rachel pointed [him]149-ellesborough ; while [she]129-rachel [herself]129-rachel brought a chair to the other side of the fire , putting on another log with a steady hand , and a remark about the wind that was whistling outside . Then , one foot crossed over the other , [her]129-rachel cheek reddened by the fire , propped on [her]129-rachel hand , and [her]129-rachel eyes on the fresh flame that was beginning to dance out of the wood , [she]129-rachel asked him,--"You'd like to hear it all ? "[129-rachel]

[He]149-ellesborough made a sign of assent .

So in a quiet , even voice , [she]129-rachel began with an account of [[her]129-rachel family]2009-her family and early surroundings , more detailed than anything [she]129-rachel had yet given [him]149-ellesborough . [She]129-rachel described [[her]129-rachel father]735-her father ( the striking apostolic head of [the old man]292-the old man hung on the wall behind [her]129-rachel ) and [his]735-her father missionary journeys through [the prairie settlements]2012-the prairie settlements in the early days of [Alberta]66-alberta ; how , when [he]735-her father was old and weary , [he]735-her father would sometimes take [her]129-rachel , [[his]735-her father latest child]2013-his latest child , [a small girl of ten or twelve]2014-a small girl of ten or twelve , on [his]735-her father pastoral rounds , for company , perched up beside [him]735-her father in [his]735-her father buggy ; and how [[her]129-rachel mother]354-her mother was killed by the mere hardships of the prairie life , sinking into fretful invalidism for two years before [her]354-her mother death .

" [I]2016-i nursed [her]129-rachel for years . [I]2016-i never did anything else -- [I]2016-i could n't . [I]2016-i never had any amusements like [other girls]3755-other girls . There was no money and no time . [She]129-rachel died when [I]2016-i was twenty - four . And three months after , [[my]2016-i father]3612-my father died . [He]3612-my father did n't leave a penny . Then [[my]2016-i brother]3372-my brother asked [me]2016-i to go and live with [him]3372-my brother and [[his]3372-my brother wife]466-his wife . [I]2016-i was to have [my]2016-i board and a dress allowance , if [I]2016-i would help [her]129-rachel in [the house]337-the house . [[My]2016-i brother]3372-my brother 's an awfully good sort -- but [I]2016-i could n't get on with [[his]3372-my brother wife]466-his wife . [I]2016-i just could n't ! [I]2016-i expect it was [my]2016-i fault , just as much as [hers]129-rachel . It was something [we]3762-we could n't help . Very soon [I]2016-i hated the sight of [her]129-rachel , and [she]129-rachel never missed a chance of making [me]2016-i feel a worm -- a useless , greedy creature , living on [other people]1882-other people 's work . If only there had been [some children]3764-some children , [I]2016-i dare say [I]2016-i could have borne it . But [she]129-rachel and [I]2016-i could never get away from [each other]460-each other . There were no distractions . [Our]3762-we nerves got simply raw -- at least [mine]2016-i did . "[2016-i]

There was a pause . [She]2016-i lifted [her]2016-i brown eyes , and looked at [Ellesborough]149-ellesborough intently .

" [I]2016-i suppose [[my]2016-i mother]3503-my mother would have borne it . But [girls]3223-girls nowadays ca n't . [Not girls like [me]2016-i]3768-not girls like me , anyway . [Her]2016-i cheeks had flushed . [Her]2016-i eyes were very bright and defiant .

" Well then -- [this man]3771-this man [Delane]179-delane -- came to live near [you]2016-i ? "[149-ellesborough]

[He]149-ellesborough spoke with the utmost gentleness , trying to help [her]2016-i out .

" [I]2016-i met [him]3771-this man at a dance in [Winnipeg]55-winnipeg first -- the day after [I]2016-i 'd had a horrid row with [[my]2016-i sister - in - law]3772-my sister - in - law . "[2017-i]

[She]2022-i spoke with passionate animation -- almost fierceness . While through [her]2022-i inner mind there ran the thought , " [I]2022-i 've told him!--I've told [him]3824-him ! [They]2023-they stood fronting [each other]460-each other . Over the fine bronzed face of [the forester]2025-the forester there ran a ripple of profound emotion -- nostril and lip -- and eye . [She]2022-i clung to [him]2025-the forester , a great wave of passion sweeping through [her]2022-i also . [She]2022-i thought , " Now [I]2022-i shall be happy!--and [I]2022-i shall make [him]2025-the forester happy , too . Of course [I]2022-i shall!--I'm doing quite right . "[2022-i]

Presently [he]2025-the forester put [her]2022-i back in [her]2022-i chair , and sat beside [her]2022-i on the low fender stool , in front of the fire . [His]2025-the forester aspect was completely transformed . " Do [you]2022-i know where [that man]3736-that man is now ? "[2025-the forester] [he]2025-the forester said to [her]2022-i presently . " [Roger]179-delane ? No , [I]2022-i have no idea . [I]2022-i always suppose [he]3736-that man 's in [Canada]13-canada still . [He]3736-that man never appeared when the case was tried . "[2022-i]

[Ellesborough]149-ellesborough shrugged [his]149-ellesborough shoulders contemptuously .

" Threats are cheap ! [I]2022-i hope [you]149-ellesborough soon put that out of [your]149-ellesborough mind ? "[2022-i]

[She]2028-her made a little restless movement .

" Yes , [I]2028-her -- [I]2028-her suppose so . But [I]2028-her did tell [you]2028-her once , did n't [I]2028-her , that -- [I]2028-her often had fears -- about nothing ? "[2028-her]

" Yes , [you]2028-her did tell [me]149-ellesborough , "[149-ellesborough] [he]149-ellesborough said , smiling . " Do n't have any more fears , [darling]3832-darling ! [I]149-ellesborough 'll see to that . "[149-ellesborough]

[He]149-ellesborough took [her]2028-her hands again , and raised them to [his]149-ellesborough lips and kissed them .
