Was [she]2028-her really afraid of [the villain [she]2028-her had escaped from]2029-the villain she had escaped from ? [The dear , foolish woman]2030-the dear , foolish woman ! [The man in [his]149-ellesborough self - confident strength]2031-the man in his self - confident strength loved [her]2028-her the more for the vague terrors [he]149-ellesborough felt [himself]149-ellesborough so well able to soothe .

For half an hour more [they]2032-they sat together , in that first intimacy of love , which transfigures [men]3205-men and [women]3203-women , so that when [they]2032-they pass back from it into ordinary life [they]2032-they scarcely recognize life or [themselves]2032-they again . [They]2032-they talked much less of the past than of the future -- and that in the light of the glorious war news coming in day by day . [Austria]69-austria was on the point of surrender -- the German landslide might come at any moment -- then _ peace_!--incredible word . [Ellesborough]149-ellesborough would hardly now get to [France]27-france . [They]2032-they might be able to marry soon -- within a few weeks . As to [the farm]345-the farm , [he]149-ellesborough asked [her]2028-her , laughing , whether [she]2028-her would take [him]149-ellesborough in as [a junior partner]2036-a junior partner for a time , till [they]2032-they could settle [their]2032-they plans . " [I]2028-her 've got a bit of money of [my]2028-her own . But first [you]2028-her must let [me]2028-her go back , as soon as there are [ships to go]3833-ships to go in -- to see after [my]2028-her own humble business . [We]2032-they could launch out -- get some fine stock -- try experiments . It 's a going concern , and [I]2028-her 've got a good share in it . Why should n't [you]2028-her go , too ? "[2028-her]

[He]149-ellesborough saw [her]2028-her shrink .

" To [Canada]13-canada ? Oh , no ! "[149-ellesborough]

[He]149-ellesborough scourged [himself]149-ellesborough mentally for having taken [her]2028-her thoughts back to the old unhappy times . But [she]2028-her soon recovered [herself]2028-her . Then it was time for [him]149-ellesborough to go , and [he]149-ellesborough stood up .

" [I]149-ellesborough should like to have seen [Janet]131-janet ! "[149-ellesborough] [he]149-ellesborough said joyously . " [She]131-janet 'll have to get used to Christian names . How soon will [you]149-ellesborough tell [her]131-janet ? Directly [she]131-janet comes in ? "[149-ellesborough]

" Certainly not . [I]149-ellesborough shall wait -- till to - morrow morning . "[149-ellesborough]

[He]149-ellesborough laughed , whispering into [her]2028-her ear , as [her]2028-her soft , curly head lay against [his]149-ellesborough breast .

" [You]149-ellesborough wo n't wait ten minutes -- [you]149-ellesborough could n't ! Well , [I]149-ellesborough must be going , or [they]3834-they 'll shut [me]149-ellesborough out of [the camp]3224-the camp . "[149-ellesborough]

" Why do [you]149-ellesborough hurry so ? "[149-ellesborough]

" Hurry ? Why , [I]149-ellesborough shall be an hour late , anyway . [I]149-ellesborough shall have to give [myself]149-ellesborough C.B. to - morrow . "[149-ellesborough]

[She]2028-her laughed -- a sound of pure content . Then [she]2028-her suddenly drew [herself]2028-her away , frowning at [him]149-ellesborough .

" [You]149-ellesborough do love [me]2028-her -- [you]149-ellesborough do -- [you]149-ellesborough will always!--whatever [people]880-people may say ? "[2028-her]

[He]149-ellesborough was surprised at the note almost of violence in [her]2028-her voice . [He]149-ellesborough answered it by a passionate caress , which [she]2028-her bore with trembling . Then [she]2028-her resolutely moved away .

" Do go ! "[2028-her] [she]2028-her said to [him]149-ellesborough , imploringly . " [I]2028-her 'd like to be a few minutes -- alone -- before [they]880-people come back . "[2028-her]

[He]149-ellesborough saw [her]2028-her settle [herself]2028-her by the fire , [her]2028-her hands stretched out to the blaze . Seeing that the fire was low , and remembering the chill of [her]2028-her hands in [his]149-ellesborough , [he]149-ellesborough looked around for the wood - basket which was generally kept in a corner behind the piano .

[His]149-ellesborough movement was suddenly arrested . [He]149-ellesborough was looking towards the uncurtained window . The night had grown pitch dark outside , and there were splashes of rain against the glass . But [he]149-ellesborough distinctly saw as [he]149-ellesborough turned [a man]3155-a man 's face pressed against the glass -- a strained , sallow , face , framed in straggling black hair , a face with regular features , and eyes deeply set in blackened orbits . It was a face of hatred ; the lips tightly drawn over the teeth , seemed to have a curse on them .

The vision lasted only a moment . [Ellesborough]149-ellesborough 's trained instinct , the wary instinct of [the man who had parsed days and nights with nature in [her]2039-her wilder and lonelier places]2038-the man who had parsed days and nights with nature in her wilder and lonelier places , checked the exclamation on [his]149-ellesborough lips . And before [he]149-ellesborough could move again , the face had disappeared . The old holly bush growing against the farm wall , from which the apparition seemed to have sprung , was still there , some of its glossy leaves visible in the bright light of the paraffin lamp which stood on the table near the window . And there was nothing else .

[Ellesborough]149-ellesborough quietly walked to the window , drew down the blind , and pulled the curtains together . [Rachel]129-rachel looked around at the sound .

" Did n't [I]129-rachel do that ? "[129-rachel] [she]129-rachel said , half dreamily .

" [We]3837-we forgot ! "[149-ellesborough] [He]149-ellesborough smiled at [her]129-rachel . " Now it 's all cosy . Ah , there they are ! Perhaps [I]149-ellesborough 'll get [Janet]131-janet to come as far as [the road]3145-the road with [me]149-ellesborough . "[149-ellesborough] For voices were approaching -- [Janet]131-janet talking to [the girls]3326-the girls . [Rachel]129-rachel looked up , assenting . The colour had rushed back to [her]129-rachel face . [Ellesborough]149-ellesborough took in the picture of [her]129-rachel , sitting unconscious by the fire , while [his]149-ellesborough own pulse was thumping under the excitement of what [he]149-ellesborough had seen .

With a last word to [her]129-rachel , [he]149-ellesborough closed the sitting - room door behind [him]149-ellesborough , and went out to meet [Janet Leighton]131-janet in the dark .

[IX]70-ix

[It]2041-it was a foggy October evening , and [Berkeley Square]71-berkeley square , from which the daylight had not yet departed , made a peculiarly dismal impression on [the passers - by]2042-the passers - by , under the mingled illumination of its half - blinded lamps , and of a sunset which in [the country]950-the country was clear and golden , and here in west [London]11-london could only give a lurid coppery tinge to the fog , to [the eastern house]2044-the eastern house - fronts , and to the great plane - trees holding [the Square garden]2045-the square garden , like giants encamped . [Landsowne House]72-landsowne house , in [its]72-landsowne house lordly seclusion from [the rest of [the Square]73-the square]2046-the rest of the square , seemed specially to have gathered the fog to itself , and was almost lost from sight . Not a ray of light escaped the closely - shuttered windows . The events of the _ mensis mirabilis _ were rushing on . [Bulgaria]74-bulgaria , [Austria]69-austria , [Turkey]75-turkey , had laid down [their]2047-their arms -- the German cry for an armistice had rung through [Europe]46-europe . But still [London]11-london lay dark and muffled . [Her]131-janet peril was not yet over .

In [the drawing - room of [one of [the houses on the eastern side]2050-the houses on the eastern side]2049-one of the houses on the eastern side , belonging to [a Warwickshire baronet]2051-a warwickshire baronet and [M.P.--Sir Richard Winton]219-m.p.--sir richard winton by name]2048-the drawing - room of one of the houses on the eastern side , belonging to a warwickshire baronet and m.p.--sir richard winton by name -- [a lady]553-a lady was standing in front of a thrifty fire , which in view of the coal restrictions of the moment , [she]553-a lady had been very unwilling to light at all . The restrictions irritated [her]553-a lady ; so did the inevitable cold of [the room]431-the room ; and most of all was [she]553-a lady annoyed and harassed by the thought of [a visitor who might appear at any moment]2054-a visitor who might appear at any moment . [She]131-janet was tall , well - made , and plain . [One]279-one might have guessed [her]131-janet age at about thirty - five . [She]131-janet had been out in the earlier afternoon , attending a war meeting on behalf of [some charities in which [she]131-janet was interested]2056-some charities in which she was interested , and [she]131-janet had not yet removed a high and stately hat with two outstanding wings and much jet ornament , which [she]131-janet had worn at the meeting , to the huge indignation of [[her]131-janet neighbours]2057-her neighbours . The black of [her]131-janet silk dress was lightened by a rope of pearls , and various diamond trinkets . [Her]131-janet dress fitted [her]131-janet to perfection . [Competence]220-competence and will were written in [her]131-janet small , shrewd eyes and in the play of a decided mouth .

There was a knock at the door . At [Lady Winton]221-lady winton 's " Come in ! "[2058-a stout , elderly maid] [a stout , elderly maid]2058-a stout , elderly maid appeared . " [You]2059-her mistress 'll see [Mr. Roger]222-mr. roger [here]3217-here ? "[2058-a stout , elderly maid]

[The maid]2060-the maid explained that all was ready . [Jones]224-jones [the butler]2061-the butler had been sent with a note to [the City]2062-the city , and [the housemaid]2063-the housemaid was sitting with the kitchen - maid , who was recovering from the flu .

" [I]2065-a tall man told [them]3841-them [I]2065-a tall man 'd answer the bell . And [I]2065-a tall man 'll keep an eye that [no one]570-no one comes down before [he]222-mr. roger 's gone . There [he]222-mr. roger is ! "[2065-a tall man]

[A tall man]2065-a tall man entered -- coughing .

" That [I]221-lady winton think would be the lowest depth ! "[221-lady winton] said [Lady Winton]221-lady winton , breathing quick , " to beg money from [the wife who divorced [you]2083-you]3886-the wife who divorced you ! "[221-lady winton]

" [I]221-lady winton am ready to beg for money -- requisition is the better word -- from anybody in [the world]474-the world who has more of it than [I.]221-lady winton [I]221-lady winton am [a Bolshevist]3888-a bolshevist . [Lady Winton]221-lady winton made no reply . [She]221-lady winton stood , a statue of angry patience waiting for [him]2087-he to go . [He]2087-he turned to [her]221-lady winton with a sneer on [his]2087-he lips . [[His]2087-he sister]1186-his sister was still silent .

[The man moving about [the room]431-the room]2091-the man moving about the room was perhaps the thing [she]221-lady winton feared and hated most in [the world]474-the world . Every scene of this kind -- and [he]2087-he forced them on [her]221-lady winton , in spite of [her]221-lady winton futile resistance , at fairly frequent intervals -- represented to [her]221-lady winton an hour of torture and humiliation . How to hide the scenes and the being who caused them , from [[her]221-lady winton husband]1294-her husband , [[her]221-lady winton servants]2095-her servants , [[her]221-lady winton [friends]3434-friends]2096-her friends , was becoming almost [her]221-lady winton chief preoccupation . [She]221-lady winton was beginning to be afraid of [[her]221-lady winton brother]1111-her brother . For some time [she]221-lady winton had regarded [him]1111-her brother as incipiently insane , and as [she]221-lady winton watched [him]1111-her brother this evening [he]1111-her brother seemed to [her]221-lady winton more than ever charged with sinister possibilities . It appeared to be impossible to influence or frighten [him]1111-her brother ; and [she]221-lady winton realized that as [he]1111-her brother seemed not to care a fig whether [she]221-lady winton caused a scandal or not , and [she]221-lady winton cared with every pulse of [her]221-lady winton being , [she]221-lady winton was really in [his]1111-her brother power , and it was no good struggling .

" Good - night , [Roger]179-delane . [Nannie]223-nannie will show [you]230-edie out . "[1111-her brother]

The door closed on [him]1111-her brother , and [Lady Winton]221-lady winton dropped on a sofa by the fire , [her]221-lady winton face showing white and middle - aged in the firelight . [She]221-lady winton was just [an ordinary woman , only with a stronger will than most]2099-an ordinary woman , only with a stronger will than most ; and as [an ordinary woman]2100-an ordinary woman , amid all [her]221-lady winton anger and fear , [she]221-lady winton was not wholly proof against such a spectacle as that now presented by [[her]221-lady winton once favourite brother]2101-her once favourite brother . It was not [his]1111-her brother words that affected [her]221-lady winton -- but a hundred little personal facts which every time [she]221-lady winton saw [him]1111-her brother burnt a little more deeply into [her]221-lady winton consciousness the irreparableness of [his]1111-her brother personal ruin -- physical and moral . Idleness , drink , disease -- the loss of shame , of self - respect , of manners -- the sense of something vital gone for ever -- all these fatal things stared out upon [her]221-lady winton , from [his]1111-her brother slippery emaciated face , [his]1111-her brother borrowed clothes , [his]1111-her brother bullying voice -- the scent on [him]1111-her brother of the mews in which [he]1111-her brother lived !

[She]221-lady winton covered [her]221-lady winton face with [her]221-lady winton hands and cried a little . [She]221-lady winton could remember when [he]1111-her brother was [the darling and pride of [the family]1000-the family]2102-the darling and pride of the family -- especially of [[his]1111-her brother father]984-his father . "[1111-her brother]

That was wicked stuff , of course ; but there had been a twist in [him]1111-her brother from the beginning . Had _ [she]221-lady winton _ done [her]221-lady winton best for [him]1111-her brother ? There were times when [her]221-lady winton conscience pricked [her]221-lady winton .

The clock struck seven . The sound brought [her]221-lady winton to [her]221-lady winton feet . [She]221-lady winton must go and dress . [Richard]225-richard would be [home]3185-home directly , and [they]2106-they were dining out , to meet [a distinguished General]2107-a distinguished general , in [London]11-london for a few days ' leave from the front . Meanwhile [Delane]179-delane stepped out into the fog , which , however , was lifting a little . [Delane]179-delane bought an _ Evening News _ , glanced at the headlines , and threw it away . What did the war matter to him?--or the new world that [fools]2124-fools supposed to be coming after it ? [Consumptives]2125-consumptives had a way , no doubt , of living longer than [people]880-people expected -- or hoped . [He]2125-consumptives wandered on along [Regent Street]77-regent street , and [Waterloo Place]78-waterloo place , down [the Duke of [York]80-york]79-the duke of york 's steps into [the Mall]2141-the mall , where some captured guns were already in position , with [children]1021-children swarming about [them]2141-the mall ; and so through [St. James 's Park]81-st. james 's park to [the Abbey]82-the abbey . The fog was now all but clear , and there were frosty stars overhead . [The Abbey towers]2143-the abbey towers rose out of a purple haze , etherially pale and moon - touched . [The House of Commons]2144-the house of commons was sitting , but there was still no light on [the Clock Tower]2145-the clock tower , and no unmuffling of the lamps . [London]11-london was waiting , as [the world]474-the world was waiting , for the next step in the vast drama which had three continents for its setting ; and meanwhile , save for the added movements in [the streets]1248-the streets , and a new something in the faces of [the crowds hurrying along the pavements]2148-the crowds hurrying along the pavements , there was nothing to show that all was in fact over , and the war won .

[Delane]179-delane followed [a stream of people entering [the Abbey]2150-the abbey]2149-a stream of people entering the abbey through the north transept . Perhaps it was fever . [His]2125-consumptives hands burnt .

" _ [My]2125-consumptives soul doth magnify [the Lord]3159-the lord , and [my]2125-consumptives spirit hath rejoiced in [God]176-god [[my]2125-consumptives Saviour]3909-my saviour ! _ "[2125-consumptives]

" [I]2125-consumptives am what [I]2125-consumptives conceive [myself]2125-consumptives to be -- who can prove [me]2125-consumptives to be anything else ? What am [I]2125-consumptives then ! Then , suddenly , a face , [a woman]3156-a woman 's pretty face , in the benches of [the north transept]2162-the north transept , caught [his]2125-consumptives eye , and with a leap , as of something unchained , the beast within [him]2125-consumptives awoke . It had reminded [him]2125-consumptives of [Rachel]129-rachel ; and therewith the decent memories of the distant past disappeared , engulfed by the seething , ugly , mud - stained present . [He]2125-consumptives was again crouching on [the hill]369-the hill - side , in the shelter of the holly , watching the scene within : [Rachel]129-rachel in [that man]3736-that man 's arms ! [He]2125-consumptives remembered [his]2125-consumptives own backward start of alarm , as [Ellesborough]149-ellesborough suddenly turned and walked towards the window . [He]2125-consumptives had allowed [himself]2125-consumptives , in [his]2125-consumptives eagerness to see , to press too near . [He]2125-consumptives had exposed [himself]2125-consumptives ? [He]2125-consumptives did not really believe that [he]2125-consumptives had been discovered -- unless [the American]1090-the american was [an uncommonly cool hand]2182-an uncommonly cool hand ! But as [he]2125-consumptives sat panting there , on the fringe of the wood , [he]2125-consumptives had fancied voices and the flash of a light in [the hollow beneath [him]2125-consumptives]2186-the hollow beneath him . These slight signs of movement , however , had quickly disappeared . Darkness and silence resumed possession of [the farm]345-the farm , and [he]2125-consumptives had had no difficulty in finding [his]2125-consumptives way unmolested through the trees to [the main road]1450-the main road , and to [the little town]2189-the little town , five miles nearer to [London]11-london than [Millsborough]43-millsborough , at which [he]2125-consumptives had taken [a room]2190-a room , under [his]2125-consumptives present name of [Wilson]231-wilson .

[The wooded common]2191-the wooded common , indeed , with [its]2191-the wooded common high , withered bracken , together with [the hills encircling [the farm]345-the farm]2192-the hills encircling the farm , had been the cover from which [he]2125-consumptives had carried out [his]2125-consumptives prying campaign upon [[his]2125-consumptives former wife]2194-his former wife . As [he]2125-consumptives sat or knelt , mechanically , under the high and shadowy spaces of [the Abbey]2150-the abbey , [his]2125-consumptives mind filled with excited recollections of that other evening when , after tearing [his]2125-consumptives hand badly on some barbed wire surrounding one of [Colonel Shepherd]124-colonel shepherd 's game preserves , so that it bled profusely , and [he]2125-consumptives had nothing to bandage it with , [he]2125-consumptives had suddenly become aware of voices behind [him]2125-consumptives , and of [a large party of [men in khaki -- Canadian foresters]2197-men in khaki -- canadian foresters]2196-a large party of men in khaki -- canadian foresters , by the look of [them]2196-a large party of men in khaki -- canadian foresters , from [the Ralstone timber camp]2198-the ralstone timber camp , advancing , at some distance , in a long extended line through the trees ; so that [they]2196-a large party of men in khaki -- canadian foresters were bound to come upon [him]2125-consumptives if [he]2125-consumptives remained in the wood . [He]2125-consumptives turned back at once , faced the barbed wire again , with renewed damage both to clothes and hands , and ran , crouching , down [the green road leading to [the farm]345-the farm]2199-the green road leading to the farm , [his]2125-consumptives wound bleeding as [he]2125-consumptives ran . Then [he]2125-consumptives had perceived [an old labourer]2201-an old labourer making for [him]2125-consumptives with shouts . But under the shelter of [the cart - shed]424-the cart - shed , [he]2125-consumptives had first succeeded in tying [his]2125-consumptives handkerchief so tightly round [his]2125-consumptives wrist , with [his]2125-consumptives teeth and one hand , as to check the bleeding , which was beginning to make [him]2125-consumptives feel faint . Then , creeping round the back of [the farm]345-the farm , [he]2125-consumptives saw that the upper half of the stable door was open , and leaping over it , [he]2125-consumptives had hidden among the horses , just as [Halsey]207-mrs. halsey came past in pursuit . [The old man]292-the old man -- confound [him!--had]2125-consumptives made the circuit of [the farm]345-the farm , and had then gone up [the grass road]3698-the grass road to [the hill]369-the hill . [Delane]179-delane , looking out from [the dark stable]2208-the dark stable , had been able to watch [him]2125-consumptives through the dusk , keeping an eye the while to the opposite door opening on [the farm - yard]430-the farm - yard . But [the labourer]465-the labourer disappeared , and in [the dark roomy stable]2211-the dark roomy stable , with [its]2211-the dark roomy stable beamed roof , nothing could be heard but the champing and slow tramping movements of the splendid cart - horses . [Rachel]129-rachel 's horses ! [Delane]179-delane passed [his]2125-consumptives free hand over two of [them]2212-them , and [they]2212-them turned [their]2212-them stately heads and nosed [him]2125-consumptives in a quiet way . Then [he]2125-consumptives vaulted again over the half door , and hurried up [the hill]369-the hill , in the gathering darkness .

[He]2125-consumptives was aware of the ghost - story . [He]2125-consumptives had heard it and the story of the murder from [a man cutting bracken on [the common]3647-the common]2214-a man cutting bracken on the common ; and [he]2125-consumptives had already formed some vague notions of making use of it for the blackmailing of [Rachel]129-rachel . It amused [him]2125-consumptives to think that perhaps [his]2125-consumptives sudden disappearance would lead to a new chapter of the old tale .

Then at the recollection of [Rachel]129-rachel 's prosperity and peace , of [her]129-rachel sleek horses and cows , [her]129-rachel huge hay and corn stacks , [[her]129-rachel comfortable home]2216-her comfortable home , and [[her]129-rachel new lover]2217-her new lover , a fresh shudder of rage and hatred gripped [him]2125-consumptives . [She]129-rachel had once been [his]2125-consumptives thing -- [[his]2125-consumptives chattel]2218-his chattel ; [he]2125-consumptives seemed to see [her]129-rachel white neck and breast , [her]129-rachel unbound hair on the pillow beside [him]2125-consumptives -- and [she]129-rachel had escaped [him]2125-consumptives , and danced on [him]2125-consumptives .

Of course [she]129-rachel had betrayed [him]2125-consumptives -- of course [she]129-rachel had had [a lover]1652-a lover ! What other explanation was there of [her]129-rachel turning against him?--of [her]129-rachel flight from [[his]2125-consumptives house]2220-his house ? But [she]129-rachel had been clever enough to hide all the traces of it . [He]2125-consumptives recalled [his]2125-consumptives own lame and baffled attempts to get hold of some evidence against [her]129-rachel , with gnashing of teeth ....

Dempsey]235-dempsey did not find [Rachel Henderson]129-rachel at [home]3185-home when [he]235-dempsey called at [Great End Farm]3152-great end farm , after [his]235-dempsey meeting with [[his]235-dempsey unknown companion]2273-his unknown companion on [the common]3647-the common .

[Ellesborough]149-ellesborough and [Rachel]129-rachel had gone to [London]11-london for the day . [Ellesborough]149-ellesborough 's duties at [the Ralstone camp]1973-the ralstone camp were in a state of suspended animation , since , in these expectant days before the signing of the armistice , there had been a general slackening , as though by silent and general consent , in the timber felling due to the war throughout [the beautiful district in which [Millsborough]43-millsborough]2276-the beautiful district in which millsborough lay . Enough damage had been done already to [the great wood - sanctuaries]2277-the great wood - sanctuaries . On one pretext or another [men]3205-men held [their]3205-men hands .

[Ellesborough]149-ellesborough then was free to take time off when [he]149-ellesborough would , and to spend it in love - making . The engagement had been announced , and [Ellesborough]149-ellesborough believed [himself]149-ellesborough [a very happy man]2279-a very happy man -- with the slight drawbacks that may be imagined .

In the first place -- although , as [he]149-ellesborough became better acquainted with [Rachel]129-rachel 's varying moods and aspects , [he]149-ellesborough fell more and more deeply under the charm of [her]129-rachel temperament -- a temperament at once passionate and childish , crude , and subtle , with many signs , fugitive and surprising , of a deep and tragic reflectiveness ; [he]149-ellesborough became also more and more conscious of what seemed to [him]149-ellesborough the lasting effects upon [her]129-rachel of [her]129-rachel miserable marriage . The nervous effects above all ; shown by the vague " fears "[129-rachel] of which [she]129-rachel had spoken to [him]149-ellesborough , on one of [their]2280-their early walks together ; and by the gulfs of depression and silence into which [she]129-rachel would often fall , after periods of high , even wild spirits .

It was this constant perception of a state of nervous suffering and irritability in [this splendid physical creature]2281-this splendid physical creature -- a state explained , as [he]149-ellesborough thought , by [her]129-rachel story , which had put [him]149-ellesborough instantly on [his]149-ellesborough guard , when that sinister vision at the window had sprung for a moment out of the darkness . Before almost [he]149-ellesborough could move towards it , it had gone . And with a farewell smile at [the woman [he]149-ellesborough had just been holding in [his]149-ellesborough arms]2282-the woman he had just been holding in his arms , a smile which betrayed nothing , [he]149-ellesborough had hurried away from [her]129-rachel to investigate the mystery . A hasty word to [Janet Leighton]131-janet in [the kitchen]3239-the kitchen , and [he]149-ellesborough was making a rapid circuit of [the farm]345-the farm , and searching [the farm - yard]430-the farm - yard ; with no results whatever .

Then [he]149-ellesborough , [Janet]131-janet , and [Hastings]127-miss henderson had held a hurried and secret colloquy in a corner of [the great cow - shed]2286-the great cow - shed , as far from [Rachel]129-rachel 's sight and hearing as possible . Clearly [some one]2287-some one was haunting [the farm]345-the farm for some malicious purpose . [Hastings]127-miss henderson , for the first time , told the story of the blood - marks , and of two or three other supposed visions of [a man , tall and stooping , with a dark sallow face , which [persons working on [the farm]345-the farm , or walking near it on [the hill]369-the hill]2290-persons working on the farm , or walking near it on the hill]2289-a man , tall and stooping , with a dark sallow face , which persons working on the farm , or walking near it on the hill , had either seen or imagined . [Ellesborough]149-ellesborough finally had jumped on [his]149-ellesborough motor - bicycle and ridden off to [the police depot at [Millsborough]43-millsborough]2293-the police depot at millsborough . [They]1861-the police were inclined to believe that [some half - witted person]2298-some half - witted person was concerned , drawn , perhaps , from the alien population which had been floating through [the district]2237-the district , and bent on mischief or robbery -- or a mixture of both .

[Rachel]129-rachel meanwhile knew nothing of these consultations . After [her]129-rachel engagement was made public , [she]129-rachel began to look so white , so tired and tremulous , that both [Ellesborough]149-ellesborough and [Janet]131-janet were alarmed . Overwork , according to [Janet]131-janet , with the threshing , and in [the potato - fields]2300-the potato - fields . Never had [Rachel]129-rachel worked with such a feverish energy as in these autumn weeks . Add the excitement of an engagement , said [Janet]131-janet , and [you]2301-you see the result .

[She]129-rachel would have prescribed bed and rest ; but [Rachel]129-rachel scouted the advice . The alternative was amusement -- change of scene -- in [[Ellesborough]149-ellesborough 's company]2302-ellesborough 's company . Here [she]129-rachel was more docile , feverishly submissive and happy , indeed , so long as [Ellesborough]149-ellesborough made the plans , and [Ellesborough]149-ellesborough watched over [her]129-rachel . [Janet]131-janet wondered at certain profound changes in [her]129-rachel . It was , [she]131-janet saw , the first real passion of [Rachel]129-rachel 's life .

So [Dempsey]235-dempsey called in vain . [Miss Henderson]127-miss henderson was in [town]450-town for [a theatre]2304-a theatre and shopping . " [I]131-janet 'll ask [Miss Henderson]127-miss henderson , "[131-janet] said [Janet]131-janet , moving towards the door , as a signal to [him]235-dempsey to take [his]235-dempsey leave . " But [I]131-janet expect [you]235-dempsey 're confusing [her]127-miss henderson with [some one else]3969-some one else . "[131-janet]

[Dempsey]235-dempsey , however , began rather eagerly to dot the [i]0-i 's . The picture of the snowstorm , of [the woman at the door]2310-the woman at the door , various points in [his]235-dempsey description of [her]2310-the woman at the door , and of [the solitary -- apparently bachelor -- owner of [the farm]345-the farm]2311-the solitary -- apparently bachelor -- owner of the farm , began to affect [Janet]131-janet uncomfortably . [She]131-janet got rid of the chatter - box as soon as possible , and went slowly to [the kitchen]3239-the kitchen , to get supper ready . As [she]131-janet fried the bacon , and took some vegetables out of the hay - box , [she]131-janet was thinking fast .

[Tanner]201-tanner ? No -- [she]131-janet had never heard [Rachel]129-rachel mention the name . But it happened that [Dempsey]235-dempsey had given a precise date . It was in the " November before [they]2315-they Passed [Conscription]88-conscription "[235-dempsey] in [Canada]13-canada , _ i.e. _ before [he]235-dempsey [himself]235-dempsey was called up -- that [he]235-dempsey saw [Mrs. Delane]179-delane , at night , in [[Dick Tanner]201-tanner 's house]2314-dick tanner 's house . And [Janet]131-janet remembered that , according to the story which as [they]2315-they two sat by the fire alone at night , when [the girls]3326-the girls were gone to bed , [Rachel]129-rachel had gradually built up before [her]179-delane . It was in that same month that [Rachel]129-rachel had been deserted by [Delane]179-delane ; who had gone off to [British Columbia]36-british columbia with [the Italian girl]3804-the italian girl , as [[his]235-dempsey wife]466-his wife afterwards knew , leaving [Rachel]129-rachel alone on [the farm]345-the farm -- with [one Japanese servant]2320-one japanese servant .

Why should n't [she]129-rachel have been staying on [[Mr. Tanner]201-tanner 's farm]2321-mr. tanner 's farm ? There was no doubt [some one else there]2322-some one else there -- whom [the boy]901-the boy did n't see . Perhaps [she]129-rachel had [herself]129-rachel taken refuge [there]377-there during the storm . But all the same [Janet]131-janet felt vaguely troubled .

* * * * *

It was nearly seven o'clock , and the moon , now at the full , was rising over [the eastern hill]2325-the eastern hill , and balancing the stubbles and the new - turned plough - lands in [the upland]2326-the upland cup to a pearly whiteness as [they]2327-they lay under [the dark woods]2328-the dark woods and a fleecy sky . There was a sound of [a motor]2329-a motor in [the lane]1516-the lane -- [the village]304-the village taxi bringing [the travellers]2332-the travellers [home]3185-home .

In a few more minutes [they]2327-they were in [the sitting - room]447-the sitting - room , [Rachel]129-rachel throwing off [her]129-rachel thick coat with [Ellesborough]149-ellesborough 's help , and declaring that [she]129-rachel was not the least tired .

" Do n't believe [her]129-rachel ! "[149-ellesborough] said [Ellesborough]149-ellesborough , smiling at [Janet]131-janet . " [She]129-rachel is not [a truthful woman]3970-a truthful woman ! "[149-ellesborough]

And [his]149-ellesborough proud eyes returned to [Rachel]129-rachel as though now that there was light to see [her]129-rachel by [he]149-ellesborough had no other use for [them]2335-them .

[Rachel]129-rachel , indeed , was in a radiant mood . Pallor and depression had vanished ; [she]129-rachel was full of chatter about [the streets]1248-the streets , [the crowds]2337-the crowds , [the shops]2338-the shops .

" But it 's hopeless to go shopping with [a man]3155-a man ! [He]3155-a man ca n't make up [his]3155-a man mind one bit ! "[129-rachel]

" [He]3155-a man had n't a mind to make up ! "[149-ellesborough] murmured [Ellesborough]149-ellesborough , looking up at [her]129-rachel as [she]129-rachel perched above [him]149-ellesborough on a corner of the table .

[She]129-rachel laughed .

" That , [I]129-rachel suppose , was what made [him]3155-a man want to buy [the whole place]3972-the whole place ! If [I]129-rachel 'd taken [his]3155-a man advice , [Janet]131-janet , [I]129-rachel should have been just cleaned out ! "[129-rachel]

" What 's the good of being economical when [one]279-one 's going to be married ! "[149-ellesborough] said [Ellesborough]149-ellesborough , joyously . " Why-- "[149-ellesborough]

[Rachel]129-rachel interrupted [him]149-ellesborough -- with a hand on [his]149-ellesborough shoulder .

" And [we]3974-we 've settled [our]3974-we plans , [Janet]131-janet -- that is , if [you]131-janet 're agreeable . Will [you]131-janet mind looking after [the farm]345-the farm for six months ? "[129-rachel]

" [You]129-rachel see , if the armistice is signed -- and [we]3974-we shall know to - morrow , "[149-ellesborough] said [Ellesborough]149-ellesborough , " [I]149-ellesborough shall be free in a month or so , and then [we]3974-we propose to marry and get a passage before Christmas . [I]149-ellesborough must go [home]3185-home , and [she]131-janet says [she]131-janet 'll come with [me]149-ellesborough ! "[149-ellesborough]

A shadow had fallen suddenly , it seemed to [Janet]131-janet , over [Rachel]129-rachel 's aspect , but [she]131-janet at once endorsed what [Ellesborough]149-ellesborough had said .

" [We]3974-we ca n't settle things -- can we?--till [we]3974-we 've seen [[his]149-ellesborough people]1196-his people . [We]3974-we 've got to decide whether [I]149-ellesborough 'll go to [America]33-america , or [he]149-ellesborough 'll come here . "[149-ellesborough]

" But [we]3974-we want to say"--Ellesborough[149-ellesborough] turned gravely to [Janet--"that]131-janet first and foremost , [we]3974-we wish to do the best for [you]131-janet . "[149-ellesborough]

The sudden tears came into [Janet]131-janet 's eyes . But they did not show .

" Oh , that 'll be all right . Do n't bother about [me]149-ellesborough . "[149-ellesborough]

" [We]3974-we shall bother ! "[129-rachel] said [Rachel]129-rachel with energy , " but [I]129-rachel 'll tell [you]149-ellesborough all about it presently . [He]149-ellesborough wo n't stay to supper . "[129-rachel]

[She]129-rachel descended from the table , and [Ellesborough]149-ellesborough rose . After a little more chat about the day and its doings , [he]149-ellesborough said good - night to [Janet]131-janet .

" How do [you]131-janet get back ? "[149-ellesborough]

" Oh , [I]131-janet left [my]131-janet bike in [the village]304-the village . [I]131-janet shall walk and pick it up there . "[131-janet]

[Rachel]129-rachel took up [her]129-rachel thick coat and slipped it on again . [She]131-janet would walk with [him]149-ellesborough to [the road]3145-the road , [she]131-janet said -- there were some more things to say .

[Janet]131-janet watched [them]2340-them go out into the wide frosty night , where the sky was shedding its clouds , and the temperature was falling rapidly . [She]131-janet realized that [they]2340-them were in that stage of passion when everything is unreal outside the one supreme thing , and all other life passes like a show half - seen . And all the while the name [Tanner]201-tanner -- [Dick Tanner]201-tanner -- echoed in [her]131-janet mind . Such a simple thing to put a careless question to [Rachel]129-rachel ! Yet perhaps -- after all -- not so simple .

Meanwhile [the two lovers]2341-the two lovers were together on the path through the stubbles , walking hand - in - hand through the magic of the moonlight .

" Will [you]149-ellesborough write a little line to [[my]131-janet mother]3503-my mother to - morrow ? "[131-janet]

" Yes , of course . But-- "[131-janet]

[He]149-ellesborough caught [her]131-janet long breath .

" [I]149-ellesborough have prepared the way , [darling]3832-darling . [I]149-ellesborough promise [you]3832-darling -- it will be all right . "[149-ellesborough]

" But why -- why -- didn't [I]131-janet see [you]149-ellesborough first ? "[131-janet] It was a stifled cry , which seemed somehow to speak for [them]2341-the two lovers both . And [she]131-janet added , bitterly , " It 's no good talking -- it ca n't ever be the same -- to [you]149-ellesborough , or to [[your]149-ellesborough people]3439-your people . "[131-janet]

" It shall be the same ! Or rather , [we]2341-the two lovers shall owe [you]149-ellesborough a double share of love to make up to [you]149-ellesborough -- for that horrible time . Forget it , [dear]3609-dear -- make [yourself]149-ellesborough forget it . [[My]131-janet mother]3503-my mother would tell [you]149-ellesborough so at once . "[131-janet]

" Is n't [she]3503-my mother -- very strict about divorce ? "[131-janet]

[Ellesborough]149-ellesborough hesitated -- just a moment .

" [She]3503-my mother could n't have any doubts about [your]149-ellesborough case -- [dearest]3984-dearest -- who could ? [You]149-ellesborough fell among [thieves]3985-thieves , and-- "[131-janet]

" And [you]149-ellesborough 're picking [me]149-ellesborough up , and taking [me]149-ellesborough to [the inn]3986-the inn ? "[149-ellesborough]

[He]149-ellesborough pressed [her]2342-she hand passionately . [They]2343-they walked in silence till the gate appeared .

" Go back , [dearest]3984-dearest . [I]131-janet shall be over on Sunday . "[131-janet]

" Not till then ? "[149-ellesborough]

" [I]131-janet 'm afraid not . If the peace news comes tomorrow , [the camp'll]3988-the camp'll go mad , and [I]131-janet shall have to look after [them]3988-the camp'll . "[131-janet]

[They]2343-they paused at the gate , and [he]149-ellesborough kissed [her]2342-she . [She]2342-she lay passive in [his]149-ellesborough arms , the moonlight touched [her]2342-she brown hair , and the beautiful curves of [her]2342-she cheek and throat .

" Was n't it heavenly to - day ? "[2342-she] [she]2342-she whispered .

" Heavenly ! Go [home]3185-home ! "[149-ellesborough]

[She]2342-she turned back towards [the farm]345-the farm , drawing [her]2342-she cloak and its fur collar close round [her]2342-she , against the cold . And indeed [Ellesborough]149-ellesborough was no sooner gone , the rush of the motor cycle along [the distant road]2345-the distant road had no sooner died away , than a shiver ran through [her]2342-she which was more than physical . So long as [he]149-ellesborough was there , [she]2342-she was happy , excited , hopeful . And when [he]149-ellesborough was not [there]377-there , the protecting screen had fallen , and [she]2342-she was exposed to all the stress and terror of the storm raging in [her]2342-she own mind .

" Why ca n't [I]2342-she forget it all--_everything _ ! It 's dead--_it 's dead _ ! "[2342-she] [she]2342-she said to [herself]2342-she again and again in an anguish , as [she]2342-she walked back through [the broad open field]2347-the broad open field where the winter - sown corn was just springing in the furrows -- the moon was so bright that [she]2342-she could see the tiny green spears of it .

And yet in reality [she]2342-she perfectly understood why it was that , instead of forgetting , memory was becoming more and more poignant , more and more persecuting . It was because the searching processes of love were going deeper and deeper into [her]2342-she inmost soul . [This good man who loved [her]2342-she , who was going to take [her]2342-she injured life into [his]149-ellesborough keeping , to devote to [her]2342-she all [his]149-ellesborough future , and all the harvest of [his]149-ellesborough upright and hard - working past]2348-this good man who loved her , who was going to take her injured life into his keeping , to devote to her all his future , and all the harvest of his upright and hard - working past -- [she]2342-she was going to marry [him]149-ellesborough with a lie between [them]2349-them , so that [she]2342-she could never look [him]149-ellesborough straight in the face , never be certain that , sometime or other , something would not emerge like a drowned face from the dark , and ruin all [their]2349-them happiness . It had seemed , at the beginning , so easy to keep silence , to tell everything but the one miserable fact that [she]2342-she could n't tell ! And now it was getting intolerably hard , just because [she]2342-she knew for the first time what love really meant , with its ardour for self - revelation , for an absolute union with [the beloved]2350-the beloved . By marrying [him]149-ellesborough without confession , [she]2342-she would not only be wronging [him]149-ellesborough , [she]2342-she would be laying up probable misery for [herself]2342-she -- and [him]149-ellesborough -- through the mere action of [her]2342-she own temperament .

For [she]2342-she knew [herself]2342-she . Among [the girls]3326-the girls and [women]3203-women [she]2342-she had been thrown with during the preceding year and a half , there were [some moral anarchists]2353-some moral anarchists , with whose views [she]2342-she had become strikingly familiar . Why , [they]2353-some moral anarchists said , make so much of these physical facts ? Accept them , and the incidents that spring from them . Why all this weeping and wailing over supposed shames and disgraces ? The sex - life of the present is making its own new codes . Who knows what [they]2353-some moral anarchists will ultimately be ? And as for the indelible traces and effects of an act of weakness or passion that [the sentimental and goody - goody people]2354-the sentimental and goody - goody people talk of , in the majority of cases [they]2354-the sentimental and goody - goody people do n't exist . After it , [the human being concerned]2355-the human being concerned may be just the same as before .

[Rachel]129-rachel was quite aware of this modern gospel . Only [she]2342-she was shut out from adopting it in [her]2342-she own case by an invincible heredity , by the spirit of [[her]2342-she father]735-her father in [her]2342-she , [the saintly old preacher , whose uncompromising faith [she]2342-she had witnessed and shared through all [her]2342-she young years]2357-the saintly old preacher , whose uncompromising faith she had witnessed and shared through all her young years . [She]2342-she might and did protest that the faith was no longer [hers]2342-she . But it had stamped [her]2342-she . [She]2342-she could never be wholly rid of its prejudices and repulsions . What would [[her]2342-she father]735-her father have said to [her]2342-she divorce?--he with [his]735-her father mystical conception of marriage ? [She]2342-she dreaded to think . And as to that other fact which weighed on [her]2342-she conscience , [she]2342-she seemed to hear [herself]2342-she pleading -- with tears!--"Father!--it was n't [my]2342-she will -- it was [my]2342-she _ weakness_!--Don't look at [me]2342-she so ! "[2342-she]

And now , in addition , there was the pressure upon [her]2342-she of [Ellesborough]149-ellesborough 's own high ideals and religious temper ; of the ideals , also , of [[his]735-her father family]2359-his family , as [he]735-her father was tenderly and unconsciously revealing them . And , finally , there was the daily influence of [[Janet]131-janet 's neighbourhood]2360-janet 's neighbourhood -- [Janet]131-janet , so austere for [herself]131-janet , so pitiful for [others]1797-others : [Janet]131-janet , so like [Ellesborough]149-ellesborough in the unconscious sternness of [her]131-janet moral outlook , so full , besides , of an infinite sorrow for [the sinner]2362-the sinner .

And between these two stood [this variable , sensuous , woman]2363-this variable , sensuous , woman 's nature , so capable both of good and evil . [Rachel]129-rachel felt the burden of [their]2364-their virtues too much for [her]129-rachel , together with the sting of [her]129-rachel own secret knowledge .

In some moments , even , [she]129-rachel rebelled against [her]129-rachel own passion . [She]129-rachel had such a moment of revolt , in this moonlit dark , as [her]129-rachel eyes took in [the farm]345-the farm , the dim outlines of [the farm buildings]376-the farm buildings , the stacks , the new - ploughed furrows . Two months earlier [her]129-rachel life had been absorbed in simple , clear , practical ambitions : how to improve [her]129-rachel stock -- how to grow another bushel to the acre -- how and when to build [a silo]2367-a silo -- whether to try electrification : a score of pleasant riddles that made the hours fly . And now this old fever had crept again into [her]129-rachel blood , and everything had lost its savour . There were times when [she]129-rachel bitterly , childishly , regretted it . [She]129-rachel could almost have hated [Ellesborough]149-ellesborough , because [she]129-rachel loved [him]149-ellesborough so well ; and because of the terror , the ceaseless preoccupation that [her]129-rachel love had begun to impose upon [her]129-rachel .

[Janet]131-janet , watching [her]129-rachel come in , saw that the radiance had departed , and that [she]129-rachel crept about again like [a tired woman]2368-a tired woman . When , after nine o'clock , [they]2369-they were alone by the fire , again and again it was on the tip of [Janet]131-janet 's tongue to say , " Tell [me]131-janet , who was [Dick Tanner]201-tanner ? "[131-janet] Then , in a sudden panic fear , lest the words should slip out , and bring something irreparable , [she]129-rachel would get up , and make a restless pretence of some household work or other , only to sit down and begin the same inward debate once more . But [she]129-rachel said nothing , and [Rachel]129-rachel , too , was silent . [She]129-rachel sat over the fire , apparently half asleep . [Neither of [them]2369-they]2005-neither of them moved to go to bed till nearly midnight .

Then [they]2369-they kissed [each other]460-each other , and [Janet]131-janet raked out the fire .

" To - morrow ! "[131-janet] [she]131-janet said , [her]131-janet eyes on the red glow of the embers , " _ to - morrow_!--Will it be peace ? "[131-janet]

And then [Rachel]129-rachel remembered that [all the civilized world]2372-all the civilized world was waiting for the words that would end the war . Somewhere in [a French chÃ¢teau]2373-a french chÃ¢teau there was [a group of men]2374-a group of men conferring , and on the issue of this night depended the lives of [thousands]2375-thousands , and the peace of [Europe]46-europe .

[Janet]131-janet raised [her]131-janet clasped hands , and [her]131-janet plain , quiet face shone in the candle - light . [She]131-janet murmured something . [Rachel]129-rachel guessed it was a prayer . But [her]129-rachel own heart seemed dead and dumb . [She]129-rachel could not free [it]2376-it from its load of personal care ; [she]129-rachel could not feel the patriotic emotion which had suddenly seized on [Janet]131-janet .

The morning broke grey and misty . [The two labourers]2377-the two labourers and [the girls]3326-the girls went about [their]2379-their work -- raising [their]2379-their heads now and then to listen . And at eleven came the signal . Out rang the bells from [Ipscombe Church tower]89-ipscombe church tower . [Labourers]358-labourers and [girls]3223-girls threw down what [they]2379-their were doing , and gathered in [the farm - yard]430-the farm - yard round [Janet]131-janet and [Rachel]129-rachel , who were waving flags on the steps of [the farm - house]675-the farm - house . Then [Rachel]129-rachel gave [them]2379-their all a holiday for the rest of the day , and very soon there was [no one]570-no one left on [the farm premises]2385-the farm premises but [the two women]763-the two women and [the bailiff]398-the bailiff .

" Do n't stay , [Hastings]127-miss henderson , "[129-rachel] said [Rachel]129-rachel . " [I]129-rachel 'll get the horse and [cart]3990-cart [myself]129-rachel . "[129-rachel]

For it was market day at [Millsborough]43-millsborough , and peace or no peace , [she]129-rachel had some business that must be done [there]377-there .

" Oh , [I]127-miss henderson 've no call to go , [Miss]3991-miss , "[127-miss henderson] said [Hastings]127-miss henderson . " [I]127-miss henderson 'd rather stay and look after things . "[127-miss henderson]

[His]2389-his eyes met [Janet]131-janet 's , and [she]131-janet nodded imperceptibly . [She]131-janet was relieved to think of [Hastings]127-miss henderson -- [good , faithful , unassuming creature!--remaining on guard]2390-good , faithful , unassuming creature!--remaining on guard . The very desertion of [the farm - houses]2391-the farm - houses on this great day might tempt [marauders]2392-marauders -- especially [that thief or madman who had been haunting [[their]2392-marauders own premises]2394-their own premises]2393-that thief or madman who had been haunting their own premises . [She]131-janet hoped [the police]1861-the police would not forget [them]2392-marauders either . But [Hastings]127-miss henderson ' offer to stay till [the girls]3326-the girls came back from the [Millsborough]43-millsborough crowds and bands at about nine o'clock quite eased [her]131-janet mind . And meanwhile [she]131-janet and [Hastings]127-miss henderson , as had been agreed , kept [their]2392-marauders anxieties from [Rachel]129-rachel .

[Rachel]129-rachel went off at twelve o'clock in [her]129-rachel khaki suit , driving a spirited young horse in [a high cart]2397-a high cart , which was filled with farm produce . [She]129-rachel was to take early dinner with [some new friends]2398-some new friends , and then to go and look at a Jersey cow which [Janet]131-janet coveted , in [a farm on the other side of [Millsborough]43-millsborough]2399-a farm on the other side of millsborough .

" Do n't wait tea for [me]129-rachel , "[129-rachel] [she]129-rachel said to [Janet]131-janet , " [I]129-rachel shall get some somewhere . "[129-rachel] And then with a smile to [them]2392-marauders both [she]129-rachel was off . [Janet]131-janet stood looking after [her]129-rachel , lost in a painful uncertainty . " Ca n't [you]129-rachel let it alone ? "[131-janet] [Lord Melbourne]236-lord melbourne was accustomed to say suavely to [those members of [the Cabinet]2401-the cabinet who brought [him]236-lord melbourne grievances or scandals that wanted seeing to]2400-those members of the cabinet who brought him grievances or scandals that wanted seeing to . One half of [Janet]131-janet 's mind was saying , " Ca n't [you]129-rachel let it alone ? "[131-janet] to the other half .

XI

The daylight had all gone when [Rachel]129-rachel at last got into [[her]129-rachel cart]2402-her cart in [the yard of the Rose and Thistle]2403-the yard of the rose and thistle at [Millsborough]43-millsborough and took the reins . But there was a faint moonrise struggling through the mist in which [the little town]2189-the little town and countryside were shrouded . And in [the town]3456-the town , with [its]3456-the town laughing and singing crowds , [its]3456-the town bright shop windows , [its]3456-the town moist , straggling flags , the mist , lying gently over [the old houses]2406-the old houses , [the moving people]2407-the moving people , the flashes and streamers of light , was extraordinarily romantic and beautifying .

[Rachel]129-rachel drove slowly through [the streets]1248-the streets , delighting in the noise and excitement , in the sheer new pleasure of everything , [the world]474-the world -- [human beings]2410-human beings -- living -- the end of the war . And out among [the fields]3144-the fields , and in [the country road]2412-the country road , the November sun was still beautiful ; what with the pearly mist , and the purple shapes of [the forest - covered hills]2413-the forest - covered hills . [She]129-rachel had been much made of in [Millsborough]43-millsborough . [People]880-people were anxious to talk to [her]129-rachel , to invite [her]129-rachel , to do business with [her]129-rachel . [Her]129-rachel engagement , [she]129-rachel perceived , had made [her]129-rachel doubly interesting . [She]129-rachel was going to be prosperous , to succeed -- and all [the world]474-the world smiled upon [her]129-rachel .

So that [her]129-rachel pulses were running fast as [she]129-rachel reached [Ipscombe]12-ipscombe , where , in the mild fog , [a few groups]2416-a few groups were standing about , and a few doors were open . And now -- there was home!--in front of [her]129-rachel . And -- Heavens ! what had [Janet]131-janet done ? [Rachel]129-rachel pulled up the horse , and sat enchanted , looking at [the farm]345-the farm . For [there]377-there [it]345-the farm lay , pricked out in light , [its]345-the farm old Georgian lines against the background of [the hill]369-the hill . Every window had a light in it -- every blind was drawn up -- it was [Janet]131-janet 's illumination for the peace . [She]131-janet had made of [the old house]2420-the old house " [an insubstantial faery place]3992-an insubstantial faery place , "[131-janet] and [Rachel]129-rachel laughed for pleasure .

Then [she]129-rachel drove eagerly on into [the dark tunnel of trees that lay between [her]129-rachel and [the house]337-the house]2421-the dark tunnel of trees that lay between her and the house .

Suddenly a shape rushed out of the hedge into the light of the lamps , and [a man]3155-a man laid a violent hand upon the horse 's reins . The horse reared , and [Rachel]129-rachel cried out,--

" What are [you]3153-the man doing ? Let go ! "[129-rachel]

But [the man]3153-the man held the struggling horse , at once coercing and taming it , with an expert hand . A voice!--that sent a sudden horror through [Rachel,--]237-rachel,--

" Sit where [you]3153-the man are -- hold tight!--don't be a fool!--he'll quiet down . "[237-rachel,--]

[She]129-rachel sat paralysed ; and , still holding the reins , though the trembling horse was now quiet , [a man]3155-a man advanced into the light of the left - hand lamp .

[She]129-rachel struggled for breath and self - control .

[Rachel]129-rachel climbed the little slope to the front door . [It]2478-it seemed an Alp . " Shall [I]129-rachel be like that when [I]129-rachel 'm old ? "[129-rachel]

[She]129-rachel took off [her]129-rachel things , and changed mechanically into an afternoon dress , [her]129-rachel mind , like a hunted thing , running hither and thither all the time .

Presently [she]129-rachel got up and locked the door . [She]129-rachel must think--_think_--by [herself]129-rachel .

It would be quite easy to defy [Roger]179-delane -- quite easy to lie , and lie successfully , if only [she]129-rachel was sure of [herself]129-rachel , and [her]129-rachel own will to carry things through . [Roger]179-delane could prove nothing -- or [that vulgar boy]2483-that vulgar boy -- or [anybody]3236-anybody . [She]129-rachel had only to say , " [I]129-rachel went to find [Lucy Tanner]242-lucy tanner , who was [[my]129-rachel friend]4035-my friend -- [she]4035-my friend was n't [there]377-there -- [I]129-rachel was overtaken by the storm -- and [Dick Tanner]201-tanner looked after [me]129-rachel till [I]129-rachel could get [home]3185-home . "[129-rachel]

It was the most natural -- the most plausible story . If [Delane]179-delane forced [himself]179-delane on [George]198-ellesborough with any vile tale , [Ellesborough]198-ellesborough would probably give [him]2483-that vulgar boy in charge for molesting [[his]2483-that vulgar boy former wife]2194-his former wife . There was absolutely nothing to fear , if [she]129-rachel handled the thing in a bold , common - sense way , and told a consistent and clever lie .

And yet , [she]129-rachel had weakly made appointments with both [[her]129-rachel tormentors!--made]2486-her tormentors!--made it plain to [them]2487-them that [she]129-rachel was afraid ! [She]129-rachel called [herself]129-rachel [a coward]3606-a coward , and [a fool]3626-a fool -- and then as [she]129-rachel leant [her]129-rachel head against the side of [her]129-rachel bed , the tears ran down [her]129-rachel face , and [her]129-rachel heart cried out for [Ellesborough]198-ellesborough .

" How _ can _ [I]3626-a fool go on lying to [him]198-ellesborough -- now -- and all [my]3626-a fool life ? "[3626-a fool] It was the same cry as before , but more intense , more passionate with every day 's living . The need for lying had now doubled ; yet [her]129-rachel will could less and less steel itself to it , because of sheer love and remorse towards [the man who loved [her]129-rachel]2490-the man who loved her .

" [He]198-ellesborough would forgive [me]129-rachel . [I]129-rachel know [he]198-ellesborough would -- [I]129-rachel know [he]198-ellesborough would ! "[129-rachel] [she]129-rachel kept on murmuring to [herself]129-rachel , while [her]129-rachel eyes rained in the semi - darkness .

Yes , but it would change everything ! [Their]2491-their love -- [his]198-ellesborough feeling towards [her]129-rachel -- could never be the same again . After [Roger Delane]179-delane -- [Dick Tanner]201-tanner . Why not another -- and another ? Would [he]198-ellesborough not always be watching [her]129-rachel , dreading some new discovery ! Suspecting [her]129-rachel , even while [he]198-ellesborough loved [her]129-rachel ?

No . [She]129-rachel must choke off [Delane]179-delane -- with money -- the only way . And invent some story -- some bribe , too -- for [that odious young man who had caught [her]129-rachel unawares]2492-that odious young man who had caught her unawares .

So again [she]129-rachel hardened [herself]129-rachel , despairingly . It could not be allowed [her]129-rachel -- the balm and luxury of confession ! It was too dangerous . [Her]129-rachel all was in it .

Meanwhile , the singing continued below . [Janet]131-janet had struck up " [Tipperary]92-tipperary , "[131-janet] and the small flute - like voices of [the girls]3326-the girls , supported by [her]131-janet harsher one , mounted joyously through every crevice of [the slightly - built house]2494-the slightly - built house .

" It 's a long , long way to [Tipperary]92-tipperary , And [my]131-janet heart 's right there . "[131-janet]

The beautiful tune , interwoven for [[our]2495-our generation]2496-our generation with all that is most poignant in its life , beat on [Rachel]129-rachel 's nerves . It was being sung all over [England]2-england that Armistice Day , as it had been sung in the first days of the war , joyously , exultingly , yet with catching breath . There was in it more than [thousands of [men]3205-men and [women]3203-women]2497-thousands of men and women dared to probe , whether of joy or sorrow . [They]2497-thousands of men and women sang it , with a sob in the throat . To [Rachel]129-rachel , also , sunk in [her]129-rachel own terrors , it was almost unbearable . The pure unspoilt passion of it -- the careless , confident joy -- seemed to make an outcast of [her]129-rachel , as [she]129-rachel sat there in the dark , dragged back by the shock and horror of [Delane]179-delane 's appearance into the slime and slough of old memories , and struggling with them in vain . Yes , [she]129-rachel was " [damaged goods"--she]4038-damaged goods"--she[129-rachel] was unfit to marry [George Ellesborough]198-ellesborough . But [she]129-rachel would marry [him]198-ellesborough ! [She]129-rachel set [her]129-rachel teeth -- clinging to [him]198-ellesborough with all the energy of [a woman]3156-a woman 's deepening and maturing consciousness . [She]129-rachel had been a weak and self - willed child when [she]129-rachel married [Delane]179-delane -- when [she]129-rachel spent those half miserable , half wild days and nights with [Dick Tanner]201-tanner . Now [she]129-rachel trusted [a good man]2501-a good man -- now [she]129-rachel looked up and adored . [Her]129-rachel weakness was safe in the care of [George Ellesborough]198-ellesborough 's strength . Well , then , let [her]129-rachel fight for [her]129-rachel love .

Presently [Janet]131-janet knocked at the door . The singing [downstairs]1078-downstairs had ceased .

" Are [you]129-rachel tired , [Rachel]129-rachel ? Ca n't [I]131-janet help [you]129-rachel ? "[131-janet]

" Just a bit tired . [I]131-janet 'm resting . [I]131-janet 'll be down directly . "[131-janet]

* * * * *

But the interruption had started fresh anxieties in [her]129-rachel mind . [She]129-rachel had paid the most perfunctory attention to the few words [Janet]131-janet had said about [Dempsey]194-dempsey 's call at [the farm]345-the farm , two nights before . [She]129-rachel understood at the time that [he]194-dempsey had come to chatter about the murder , and was very glad that [she]131-janet had been out of the way .

But now -- what was it that [he]194-dempsey had said to [Janet]131-janet -- and why had [Janet]131-janet said so little about [his]194-dempsey visit ?

Instead of resting [she]129-rachel walked incessantly up and down . This uncertainty about [Janet]131-janet teased [her]129-rachel ; but after all it was nothing to that other mystery -- how did [Roger]179-delane know?--and to the strange and bewildering effect of the juxtaposition of [the two men]1338-the two men -- [their]1338-the two men successive appearance in the darkness within -- what?--ten minutes?--a quarter of an hour?--while the cloud was on [her]129-rachel own brain -- without apparently any connection between [them]1338-the two men -- and relevance to [each other]460-each other . There must have been some connection ! And yet there had been no sign of any personal knowledge of [Roger Delane]179-delane in [Dempsey]194-dempsey 's talk ; and no reference whatever to [Dempsey]194-dempsey in [Delane]179-delane 's .

[She]129-rachel went down to supper , very flushed and on edge . [Little Jenny]131-janet eyed [her]129-rachel surreptitiously . For the first time [the child]662-the child 's raw innocence was disturbed or jealous . What did [John Dempsey]194-dempsey want with calling on [Miss Henderson]127-miss henderson -- and why had [he]194-dempsey made a rather teasing mystery of it to [her]127-miss henderson , [Jenny]131-janet ? " Would n't [you]127-miss henderson like to know , [Miss Inquisitive]243-miss inquisitive ? "[194-dempsey] Yes , [Jenny]131-janet would like to know . Of course [Miss Henderson]127-miss henderson was engaged to [Captain Ellesborough]149-ellesborough , and all that . But that was no reason why [she]129-rachel should carry off [[Jenny]131-janet 's " friend]4039-jenny 's " friend , "[129-rachel] as well as [her]129-rachel own . [Jenny]131-janet 's heart swelled within [her]131-janet as [she]131-janet watched [Miss Henderson]127-miss henderson from the other end of the table . Yes , of course , [she]127-miss henderson was nice - looking , and [her]127-miss henderson clothes were nice . [Jenny]131-janet thought that [she]131-janet would get a new best dress soon , now that peace was come ; and a new hat with a high silk crown to match the dress . [Dempsey]194-dempsey had admired a hat like that on [a girl in [the village]304-the village]2507-a girl in the village . [He]194-dempsey had said it was " real smart . "[194-dempsey] And to be ' smart " [Jenny]131-janet thought was to be happy .[194-dempsey]

After supper , [Janet]131-janet and [the girls]3326-the girls washed up and put all tidy for the night . [Rachel]129-rachel worked at accounts in [the sitting - room]447-the sitting - room . [She]129-rachel had sold the last hay [she]129-rachel had to spare wonderfully well , and potatoes showed a good profit . Threshing charges were very high , and wages -- appalling ! But on the whole , [they]2511-they were doing very well . [Janet]131-janet 's Jersey cow had been expensive , but [they]2511-they could afford [her]131-janet .

[They]2511-they had never yet drawn out so good an interim balance sheet without delight , and rosy dreams for the future . Now [her]131-janet mood was leaden , and [she]131-janet pushed the papers aside impatiently . As [she]131-janet was sitting with [her]131-janet hands round [her]131-janet knees , staring into the fire , or at the chair where [Ellesborough]149-ellesborough had sat while [she]131-janet told [her]131-janet story , [Janet]131-janet came into [the room]431-the room . Then [she]129-rachel came up to the fire . [The two girls]729-the two girls could be heard laughing overhead .

" So [my]129-rachel cow 's a good one ? "[129-rachel] [she]129-rachel said , with [her]129-rachel pleasant voice and smile .

" [A beauty]4040-a beauty , "[129-rachel] said [Rachel]129-rachel , looking up , and recapitulating the points and yield of the Jersey .

[Janet]131-janet gave a shrug -- implying a proper scepticism .

" It does n't seem to be quite as easy to tell lies about cows as about horses , "[131-janet] [she]131-janet said , laughing ; " that 's about all [one]279-one can say . [We]729-the two girls 'll hope for the best . "[131-janet] Then -- after a moment,--

" [I]131-janet never told [you]129-rachel much about [that man]3736-that man [Dempsey]194-dempsey 's visit . Of course [he]3736-that man came to see [you]129-rachel . * * * * *

[Rachel]129-rachel scarcely slept , and the November day broke grey and misty as before . After breakfast [she]129-rachel went out into [the fields]3144-the fields . [He]194-dempsey came up with the same look , half embarrassed , half inclining to laugh , that [he]194-dempsey had worn the day before . [The vicar]3228-the vicar had come [downstairs]1078-downstairs that morning in a mood of depression , irritable -- almost snappish depression . [Miss Shenstone]139-miss shenstone was thin , methodical , devoted ; of small speech and great virtue . [Such persons so securely anchored and self - determined]2560-such persons so securely anchored and self - determined can have but small sympathy for [the drifters of [this world]2562-this world]2561-the drifters of this world . [The vicar]3228-the vicar knew perfectly well that [[his]3228-the vicar sister]1186-his sister was relieved . It was that which had secretly affected a naturally sweet temper .
