[Meanwhile Miss Shenstone]252-meanwhile miss shenstone 's note was duly delivered , and [Rachel]129-rachel , holding it in [her]129-rachel hand , opened the wicket gate .

" Wo n't [you]3228-the vicar come in ? "[129-rachel]

" Oh , no , [I]3228-the vicar must n't waste [your]129-rachel time , "[3228-the vicar] said [the vicar]3228-the vicar , with dignity . " Perhaps [you]129-rachel 'll give [me]3228-the vicar a verbal answer . "[3228-the vicar]

[Rachel]129-rachel opened the note , and [the vicar]3228-the vicar was puzzled by the look which crossed [her]129-rachel face as [she]129-rachel read it . It was a look of relief -- as though something fitted in .

" Very kind of [Lady Alicia]173-lady alicia . Of course [the girls]3326-the girls shall come . [They]3326-the girls will be delighted . [You]129-rachel really wo n't come in ? Then [I]3228-the vicar 'll walk to [the road]3145-the road with [you]129-rachel . "[3228-the vicar]

What was the change in [her]129-rachel ? [The vicar]3228-the vicar perceived something indefinable ; and before [they]2598-they had walked half the distance to [the road]3145-the road [he]3228-the vicar had forgotten [his]3228-the vicar own grievance . [She]129-rachel looked ill . [Janet Leighton]131-janet , meeting [him]3228-the vicar in [the village]304-the village a few days before , had talked of [[her]131-janet partner]2601-her partner as " done up . "[131-janet] Was it the excitement of falling in love?--combined perhaps with the worry of leaving [her]131-janet work and the career just begun ?

[He]3228-the vicar asked a few questions about [her]131-janet plans . [She]131-janet answered [him]3228-the vicar very gently , with a subtle note of apology in [her]131-janet voice ; but yet , as it seemed to [him]3228-the vicar , from rather far away . And when [they]2598-they parted , [he]3228-the vicar realized that [he]3228-the vicar had never known more of [her]131-janet than an outer self , which offered but little clue to [the self within]2602-the self within .

[Rachel]129-rachel walked back to [the farm]345-the farm with [Miss Shenstone]252-meanwhile miss shenstone 's note in [her]129-rachel pocket . [She]129-rachel had told [the vicar]3228-the vicar that [her]129-rachel land - girls should certainly come to [[the Shepherds]2605-the shepherds ' servants]2606-the shepherds ' servants ' party -- but [she]129-rachel said nothing about it to [them]2607-them -- till [Janet Leighton]131-janet had safely bicycled away in the early afternoon . The invitation , however , was a godsend . For [Rachel]129-rachel had begun to realize that there was a good deal of watching going on -- watching of [the farm]345-the farm , and watching over [herself]129-rachel . [She]129-rachel understood that [Halsey]244-old halsey had been scared by [some tramp]2609-some tramp or other whom [he]244-old halsey took for the ghost ; and [she]129-rachel saw that [Janet]131-janet was unwilling that [any one]3450-any one should be alone after dark in [the farm]345-the farm . [Nobody]3230-nobody had talked to [her]131-janet -- [Rachel]129-rachel -- about it -- no doubt by [Ellesborough]149-ellesborough 's wish -- because [she]131-janet was supposed to be out of sorts -- run down . [She]129-rachel had accepted the little conspiracy of silence as a proof of [his]244-old halsey tenderness , and had obediently asked no questions .

And it had not yet occurred to [her]129-rachel to connect the stories floating about [the farm]345-the farm with [Delane]179-delane 's reappearance . The stunning fact of the reappearance , with all that it might mean to [her]129-rachel , absorbed [her]129-rachel mind -- for a few hours yet .

But as soon as [Janet]131-janet was safely off [the premises]2614-the premises , [she]129-rachel hurried across to [the shippen]1839-the shippen , where [Betty]141-betty and [Jenny]131-janet were milking .

" Girls!--would [you]2616-the two little maidens like to go to [the Shepherds]2605-the shepherds ' dance to - night ? [I]129-rachel 've got an invitation for [you]2616-the two little maidens ? "[129-rachel]

Stupefaction -- and delight ! The invitations had been very sparing and select , and [the two little maidens]2616-the two little maidens had felt [themselves]2616-the two little maidens Cinderellas indeed , all the sorer in [their]2616-the two little maidens minds seeing that [Dempsey]245-dempsey and [[Betty]141-betty 's young man]2617-betty 's young man were both going .

But _ frocks _ ! [Jenny]131-janet at least had nothing suitable . [Rachel]129-rachel at once offered a white frock . The milking and dairy work were hurried through , and then came the dressing , as the dance began at seven . [Betty]141-betty , knowing [herself]141-betty to be [a beauty]4040-a beauty , except for [her]141-betty teeth , had soon finished . A white blouse , a blue cotton skirt , a blue ribbon in [her]141-betty mop of brown hair -- and [she]141-betty looked at [herself]141-betty exultantly in [Miss Henderson]127-miss henderson 's glass . [Jenny]131-janet was much more difficult to please . [She]131-janet was crimson with excitement , and the tip of [her]131-janet little red tongue kept slipping in and out . But [Rachel]129-rachel patted and pinned -- in a kind of dream . [Jenny]131-janet 's red hair , generally worn in the tightest wisps and plaits , was brushed out till it stood like a halo round [her]131-janet face and neck , and [she]131-janet was secretly afraid that [Dempsey]245-dempsey would n't know [her]131-janet .

Then [Rachel]129-rachel wrapped [them]2619-them up in [their]2619-them land - army waterproofs , and saw [them]2619-them off , carrying an electric torch to guide [them]2619-them safely through [the bit of lane under the trees]2620-the bit of lane under the trees . But there was a moon rising , and the fog was less .

" Ai n't [she]131-janet just kind?--don't [you]141-betty just love [her]131-janet ? "[131-janet] said [Jenny]131-janet ecstatically to [Betty]141-betty , as [they]2619-them turned back to wave [their]2619-them farewells again to [the figure standing in the doorway]2621-the figure standing in the doorway .

[Betty]141-betty assented . But [they]2619-them were both greatly astonished . For [Rachel]129-rachel did not in general take much personal notice of [them]2619-them .

[They]2619-them were no sooner out of sight than [Rachel]129-rachel went to look at the clock in [the kitchen]3239-the kitchen . Ten minutes to seven . Two hours to wait . How were [they]2619-them going to be got through ?

[She]129-rachel went out aimlessly into [the farm - yard]430-the farm - yard , where [the farm buildings]376-the farm buildings stood in a faintly luminous mist , the hill - side behind [them]376-the farm buildings , and [the climbing woods]2625-the climbing woods . To [her]129-rachel left , across [the fields]3144-the fields ran the road climbing to [the miniature pass]2627-the miniature pass , whence [it]2627-the miniature pass descended steeply to [the plain beyond]2628-the plain beyond . And on the further side of [the road]3145-the road lay [[her]129-rachel own fields]2468-her own fields , with alternating bands of [plough - land]2631-plough - land and stubble , and the hedge - row trees standing ghostly and separate in the light haze .

[She]129-rachel was alone in [the farm]345-the farm , in all that landscape the only living thing at the moment , except for the animals . A tense energy of will seemed to possess [her]129-rachel . [She]129-rachel was defending [herself]129-rachel -- defending [Ellesborough]149-ellesborough -- and [their]2633-their joint lives . How was [she]129-rachel going to do it ? [She]129-rachel did n't know . But the passion in [her]129-rachel blood would give [her]129-rachel strength -- would see [her]129-rachel through .

In [the old barn]2634-the old barn , the cows were munching peacefully . The air was sweet with [their]2633-their breath , and with the hay piled in [[their]2633-their cribs]2635-their cribs . [Rachel]129-rachel wandered noiselessly amongst [them]2633-their , and [they]2633-their turned [their]2633-their large eyes slowly to look at [her]129-rachel , and the small lantern [she]129-rachel carried . In [the stables]417-the stables , too , not a sound , but an occasional swishing and champing . [Rachel]129-rachel hung up the lantern , and sat down on a truss of hay , idly watching the rays of light striking up into the cross - beams of the roof , and on the shining flanks of the horses . [Her]129-rachel mind was going at a great speed . And all in a moment -- without any clear consciousness of the strange thoughts that had been running through [her]129-rachel brain -- an intuition struck through [her]129-rachel .

_ [Roger_!--it]253-roger_!--it was [he]253-roger_!--it who had been playing the ghost -- [he]253-roger_!--it who had been seen haunting [the farm]345-the farm -- who had scared [Halsey--_Roger]254-halsey--_roger _ ! come to spy upon [her]129-rachel and [[her]129-rachel lover]1714-her lover ! Once the idea suggested itself , [she]129-rachel was certain of it -- it must be true .

The appearance in [the lane]1516-the lane had been cleverly premeditated . [She]129-rachel had been watched for days , perhaps for weeks .

[Ellesborough]149-ellesborough had been watched , too , no doubt .

[She]129-rachel drew a shuddering breath . [She]129-rachel was afraid of [Roger Delane]179-delane . From the early days of [her]129-rachel marriage [she]129-rachel had been afraid of [him]253-roger_!--it . There was about [him]253-roger_!--it the incalculable something which means moral insanity -- abnormal processes of mind working through uncontrolled will . [You]2640-you could never reason with or influence [him]253-roger_!--it , where [his]253-roger_!--it appetites or [his]253-roger_!--it passions were concerned . A mocking spirit looked out upon [you]2640-you , just before [his]253-roger_!--it blow fell . [He]253-roger_!--it was [a mere force -- inhuman and sinister]2641-a mere force -- inhuman and sinister .

Well , [she]129-rachel had got to fight it and tame it ! [She]129-rachel shut up [the cow - house]1175-the cow - house and stable , and stood out awhile in [the farm - yard]430-the farm - yard , letting the mild wind play on [her]129-rachel bare head and hot cheeks . The moon was riding overhead . The night seemed to [her]129-rachel very silent and mysterious -- yet penetrated by something divine to which [she]129-rachel lifted [her]129-rachel heart . What would [Ellesborough]149-ellesborough say over there -- in [[[his]149-ellesborough forester]2644-his forester 's hut]2645-his forester 's hut , five miles beyond [the hills]3216-the hills , if [he]253-roger_!--it knew what [she]129-rachel was doing -- whom [she]129-rachel was expecting ? [She]129-rachel shut [her]129-rachel eyes , and saw [his]253-roger_!--it lean , strong face , [his]253-roger_!--it look--

The church clock was striking , and surely -- in the distance , the sound of an opening gate ? [She]129-rachel hurried back to [the house]337-the house , and [the sitting - room]447-the sitting - room . The lamp was low . [She]129-rachel revived it . [She]129-rachel made up the fire . [She]129-rachel felt [herself]129-rachel shivering with excitement , and [she]129-rachel stooped over the fire , warming [her]129-rachel hands .

[She]129-rachel had purposely left the front door unlocked . A hand tried the handle , turned it -- a slow step entered .

[She]129-rachel went to the sitting - room door and threw it open--

" Come in here . "[129-rachel]

[Roger Delane]179-delane came in and shut the door behind [him]253-roger_!--it . [They]2649-they confronted [each other]460-each other .

" [You]129-rachel 've managed it uncommonly well , "[253-roger_!--it] [he]253-roger_!--it said , at last . " [You]129-rachel 've dared it . Are n't [you]129-rachel afraid of [me]253-roger_!--it ? "[253-roger_!--it]

" Not the least . What do [you]129-rachel want ? "[2649-they]

[They]2649-they surveyed [each other]460-each other -- with hatred , yet not without a certain passionate curiosity on both sides . When [Delane]179-delane had last seen [Rachel]129-rachel [she]129-rachel was a pale and care - worn creature , [her]129-rachel youth darkened by suffering and struggle , [her]129-rachel eyes still heavy with the tears [she]129-rachel had shed for [[her]129-rachel lost baby]2652-her lost baby . [He]253-roger_!--it beheld [her]129-rachel now rounded and full - blown , at the zenith of [her]129-rachel beauty , and breathing an energy , physical and mental , [he]253-roger_!--it had never yet seen in [her]129-rachel . [She]129-rachel had escaped [him]253-roger_!--it , and [her]129-rachel life had put out a new flower . [He]253-roger_!--it was suddenly possessed as [he]253-roger_!--it looked at [her]129-rachel , both by the poisonous memory of old desire , and by an intolerable sense of [his]253-roger_!--it impotence , and [her]129-rachel triumph . And the physical fever in [his]253-roger_!--it veins made self - control difficult .

On [her]129-rachel side , [she]129-rachel saw the ruin of [a man]3155-a man . When [she]129-rachel married [him]253-roger_!--it [he]253-roger_!--it had been [a moral wreck]2654-a moral wreck . But the physical envelope was still intact , still splendid . Now [his]253-roger_!--it clothes seemed to hang upon a skeleton ; the hollows in the temples and cheeks , the emaciation of the face and neck , the scanty grey hair , struck horror , but it was a horror in which there was not a trace of sympathy or pity . [He]253-roger_!--it had destroyed [himself]253-roger_!--it , and [he]253-roger_!--it would , if [he]253-roger_!--it could , destroy [her]129-rachel . [She]129-rachel read in [him]253-roger_!--it the thirst for revenge . [She]129-rachel had to baffle it , if [she]129-rachel could .

As [she]129-rachel defied [him]253-roger_!--it , indeed , [she]129-rachel saw [his]253-roger_!--it hand steal to [his]253-roger_!--it coat - pocket , and it occurred to [her]129-rachel that the pocket might contain a revolver . " [Rachel!--when]256-rachel!--when did [you]2662-her begin to prefer [Dick Tanner]201-tanner to [me]2661-he ? No doubt [you]2662-her had a jolly time with [him]149-ellesborough . [I]2661-he suppose [I]2661-he ca n't undo the divorce -- but [you]2662-her would never have got it , if [I]2661-he had n't been such [an innocent]4116-an innocent . "[2661-he]

[She]2662-her sprang up , and [he]2661-he saw that [he]2661-he had gone too far .

" If [you]2661-he say any more such things to [me]2662-her , [you]2661-he will get nothing from [me]2662-her -- and [you]2661-he may either _ go_-- "[2662-her] [she]2662-her pointed passionately to the door--"or [you]2661-he may sit there till [[my]2662-her people]3368-my people come back -- which [you]2661-he like . "[2662-her]

[He]2661-he looked at [her]2662-her , under [his]2661-he eyebrows , smiling mechanically -- weighing the relative advantages of prudence or violence . [Prudence]257-prudence carried the day .

" [You]2662-her are just [the same spitfire]4118-the same spitfire , [I]2662-her see , as [you]2662-her used to be ! All right . [I]2662-her see [you]2662-her understand . Well , now , how am [I]2662-her to get [my]2662-her money -- [my]2662-her damages ? "[2662-her] [She]2662-her turned away , and went quickly to [an old bureau that had been [[her]2662-her uncle]350-her uncle 's]2663-an old bureau that had been her uncle 's . [He]2661-he watched [her]2662-her , exultant . It was all true , then . [Dick Tanner]201-tanner had been [[her]2662-her lover]1714-her lover , and [Ellesborough]149-ellesborough knew nothing . [He]2661-he did not know whether to be the more triumphant in [her]2662-her tacit avowal , or the more enraged by the testimony borne by [her]2662-her acquiescence to [her]2662-her love for [Ellesborough]149-ellesborough . [He]2661-he hated [her]2662-her ; yet [he]2661-he had never admired [her]2662-her so much , as [his]2661-he eyes followed [her]2662-her stooping over the drawers of [the bureau]2666-the bureau , [her]2662-her beautiful head and neck in a warm glow of firelight .

Then , suddenly , [he]2661-he began to cough . [She]2662-her , hunting for [her]2662-her cheque - book , took no notice at first . But the paroxysm grew ; it shook the very life out of [him]2661-he ; till at last [she]2662-her stood arrested and staring - while [he]2661-he fell back in [his]2661-he chair like [a dead man]2667-a dead man , [his]2661-he eyes shut , [his]2661-he handkerchief to [his]2661-he lips .

" Shall [I]2662-her -- shall [I]2662-her get [you]2661-he some brandy ? "[2662-her] [she]2662-her said , coldly . [He]2661-he nodded assent . [She]2662-her hurriedly looked for [her]2662-her keys , and went to a cupboard in [the kitchen]3239-the kitchen , where [Janet]131-janet kept a half bottle of brandy for medical use if needed .

[He]2661-he drank off what [she]2662-her brought -- but it was some time before [he]2661-he recovered speech . When [he]2661-he did it was in a low tone that made the words a curse:---

" That 's [your]2661-he doing ! "[2661-he]

[Her]2662-her only answer was a gesture .

" It is , "[2661-he] [he]2661-he insisted , speaking in gasps . " [You]2662-her never showed [me]2661-he any real love -- any forbearance . [You]2662-her never cared for [me]2661-he -- as [you]2662-her know [I]2661-he cared for [you]2662-her . [You]2662-her told [me]2661-he so once . [You]2662-her married [me]2661-he for a [home]3185-home -- and then [you]2662-her deserted -- and betrayed [me]2661-he . "[2661-he]

There was a guilty answer in [her]2662-her consciousness which made [her]2662-her speak without anger .

" [I]2669-he know [my]2669-he own faults very well . And now [you]2662-her must go -- [we]4120-we ca n't either of [us]4120-we stand this any more . Do [you]2662-her give [me]2669-he [your]2662-her solemn promise that [you]2662-her will trouble [me]2669-he no more --- or [the man [I]2669-he am going to marry]4121-the man i am going to marry -- if [I]2669-he do this for [you]2662-her ? "[2669-he]

" Give [me]2669-he a piece of paper-- "[2669-he] [he]2669-he said , huskily .

[He]2669-he wrote the promise , signed it , and pushed it to [her]2662-her . Then [he]2669-he carefully examined the self cheque " to [bearer]4122-bearer "[2669-he] which [she]2662-her had written .

" Well , [I]2669-he dare say that will see [me]2669-he out -- and bury [me]2669-he decently . [I]2669-he shall take [[my]2669-he family]4123-my family down to [the sea]4124-the sea . [You]2662-her know [I]2669-he 've got [a little girl]1215-a little girl -- about three ? Oh , [I]2669-he never told any lies about [Anita]186-anita . [I]2669-he 've married [her]1215-a little girl now . "[2669-he]

[Rachel]129-rachel stood like a stone , without a word . [Her]129-rachel one consuming anxiety was to see [him]2669-he gone , to be done with [him]2669-he .

[He]2669-he rose slowly -- with difficulty . And the cough seized [him]2669-he again . [Rachel]129-rachel in a fevered exasperation watched [him]2669-he clinging to the table for support . Would [he]2669-he die -- or faint -- then and there -- and be found by [Janet]131-janet , who must now be on [her]131-janet way [home]3185-home ? [She]129-rachel pressed brandy on [him]2669-he again . But [he]2669-he pushed it away . " Let [me]2669-he be ! "[2669-he] [She]129-rachel could only wait .

When [he]2669-he could speak and move again , [he]2669-he put the cheque away in [his]2669-he pocket , and buttoned [his]2669-he coat over it .

" Well , good - night . "[2669-he] Then straightening [himself]2669-he , [he]2669-he fixed [her]129-rachel with a pair of burning eyes . " Good - night . [Anita]186-anita will be kind to [me]2669-he -- when [I]2669-he die -- [Anita]186-anita will be [a woman]3156-a woman to [me]2669-he . [You]129-rachel were never kind -- [you]129-rachel never thought of any one but [yourself]129-rachel . Good - bye . Good luck ! "[2669-he]

And walking uncertainly to the door , [he]2669-he opened it and was gone . [She]129-rachel heard [his]2669-he slow steps in [the farmyard]426-the farmyard , and the opening of the wicket gate . Then all sounds died away .

For a few minutes [she]129-rachel crouched sobbing over the fire , weeping for sheer nervous exhaustion . Then the dread seized [her]129-rachel of being caught in such a state by [Janet]131-janet , and [she]129-rachel went [upstairs]439-upstairs , locked [her]129-rachel door , and threw [herself]129-rachel on [her]129-rachel bed . The bruise of an intolerable humiliation seemed to spread through soul and body . [She]129-rachel knew that for the first time [she]129-rachel had confessed [her]129-rachel wretched secret which [she]129-rachel had thought so wholly [her]129-rachel own -- and confessed it -- horrible and degrading thought!--to [Roger Delane]179-delane . Not in words indeed -- but in act . [No innocent woman]2673-no innocent woman would have paid the blackmail . [The dark room in which [she]129-rachel lay]2674-the dark room in which she lay seemed to be haunted by [Delane]179-delane 's exultant eyes .

And the silence was haunted too by [his]2669-he last words . There arose in [her]129-rachel a reluctant and torturing pity for [the wretched man who had been [[her]129-rachel husband]1294-her husband]2675-the wretched man who had been her husband ; a pity , which passed on into a storm of moral anguish . [Her]129-rachel whole past life looked incredibly black to [her]129-rachel as [she]129-rachel lay there in the dark -- stained with unkindness , and selfishness , and sin .

Which saw [her]129-rachel the more truly?--Roger , or [Ellesborough?--the man who hated and cursed [her]129-rachel]2677-ellesborough?--the man who hated and cursed her , or [the man who adored [her]129-rachel]2678-the man who adored her ?

[She]129-rachel was struggling , manoeuvring , fighting , to keep the truth from [George Ellesborough]198-ellesborough . It was quite uncertain whether [she]129-rachel would succeed . [Roger]179-delane 's word was a poor safeguard ! But if [she]129-rachel did , the truth itself would only the more certainly pursue and beat [her]129-rachel down .

And again , the utter yearning for confession and an unburdened soul came upon [her]129-rachel intolerably . [The religious psychologist]2679-the religious psychologist describes such a crisis as " conversion , "[2679-the religious psychologist] or " conviction of sin , "[2679-the religious psychologist] or the " working of grace . "[2679-the religious psychologist] And [he]2679-the religious psychologist knows from long experience that it is the result in the human soul not so much of a sense of evil , as of a vision of good . [Goodness]258-goodness had been brought near to [Rachel]129-rachel in the personality -- the tender self - forgetting trust -- of [George Ellesborough]198-ellesborough . It was goodness , not fear -- goodness , unconscious of any threatened wrong -- that had pierced [her]129-rachel heart . Then a thought came to [her]129-rachel . _ Janet!_--Janet whose pure and loving life beside [her]129-rachel made yet another element in the spiritual forces that were pressing upon [her]129-rachel .

[She]129-rachel sprang to [her]129-rachel feet . [She]129-rachel would tell [Janet]131-janet everything -- put [her]129-rachel poor secret -- [her]129-rachel all -- in [Janet]131-janet 's hands .

XIII

It was again a very still and misty night,--extraordinarily mild for the time of year . A singular brooding silence held [all the woodlands above [Great End Farm]1-great end farm]2680-all the woodlands above great end farm . There was not a breath of wind . Every dead branch that fell , every bird that moved , every mouse scratching among the fallen beech leaves , produced sounds disproportionately clear and startling , and for the moment there would be a rustle of disturbance , as though something or some one , in [the forest heart]2681-the forest heart , took alarm . Then the deep waters of quiet closed again , and everything -- except that watching presence -- slept .

[The hut in [Denman Wood]98-denman wood , which had formerly played a hospitable part as the scene of many a Gargantuan luncheon to [Colonel Shepherd]124-colonel shepherd 's shooting parties]2682-the hut in denman wood , which had formerly played a hospitable part as the scene of many a gargantuan luncheon to colonel shepherd 's shooting parties , had long been [an abandoned spot]2683-an abandoned spot . [[All the Colonel]2684-all the colonel 's keepers under fifty]2685-all the colonel 's keepers under fifty had gone to fight ; and there was left only [an old head keeper]2686-an old head keeper , with [one decrepit helper , who shot the scanty game which still survived on strict business principles , to eke out the household rations of [the big house]2688-the big house]2687-one decrepit helper , who shot the scanty game which still survived on strict business principles , to eke out the household rations of the big house . [The Ipscombe woods]2689-the ipscombe woods were rarely visited . [They]2689-the ipscombe woods were a long way from [[the keeper]3685-the keeper 's cottage]2691-the keeper 's cottage , and [the old man]292-the old man , depressed by the difference between war and pre - war conditions , found it quite enough to potter round the stubbles and turnips of [the home farm]2693-the home farm when game had to be shot .

The paths leading through [the underwood]2694-the underwood to [the hut]2695-the hut were now in these four years largely over - grown . [A place more hidden and forgotten it would have been difficult to find]2696-a place more hidden and forgotten it would have been difficult to find . And for this reason , combined with [[its]2695-the hut neighbourhood to [[Rachel Henderson]129-rachel 's farm]2698-rachel henderson 's farm]2697-its neighbourhood to rachel henderson 's farm , [Roger Delane]179-delane had chosen to inhabit [it]2695-the hut .

It was the third night after [his]292-the old man interview with [[his]292-the old man former wife]2194-his former wife . [He]292-the old man reached [the hut]2695-the hut after dark , by various by - paths over [the wide commons stretching between [it]2695-the hut and [X]99-x]2701-the wide commons stretching between it and x -- [the station at which [he]292-the old man now generally alighted]2702-the station at which he now generally alighted . [He]292-the old man carried in [his]292-the old man pocket some evening newspapers , a new anthology , and a novel . Owing to an injection of morphia -- a habit to which [he]292-the old man had only lately taken -- [he]292-the old man felt unusually fit , and [his]292-the old man brain was unusually alert . At the same time [he]292-the old man had had a disagreeable interview with [a doctor]908-a doctor that morning who had been insisting on Sanatorium treatment if the remaining lung was to be preserved and [his]292-the old man life prolonged . [He]292-the old man did not want to prolong [his]292-the old man life , but only to avoid the beastliness of pain . It seemed to [him]292-the old man that morphia -- good stuff!--was going to do that for [him]292-the old man . Why had n't [he]292-the old man begun it before ? But [his]292-the old man brain was queer -- [he]292-the old man was conscious of that . [He]292-the old man had asked [the doctor]2704-the doctor about some curious mental symptoms . The reply was that phthisis was often accompanied by them .

Obsession -- fixed ideas -- in the medical sense : half of [him]292-the old man , psychologically , was quite conscious that the other half was under [their]2705-their influence . The sound self was observing [the unsound self]2706-the unsound self , but apparently with no power over it . Otherwise how was it that [he]292-the old man was [here]3217-here again , hiding like a wild beast in [a lair]2708-a lair , less than a mile from [Great End Farm]1-great end farm , and [Rachel Henderson]129-rachel ?

[He]292-the old man had found [his]292-the old man way to [London]11-london in the small hours of the day following [his]292-the old man scene with [Rachel]129-rachel , intending to keep [his]292-the old man promise , and let [[his]292-the old man former wife]2194-his former wife alone . The cashing of [Rachel]129-rachel 's cheque had given [him]292-the old man and [Anita]186-anita some agreeable moments ; though [Anita]186-anita was growing disturbed that [he]292-the old man would not tell [her]186-anita where the money came from . [They]2710-they had found [fresh lodgings in [a really respectable Bloomsbury street]2712-a really respectable bloomsbury street]2711-fresh lodgings in a really respectable bloomsbury street ; [they]2710-they had both bought clothes , and [little Netta]131-janet had been rigged out . [Delane]179-delane had magnificently compounded with [his]292-the old man most pressing creditors , and had taken [Anita]186-anita to [a theatre]2304-a theatre . But [he]292-the old man had been discontented with [her]186-anita appearance [there]377-there . [She]186-anita had really lost all [her]186-anita good looks . If it had n't been for [the kid--]259-the kid--

And now , after this interval , [his]292-the old man obsession had swooped upon [him]292-the old man again . It was an obsession of hate -- which simply could not endure , when it came to the point , that [Rachel Henderson]129-rachel should vanish unscathed into the future of a happy marriage , while [he]292-the old man remained [the doomed failure and outcast [he]292-the old man knew [himself]292-the old man to be]2715-the doomed failure and outcast he knew himself to be . [Rachel]129-rachel 's implied confession rankled in [him]292-the old man like a burn . _ Tanner!_--that wretched weakling , with [his]292-the old man miserable daubs that [nobody]3230-nobody wanted to buy . So [Rachel]129-rachel had gone to [him]292-the old man , as soon as [she]129-rachel had driven [[her]129-rachel husband]1294-her husband away , no doubt to complain of [her]129-rachel ill - treatment , to air [her]129-rachel woes . [The fellow]2718-the fellow had philandered round [her]129-rachel some time , and had shown an insolent and interfering temper once or twice towards [himself]2718-the fellow . [Yes!--he]2719-yes!--he could imagine it all!--her flight , and [Tanner]201-tanner 's maudlin sympathy -- tears -- caresses -- the natural sequel . And then [her]129-rachel pose of complete innocence at the divorce proceedings -- [the Judge]3723-the judge 's remarks . Revolting hypocrisy ! If [Tanner]201-tanner had been still alive , [he]201-tanner would somehow have exposed [him]201-tanner -- somehow have made [him]201-tanner pay . Lucky for [him]201-tanner [he]201-tanner was drowned in that boat accident on [Lake Nipissing]100-lake nipissing ! And no doubt [Rachel]129-rachel thought that the accident had made everything safe for [her]129-rachel .

Every incident now , every phase of [his]201-tanner conversation with [her]129-rachel was assuming a monstrous and distorted significance in [his]201-tanner mind . How easily [she]129-rachel had yielded on the subject of the money ! [He]201-tanner might have asked a great deal more -- and [he]201-tanner would have got it . Very likely [Ellesborough]198-ellesborough was well off -- Yankees generally were -- and [she]129-rachel knew that what [she]129-rachel gave [Delane]179-delane as hush money would make very little difference to [her]129-rachel . [Ellesborough]198-ellesborough no doubt would not look very closely into [her]129-rachel shekels , having sufficient of [his]198-ellesborough own . Otherwise it might occur to [him]201-tanner to wonder how [she]129-rachel had got rid of that Â£ 500 . Would it pinch [her]129-rachel ? Probably , if all [she]129-rachel had for capital was [the old chap]2721-the old chap 's legacy . Well -- serve [her]129-rachel right -- serve [her]129-rachel , damned , doubly right ! [Ellesborough]198-ellesborough 's kisses would make up .

These thoughts , after a momentary respite , held [him]201-tanner in [their]2722-their grip as [he]201-tanner walked [[London]11-london streets]2723-london streets . Suspicion of the past -- ugly and venomous -- flapped its black wings about [him]201-tanner . Had [Rachel]129-rachel ever been faithful to [him]201-tanner -- even in the early days ? [She]129-rachel had made acquaintance with [the Tanners]255-the tanners very soon after [their]2724-their marriage . Looking back , a number of small incidents and scenes poked [their]2722-their heads out of the dead level of the past . [Rachel]129-rachel and [Tanner]201-tanner , discussing the [Watts]187-watts photograph when [Rachel]129-rachel first acquired it -- [Tanner]201-tanner 's eager denunciatory talk -- [he]201-tanner called [himself]201-tanner an " impressionist"--the[201-tanner] creature!--because [he]201-tanner could n't draw worth a cent -- [Rachel]129-rachel all smiles and deference . [She]129-rachel had never given _ [him]201-tanner _ that sort of attention . Or [Rachel]129-rachel at [a housewarming in [the next farm to [his]201-tanner]2726-the next farm to his]2725-a housewarming in the next farm to his -- [Rachel]129-rachel in a pale green dress , [the handsomest woman there]2727-the handsomest woman there , dancing with [Tanner]201-tanner -- [Rachel]129-rachel quarrelling with [him]201-tanner in the buggy on the way [home]3185-home , because [he]201-tanner called [Tanner]201-tanner a milksop--"He cares for beautiful things , and [you]129-rachel do n't ! --but that 's no reason why [you]129-rachel should abuse [him]201-tanner . "[201-tanner]

And what about those weeks not very long after that dance , when [he]201-tanner had gone off to the land - sale at [Edmonton]101-edmonton ( that was the journey , by the way , when [he]201-tanner first saw [Anita]186-anita ! ) , and [Rachel]129-rachel had stayed at [home]3185-home , with [a girl friend]3802-a girl friend , [a girl [they]2732-they knew in [Winnipeg]55-winnipeg]2731-a girl they knew in winnipeg ? But [that girl]2733-that girl had n't stayed all the time . To do [her]2733-that girl justice , [Rachel]129-rachel had made no secret of that . [He]201-tanner remembered [her]2733-that girl attacking [him]201-tanner when [he]201-tanner came [home]3185-home for having left [her]2733-that girl for three or four days quite alone . Why had [he]201-tanner been so long away ? Probably a mere bluff -- though [he]201-tanner had been taken in by it at the time , and being still in love with [her]2733-that girl , had done [his]201-tanner best to appease [her]2733-that girl . But what had [she]2733-that girl been doing all the time [she]2733-that girl was alone ? In the light of what [he]201-tanner knew now , [she]2733-that girl might have been doing anything . _ Was [the child]662-the child [his]201-tanner _ ?

So , piece by piece , with no auditor but [his]201-tanner own brain , shut in upon [himself]201-tanner by the isolation which [his]201-tanner own life had forged for [him]201-tanner , [he]201-tanner built up a hideous indictment against [the woman [he]201-tanner had once loved]2736-the woman he had once loved . [He]201-tanner wished [he]201-tanner had put off [his]201-tanner interview with [her]2733-that girl till [he]201-tanner had had time to think things out more . As [he]201-tanner came to realize how [she]2733-that girl had tricked and bested [him]201-tanner , [her]2733-that girl offence became incredibly viler than it seemed at first . [He]201-tanner had let [her]2733-that girl off far too cheaply that night at [the farm]345-the farm . Scenes of past violence returned upon [him]201-tanner , and the memory of them seemed to satisfy a rising thirst . Especially the recollection of the divorce proceedings maddened [him]201-tanner . [His]201-tanner morbid brain took hold on [them]2738-them with a grip that [his]201-tanner will could not loosen . [Her]2733-that girl evidence -- [he]201-tanner had read it in the [Winnipeg]55-winnipeg newspapers -- the remarks of [the prating old judge]2739-the prating old judge -- and of [her]2733-that girl cad of [a lawyer]2740-a lawyer -- [good God]2741-good god ! And all the time it was _ [she]2733-that girl _ who ought to have been in [the dock]2742-the dock , and [he]201-tanner [the accuser]1772-the accuser , if [he]201-tanner had known -- if [he]201-tanner had n't been [a trusting idiot]2744-a trusting idiot , [a bleating fool]2745-a bleating fool .

A brooding intensity of rage , as this inward process went on , gradually drowned in [him]201-tanner every other feeling and desire . The relief and amusement of the money and its spending were soon over . [He]201-tanner thought no more of it . [Anita]186-anita , and [[his]201-tanner child]2746-his child even -- [the child for whom [he]201-tanner really cared]2747-the child for whom he really cared -- passed out of [his]201-tanner mind . As [he]201-tanner sat drinking whisky in [the dull respectable lodging]2748-the dull respectable lodging , at night after [Anita]186-anita had gone to bed , [he]201-tanner felt the sinister call of those dark woods above [[Rachel]129-rachel 's farm]2749-rachel 's farm , and tasted the sweetness of [his]201-tanner new power to hurt [her]186-anita , now that [she]186-anita had paid [him]201-tanner this blackmail , and damned [herself]186-anita thereby -- past help . [She]186-anita had threatened [him]201-tanner . But what could [she]186-anita do -- or [the Yankee fellow]2750-the yankee fellow either ? [She]186-anita had given the show away . As for [his]201-tanner promise , when [he]201-tanner had no right to make it,--no right to allow [such a woman]2751-such a woman to get off scot - free , with plenty of money and [a new lover]2752-a new lover .

So on the Thursday evening [he]201-tanner took [train]2753-train for X. It was still the Armistice week . [The London streets]2754-the london streets were crowded with [soldiers]3495-soldiers and [young women of every sort and kind]2756-young women of every sort and kind . [He]201-tanner bought a newspaper and read it in [the train]4098-the train . It gave [him]201-tanner a queer satisfaction -- for [one half of [him]201-tanner]2758-one half of him was still always watching [the other]283-the other -- to discover that [he]201-tanner could feel patriotic emotion like [anybody else]2760-anybody else and could be thrilled by the elation of [Britain]102-britain 's victory--_his _ victory . [He]201-tanner read the telegrams , [the positions on [the Rhine]103-the rhine assigned to [the Second Army]2762-the second army]2761-the positions on the rhine assigned to the second army , and [the Fourth,--General Plumer General Rawlinson]260-the fourth,--general plumer general rawlinson -- General F.--Gad ! [he]201-tanner used to know [the son of that last old fellow at [King 's]104-king 's]2763-the son of that last old fellow at king 's .

Then [he]201-tanner fell to [his]201-tanner old furtive watching of [the people on the platform]2764-the people on the platform , [the men]3161-the men getting in and out of [the train]4098-the train . At any moment [he]201-tanner might fall in with [one of [[his]201-tanner old Cambridge acquaintances]2768-his old cambridge acquaintances]2767-one of his old cambridge acquaintances , in one of [these smart officers]2769-these smart officers , with [their]2769-these smart officers decorations and [their]2769-these smart officers red tabs . But in the first place [they]2770-they would n't travel in [this third class where [he]201-tanner was sitting]2771-this third class where he was sitting -- not till the war was over . And in the next , [he]201-tanner was so changed -- had taken indeed such pains to be -- that it was long odds against [his]201-tanner being recognized . Eleven years , was it , since [he]201-tanner left [Cambridge]17-cambridge ? About .

At X. [he]201-tanner got out . [The ticket collector]2772-the ticket collector noticed [him]201-tanner for that faint touch of a past magnificence that still lingered in [his]201-tanner carriage and gait ; but there were so many strangers about that [he]201-tanner was soon forgotten .

[He]201-tanner passed under [a railway arch]2773-a railway arch and climbed [a hill]2774-a hill , [the hill on which [he]201-tanner had met [Dempsey]194-dempsey]2775-the hill on which he had met dempsey . At [the top of [the hill]369-the hill]2776-the top of the hill [he]201-tanner left [the high - road]2778-the high - road for [a grass track across [the common]3647-the common]2779-a grass track across the common . There was just enough light from a declining moon to show [him]201-tanner where [he]201-tanner was . [The common]3647-the common was full of dark shapes -- old twisted thorns , and junipers , and masses of tall grass -- shapes which often seemed to [him]201-tanner to be strargely alive , [the silent but conscious witnesses of [his]201-tanner passage]2782-the silent but conscious witnesses of his passage .

The wood was very dark . [He]201-tanner groped [his]201-tanner way through [it]2783-it with difficulty and found [the hut]2695-the hut . Once inside [it]2695-the hut , [he]201-tanner fastened the door with a wooden bar [he]201-tanner had [himself]201-tanner made , and turned on [his]201-tanner electric torch . Bit by bit in the course of [his]201-tanner night visits [he]201-tanner had accumulated a few necessary stores -- some firewood , a few groceries hidden in a corner , a couple of brown blankets , and a small box of tools . A heap of dried bracken in a corner , raised on a substratum of old sacks , had often served [him]201-tanner for a bed ; and when [he]201-tanner had kindled a wood fire in the rough grate of loose bricks where [[Colonel Shepherd]3547-colonel shepherd 's keepers]2786-colonel shepherd 's keepers had been accustomed to warm the hot meat stews sent up for the shooting luncheons , and had set out [his]201-tanner supper on the upturned fragment of an old box which had once held meal for pheasants , [he]201-tanner had provided at least what was necessary for [his]201-tanner night sojourn . This food [he]201-tanner had brought with [him]201-tanner ; a thermos bottle full of hot coffee , with slices of ham , cheese , and bread ; and [he]201-tanner ate it with appetite , sitting on a log beside the fire , and pleasantly conscious as [he]201-tanner looked round [him]201-tanner , like [the Greek poet of long ago]2787-the greek poet of long ago , of that " cuteness "[2788-men which conjures up housing , food , and fire] of [men which conjures up housing , food , and fire]2788-men which conjures up housing , food , and fire in [[earth]2789-earth 's loneliest places]2790-earth 's loneliest places . Outside [that small firelit space]2791-that small firelit space lay the sheer silence of the wood , broken once or twice by the call and flight of an owl past the one carefully darkened window of [the hut]2695-the hut , or by the mysterious sighing and shuddering which , from time to time , would run through the crowded stems and leafless branches .

[A queer " hotel "[201-tanner] this , for mid - November]2793-a queer " hotel " this , for mid - november ! [He]201-tanner might , if [he]201-tanner had chosen , have been amusing [himself]201-tanner , _ tant bien que mal _ , in one or other of [those shabby haunts,--bars , night - clubs , dancing - rooms , to which [his]201-tanner poverty and [his]201-tanner _ moeurs]2794-those shabby haunts,--bars , night - clubs , dancing - rooms , to which his poverty and his _ moeurs _ condemned [him]201-tanner , while [[his]201-tanner old comrades]2795-his old comrades , [the lads [he]201-tanner had been brought up with at school and [college]3177-college]2796-the lads he had been brought up with at school and college , [guardsmen]2798-guardsmen , [Hussars]2799-hussars , and [the rest]830-the rest , were holding high revel for the Peace at [the Ritz]105-the ritz or [the Carlton]106-the carlton ; [he]201-tanner might even , as far as money was concerned , now that [he]201-tanner had bagged [his]201-tanner great haul from [Rachel]129-rachel , have been supping [himself]201-tanner at [the Ritz]105-the ritz , if [he]201-tanner had only had time to exchange [[his]201-tanner brother - in - law]2801-his brother - in - law 's old dress suit , which [Marianne]228-marianne had passed on to [him]201-tanner , for a new one , and if [he]201-tanner could have made up [his]201-tanner mind to the possible recognitions and rebuffs such a step would have entailed . As it was , [he]201-tanner preferred [his]201-tanner warm hiding - place in [the heart of [the woods]485-the woods]2802-the heart of the woods , coupled with this exultant sense of an unseen and mysterious power which was running , like alcohol , through [his]201-tanner nerves .

Real alcohol , however , was not wanting to [his]201-tanner solitary meal . [He]201-tanner drenched [his]201-tanner coffee in the cognac [he]201-tanner always carried about with [him]201-tanner , and then , cigarette in hand , [he]201-tanner fell back on the heap of bracken to read a while . The novel [he]201-tanner sampled and threw away ; the anthology soon bored [him]201-tanner ; and [he]201-tanner spent the greater part of two hours lying on [his]201-tanner back , smoking and thinking -- till it was safe to assume that [the coast]2804-the coast was clear round [Great End Farm]1-great end farm . About ten o'clock , [he]201-tanner slipped noiselessly out of [the hut]2695-the hut , after covering up the fire to wait for [his]201-tanner return , and hiding as far as [he]201-tanner could the other traces of [his]201-tanner occupation . The damp mist outside held all the wood stifled , and the darkness was profound . Stepping as lightly as possible , and using [his]201-tanner torch with the utmost precaution , [he]201-tanner gradually made [his]201-tanner way to the edge of [the wood]2806-the wood , and [the lip of [the basin beyond]2808-the basin beyond [it]2806-the wood]2807-the lip of the basin beyond it . On the bare down was enough faint moonlight to see by , and [he]201-tanner extinguished [his]201-tanner little lantern before leaving [the wood]2806-the wood . Below [him]201-tanner were the dim outlines of [the farm]345-the farm , a shadowy line of [road beyond]2811-road beyond , and , as it were , a thicker fold of darkness , to mark [the woods]485-the woods on the horizon . There was not a light anywhere ; [the village]304-the village was invisible , and [he]201-tanner listened for a long time without hearing anything but the rush of [a distant train]2814-a distant train .

Ah!--Yes , there was a sound down there in the hollow -- footsteps , reverberating in the silence . [He]201-tanner bent [his]201-tanner head listening intently . The footsteps seemed to approach [the farm]345-the farm , then the sounds ceased , till suddenly , on the down slope below [him]201-tanner , [he]201-tanner saw something moving . [He]201-tanner threw back [his]201-tanner head with a quiet laugh .

[The Ipscombe policeman]2816-the ipscombe policeman , no doubt , on [his]2816-the ipscombe policeman round . Would [he]2816-the ipscombe policeman come up [the hill]369-the hill ? Hardly , on such a misty night . If not , [his]2816-the ipscombe policeman retreating steps on [the farm lane]2467-the farm lane would soon tell [his]2816-the ipscombe policeman departure .

In a few minutes , indeed , the click of an opening gate could be clearly heard through the mist , and afterwards , steps . They grew fainter and fainter . All clear !

Choosing a circuitous route , [Delane]179-delane crept down [the hill]369-the hill , and reached a spot on the down - side rather higher than [the farm enclosure]2820-the farm enclosure , from which the windows of [the farm - house]675-the farm - house could be seen . There was a faint light in one of the upper two -- in which [he]201-tanner had some reason to think was that of [[Rachel]129-rachel 's bedroom]2822-rachel 's bedroom . It seemed to [him]201-tanner the window was open ; [he]201-tanner perceived something like the swaying of a blind inside it . The night was marvellously mild for mid - November ; and [he]201-tanner remembered [Rachel]129-rachel 's old craving for air , winter and summer .

The light moved , there was a shadow behind the blind , and suddenly the window was thrown up widely , and a pale figure -- [a woman]3156-a woman 's figure -- stood in the opening . [Rachel]129-rachel , no doubt ! [Delane]179-delane slipped behind a thorn growing on [the bare hill - side]2824-the bare hill - side . [His]201-tanner heart thumped . Instinctively [his]201-tanner hand groped for something in [his]201-tanner pocket . If [she]129-rachel had guessed that [he]201-tanner was there -- within twenty yards of [her]129-rachel !

Then , as [he]201-tanner watched the faint apparition in the mist , it roused in [him]201-tanner a fresh gust of rage . [Rachel]129-rachel , [the sentimental Rachel]2825-the sentimental rachel , unable to sleep -- [Rachel]129-rachel , happy and serene , thinking of [[her]129-rachel lover]1714-her lover -- the lies of [her]129-rachel divorce all forgotten -- and the abominable [Roger]179-delane cut finally out of [her]129-rachel life!--

[The figure]2827-the figure disappeared ; [he]201-tanner heard the closing of the window , which was soon dark . Then [he]201-tanner crept down to the farm wall , and round the corner of [it]2828-it to [that outer cart - shed]2829-that outer cart - shed , where [he]201-tanner had bound up [his]201-tanner bleeding hand on the night when [Halsey]244-old halsey -- silly ass!--had seen the ghost . [He]201-tanner did not dare to smoke lest spark or smell might betray [him]201-tanner . Sitting on a heap of sacks in a sheltered corner , [his]201-tanner hands hanging over [his]201-tanner knees , [he]201-tanner spent some long time brooding and pondering -- conscious all the while of the hidden and silent life of [the house]337-the house and farm at [his]201-tanner back . By now [he]201-tanner fancied [he]201-tanner understood the evening ways of [the place]435-the place . [The two girls]729-the two girls went up to bed first , about nine ; [the two ladies]691-the two ladies , about an hour later ; and [the farm bailiff]2834-the farm bailiff as a rule did not sleep on [the premises]2614-the premises , though there was a bed in [the loft over [the stable]488-the stable which could be used on occasion]2836-the loft over the stable which could be used on occasion . That window , too , through which [he]201-tanner had watched [the pair of lovers]2838-the pair of lovers , when [the Yankee]2839-the yankee discovered [him]201-tanner -- that also seemed to fit into a scheme .

[Yes!--the Yankee]261-yes!--the yankee had discovered [him]201-tanner . [His]201-tanner start , [his]201-tanner sudden movement as though to make a rush at the window , had shown it . Meanwhile [Delane]179-delane had not waited for developments . Quick as thought [he]201-tanner had made for one of those sunken climbing lanes in which [the chalk downs of [the district]2237-the district]2840-the chalk downs of the district abound , [a lane which lay to the south of [the farm]345-the farm]2842-a lane which lay to the south of the farm , while the green terraced path connected with [the ghost - story]2844-the ghost - story lay to the north of [it]2842-a lane which lay to the south of the farm . No doubt there had been a hue and cry , a search of [the farm]345-the farm and [[its]345-the farm immediate neighbourhood]2846-its immediate neighbourhood . But the night was dark and [the woods]485-the woods wide . Once in [[their]2838-the pair of lovers shelter]2848-their shelter , [he]201-tanner had laughed at pursuit . What had [the Yankee]2839-the yankee said to [Rachel]129-rachel ? And since [he]2839-the yankee had stopped [her]129-rachel in [the lane]1516-the lane , what had [Rachel]129-rachel been saying to [the Yankee]2839-the yankee ? Had [she]129-rachel yet explained that the face [he]2839-the yankee had seen at the window -- supposing always that [he]2839-the yankee had told [her]129-rachel what [he]2839-the yankee had seen -- and why should n't [he?--was]2852-he?--was not the face of [a casual tramp or lunatic]2853-a casual tramp or lunatic , but the face of [a discarded husband]2854-a discarded husband , to whom all the various hauntings and apparitions at [the farm]345-the farm had been really due ?

That was the question -- the all - important question . Clearly some one -- [Ellesborough]149-ellesborough probably -- had given a warning to [the police]1861-the police . On what [theory?--ghost?--tramp?--or husband]2857-theory?--ghost?--tramp?--or husband ?

Or had [Rachel]129-rachel just held [her]129-rachel tongue , and had [the Yankee]261-yes!--the yankee been led to believe that [the husband]2858-the husband -- for [Rachel]129-rachel must have owned up about [the husband]2858-the husband though [she]129-rachel did call [herself]129-rachel [Miss Henderson!--was]262-miss henderson!--was still some thousands of miles away -- in [Canada]13-canada -- safely dead and buried , as far as [Rachel]129-rachel was concerned ?

On the whole , [he]261-yes!--the yankee thought it most probable that [Rachel]129-rachel had held [her]129-rachel tongue about [his]2858-the husband reappearance . If [she]129-rachel had thought it worth while to bribe [him]2858-the husband so heavily , it was not very likely that [she]129-rachel would now [herself]129-rachel have set [the American]1090-the american on the track of a secret which [she]129-rachel so evidently did not want [an expectant bridegroom]2861-an expectant bridegroom to know .

[The American]1090-the american -- d -- n [him]2858-the husband ! A furious and morbid jealousy rushed upon [the man crouching under the cart]2863-the man crouching under the cart - shed . [The world]474-the world was rapidly reducing itself for [him]261-yes!--the yankee to these two figures -- figures of hate -- figures against whom [he]261-yes!--the yankee felt [himself]261-yes!--the yankee driven by a kind of headlong force , a force of destruction .

How still [the farm]345-the farm was , except for the movements of the cows inside [the shippen]1839-the shippen at [his]261-yes!--the yankee back , or of the horses in [the stable]488-the stable ! [Rachel]129-rachel , no doubt , was now asleep . In the old days [he]261-yes!--the yankee had often -- enviously -- watched [her]129-rachel tumble asleep as soon as [her]129-rachel bright head was on the pillow ; while in [his]261-yes!--the yankee own case sleep had been for years a difficult business .

[Somebody else]2868-somebody else would watch [her]129-rachel sleeping now .

Yes , if [he]261-yes!--the yankee , [the outcast]2869-the outcast , allowed it . And again the frenzied sense of power swept through [him]261-yes!--the yankee . _ If [he]261-yes!--the yankee allowed it _ ! It rested with [him]261-yes!--the yankee .

The following day , [Ellesborough]198-ellesborough set out in the early afternoon for [Great End Farm]3152-great end farm , [the bearer of much news]2871-the bearer of much news .

The day was dark and rainy , with almost a gale blowing , but [his]261-yes!--the yankee spirits had never been higher . The exultation of the great victory , the incredible Victory , seemed to breathe upon [him]261-yes!--the yankee from the gusty wind , to be driving the westerly clouds , and crying in all the noises of [the woods]485-the woods . Was it really over?--over and done?--the agony of these four years -- the hourly sacrifice of irreplaceable life -- the racking doubt as to the end -- the torturing question in every conscious mind--"Is there [a God in [Heaven]108-heaven]4127-a god in heaven -- [a God who cares for [men]3205-men]4128-a god who cares for men -- or is there not ? "[261-yes!--the yankee]

[He]261-yes!--the yankee could have shouted the answer aloud--"There is -- there is [a God]3412-a god ! And [He]3412-a god is just . "[261-yes!--the yankee]

Faith was natural to [him]261-yes!--the yankee , and nourished on [his]261-yes!--the yankee new happiness no less than on the marvellous issue of the war , it set [his]261-yes!--the yankee heart singing on this dull winter 's day . How should [he]261-yes!--the yankee find [her]2873-her ? Threshing , perhaps , in [the big barn]1170-the big barn , and [he]261-yes!--the yankee would turn to , and work with [her]2873-her and [the girls]3326-the girls till work was done , and [they]2876-they could have [the sitting - room]447-the sitting - room to [themselves]2876-they , and [he]261-yes!--the yankee could tell [her]2873-her all [his]261-yes!--the yankee news . [Janet]131-janet -- [the ever - kind and thoughtful Janet]2878-the ever - kind and thoughtful janet -- would see to that . The more [he]261-yes!--the yankee saw of [the farm]345-the farm - life the more [he]261-yes!--the yankee admired [Janet]131-janet . [She]131-janet was a little slow . [She]131-janet was not clever ; and [she]131-janet had plenty of small prejudices which amused [him]261-yes!--the yankee . But [she]131-janet was the salt of [the earth]759-the earth . Trust [her]131-janet -- lean upon [her]131-janet -- [she]131-janet would never let [you]2881-you down . And now [he]261-yes!--the yankee was going to trust [[his]261-yes!--the yankee beloved]2882-his beloved to [her]131-janet -- for a while .

Yes -- [Rachel]129-rachel and [the girls]3326-the girls , [they]3326-the girls were all in [the high barn]2884-the high barn , feeding the greedy maw of the threshing machine ; a business which strained muscles and backs , and choked noses and throats with infinitesimal particles of oil and the fine flying chaff . [He]261-yes!--the yankee watched [Rachel]129-rachel a few minutes as [she]129-rachel lifted and pitched -- a typical figure of [a New Labour]2885-a new labour , which is also a New Beauty , on [this old earth]2886-this old earth . Then [he]261-yes!--the yankee drew [her]129-rachel away , flung off [his]261-yes!--the yankee tunic , and took [her]129-rachel place , while [she]129-rachel , smiling and panting , [her]129-rachel hands on [her]129-rachel sides , leaned against the wall , and watched in [her]129-rachel turn .

Then when the engine stopped , and the great hopper full of grain lay ready for the miller , [they]3326-the girls found [themselves]3326-the girls alone in [the barn]2887-the barn for a minute . [The girls]3326-the girls and [Janet]131-janet had gone to milk , and [Hastings]127-miss henderson with [them]3326-the girls . The colour rushed into [her]129-rachel cheeks .

" _ Must [you]129-rachel go _ ? "[129-rachel]

[Her]129-rachel manner amazed [him]2892-he . [He]2892-he had expected that one so ambitious and energetic in [her]129-rachel own way of life would have greeted [his]2892-he news with eagerness . The proposal was really a great compliment to [him]2892-he -- and a great chance .

" [I]2892-he do n't see how [I]2892-he could refuse it , "[2892-he] [he]2892-he said with an altered countenance . " Indeed -- [I]2892-he do n't think [I]2892-he could . "[2892-he]

[She]129-rachel dropped [her]129-rachel face into [her]129-rachel hands , and stared into the fire . In some trouble of mind , [he]2892-he knelt down beside [her]129-rachel , and put [his]2892-he arm round [her]129-rachel .

" [I]2892-he 'll write every day . It wo n't be long , [darling]3832-darling . "[2892-he]

[She]129-rachel shook [her]129-rachel head , and [he]2892-he felt a shudder run through [her]129-rachel .

" It 's silly of [me]129-rachel -- [I]129-rachel do n't know why -- but -- [I'm]129-rachel just afraid-- "[129-rachel]

" Afraid of what ? "[129-rachel]

[She]129-rachel smiled at [him]2892-he tremulously -- but [he]2892-he saw the tears in [her]129-rachel eyes .

" [I]129-rachel told [you]2892-he -- [I]129-rachel ca n't always help it . [I]129-rachel 'm [a fool]3626-a fool , [I]129-rachel suppose -- but-- "[129-rachel]

Then [she]129-rachel threw [her]129-rachel arms round [his]2892-he neck -- murmuring in [his]2892-he ear : " [You]2892-he 'll have time to think -- when [you]2892-he 're away from [me]129-rachel -- that it was a great pity -- [you]2892-he ever asked [me]129-rachel . "[129-rachel]

[He]2892-he kissed and scolded [her]129-rachel , till [she]129-rachel smiled again . Afterwards [she]129-rachel made a strong effort to discuss the thing reasonably . Of course [he]2892-he must go -- it would be a great opening -- a great experience . And [they]2904-they would have all the more time to consider [their]2904-they own affairs . But all the evening afterwards [he]2892-he felt in some strange way that [he]2892-he had struck [her]129-rachel a blow from which [she]129-rachel was trying in vain to rally . Was it all the effect of [her]129-rachel suffering at [that brute]2905-that brute 's hands -- aided by the emotion and strain of the recent scenes between [herself]129-rachel and [him]2892-he ?

As for [her]129-rachel , when [she]129-rachel turned back from the gate where [she]129-rachel had bid [him]2892-he good - bye , [she]129-rachel saw [Janet]131-janet in the doorway waiting for [her]129-rachel almost with a sense of exasperation . [She]129-rachel had not yet said one word to [Janet]131-janet . That plunge was all to take !

[XIV

Rachel]129-rachel woke the following morning in that dreary mood when all the colour and the glamour seem to have been washed out of life , and the hopes and dreams which keep up a perpetual chatter in every normal mind are suddenly dumb .

How was [she]129-rachel going to face [Ellesborough]198-ellesborough 's long absence ? It had been recently assumed between [them]2906-them that [he]198-ellesborough would be very soon released from [[his]198-ellesborough forestry post]2907-his forestry post , that the infantry commission [he]198-ellesborough had been promised would come to nothing , now the Armistice was signed , and that in a very few weeks [they]2906-them would be free to think only of [themselves]2906-them and [their]2906-them own future . This offer of Intelligence work at [the American Headquarters]2901-the american headquarters had changed everything .

In ten days , if nothing happened , [he]198-ellesborough would be gone , and [she]129-rachel would be left behind to grapple alone with [Roger]179-delane -- who might at any moment torment [her]129-rachel again ; with the presence of [Dempsey]194-dempsey , who was thinking of settling in [the village]304-the village , and for whom [she]129-rachel would be called upon very soon to fulfil the hopes [she]129-rachel had raised in [him]198-ellesborough ; and finally , with the struggle and misery in [her]129-rachel own mind .

But something must happen . As [she]129-rachel was dressing by candle - light in the winter dawn , [her]129-rachel thoughts were rushing forward -- leaping some unexplored obstacles lying in the foreground -- to a possible marriage before [Ellesborough]198-ellesborough went to [France]27-france ; just a quiet walk to [a registry office]3865-a registry office , without any fuss or [any witness]2911-any witness but [Janet]131-janet . If [she]129-rachel could reach [that haven]2912-that haven , [she]129-rachel would be safe ; and this dumb fever of anxiety , this terrified conviction that in the end Fate would somehow take [him]198-ellesborough from [her]129-rachel , would be soothed away .

But how to reach it ? For there was now between [them]2913-them , till [they]2913-them also were revealed and confessed , a whole new series of events : not only the [Tanner]201-tanner episode , but [Delane]179-delane 's reappearance , [her]129-rachel interview with [him]198-ellesborough , [her]129-rachel rash attempt to silence [Dempsey]194-dempsey . By what [she]129-rachel had done in [her]129-rachel bewilderment and fear , in order to escape the penalty of frankness , [she]129-rachel might only -- as [she]129-rachel was now beginning to perceive -- have stumbled into fresh dangers . It was as though [she]129-rachel stood on [the friable edge of some great crater]2914-the friable edge of some great crater , [some gulf of destruction]2915-some gulf of destruction , on which [her]129-rachel feet were perpetually slipping and sinking , and only [Ellesborough]198-ellesborough 's hold could ultimately save [her]129-rachel .

And [Janet's]264-janet's -- [Janet]131-janet 's first . [Rachel]129-rachel 's thought clung to [her]129-rachel , as [the shipwrecked Southern sailor]2916-the shipwrecked southern sailor turns to [[his]2916-the shipwrecked southern sailor local saint]2917-his local saint to intercede for [him]2916-the shipwrecked southern sailor with the greater spiritual lights . [Janet]131-janet 's counsel and help -- [she]129-rachel knew [she]129-rachel must ask for [them]2918-them -- that it was the next step . Yet [she]129-rachel had been weakly putting it off day by day . And through this mist of doubt and dread , there kept striking all the time , as though quite independent of it , the natural thoughts of [a woman in love]2919-a woman in love .

During the farm breakfast , hurried through by candle - light , with rain beating on the windows , [Rachel]129-rachel was thinking--"Why did n't _ [he]2916-the shipwrecked southern sailor _ propose it?"--this[129-rachel] scheme of marrying before [he]2916-the shipwrecked southern sailor went . Was n't it a most natural thing to occur to [him]2916-the shipwrecked southern sailor ? [She]129-rachel tormented [herself]129-rachel all the morning with the problem of [his]2916-the shipwrecked southern sailor silence .

Then -- as though in rebuke of [her]129-rachel folly -- at midday came [a messenger]2920-a messenger , [a boy on a bicycle]2921-a boy on a bicycle , with a letter . [She]129-rachel took it up to [[her]129-rachel own room]2482-her own room , and read it with fluttering breath -- laughing , yet with tears in [her]129-rachel eyes .

" [[My]129-rachel Darling]4151-my darling -- What [an idiot]3994-an idiot [I]129-rachel was last night ! This morning [I]129-rachel have woke up to a brilliant idea -- why [I]129-rachel did n't propose it to [you]4151-my darling yesterday [I]129-rachel ca n't imagine ! Let [us]4153-us marry before [I]129-rachel go . Meet [me]129-rachel in [London]11-london , a week to - day , and let [us]4153-us go into [the country]950-the country , or to [the sea]4124-the sea , for a blessed forty - eight hours , afterwards . Then [you]4151-my darling will see [me]129-rachel off -- and [I]129-rachel shall know , wherever [I]129-rachel go , that [you]4151-my darling are [my]129-rachel very , very own , and [I]129-rachel am [yours]4151-my darling . [I]129-rachel do n't want to hurry [you]4151-my darling . Take time to think , and write to [me]129-rachel to - night , or wire [me]129-rachel to - morrow morning . But the very idea that [you]4151-my darling may say ' Yes ' makes [me]129-rachel [the happiest of [men]3205-men]4156-the happiest of men . Take time to think -- but -- all the same -- don't keep [me]129-rachel too long waiting ![129-rachel]

" [Your]4151-my darling own ,[129-rachel]

" G.E. "[129-rachel]

All day [she]2923-she kept the letter hidden in the loose front of [her]2923-she dress . " [I]2923-she 'll wire to - morrow morning , "[2923-she] [she]2923-she thought . But before that -- something had got to happen . Every now and then [she]2923-she would pause in [her]2923-she own work to watch [Janet]131-janet -- [Janet]131-janet butter - making , [Janet]131-janet feeding the calves , [Janet]131-janet cooking -- for on [that homely figure in white cap and apron]2924-that homely figure in white cap and apron everything seemed to depend .

The frost had come , and clear skies with it . The day passed in various miscellaneous business , under shelter , in [the big barn]1170-the big barn .

And at night , after supper , [Rachel]129-rachel stood on the front steps looking into a wide starry heaven , moonless , cold , and still . [Betty]141-betty and [Jenny]131-janet had just gone up to bed . [Janet]131-janet was in [the kitchen]3239-the kitchen , putting the porridge for the morrow 's breakfast which [she]131-janet had just made into the hay - box , which would keep it steaming all night . But [she]131-janet would soon have done work . The moment seemed to have come .

[Rachel]129-rachel walked into [the kitchen]3239-the kitchen and closed the door behind [her]129-rachel . The supper had been cleared away and the table on which [they]2928-they had eaten [it]2929-it shone spotlessly clean and bare . The fire would soon be raked out for the night , and [Janet]131-janet would lay the breakfast before [she]131-janet left [the kitchen]3239-the kitchen . Everything was in the neatest possible order , and the brilliant polish of a great stew - pan hanging on the wall particularly caught the eye . [Janet]131-janet was humming to [herself]131-janet -- one of the war tunes -- when [Rachel]129-rachel entered .

" [Janet]131-janet , [I]129-rachel want to speak to [you]131-janet . "[129-rachel]

[Janet]131-janet looked up -- startled . And yet something in [her]131-janet was not startled ! [She]131-janet had been strangely expectant all these days . It seemed to [her]131-janet [she]131-janet had already seen [Rachel]129-rachel come in like that -- had already heard [her]129-rachel say those words .

[She]131-janet shut up the hay - box , and came gently forward .

" Here , [Rachel]129-rachel ? "[131-janet]

" [You]129-rachel 've nearly done ? "[131-janet]

" In a few minutes . If [you]129-rachel 'll go into [the sitting - room]447-the sitting - room , [I]131-janet 'll join [you]129-rachel directly . "[131-janet]

And while [she]131-janet hurried through the rest of [her]131-janet work , [her]131-janet mind was really running forward in prophecy . [She]131-janet more or less knew what [she]131-janet was going to hear . And as [she]131-janet closed the kitchen door behind [her]131-janet there was in [her]131-janet a tremulous sense as though of some sacred responsibility .

[Rachel]129-rachel was crouching over the fire as usual , and [Janet]131-janet drew up a stool beside [her]129-rachel , and laid a hand on [her]131-janet knee .

" What is it ? "[131-janet]

[Rachel]129-rachel turned .

" [I]131-janet told [you]131-janet one secret , [Janet]131-janet , the other day . Now this is another . And it's-- "[131-janet] [She]131-janet flushed , and broke off , beginning again after a moment--"I did n't mean to tell [you]131-janet , or [any one]3450-any one . [I]131-janet ca n't make up [my]131-janet mind whether [I]131-janet 'm bound to or not . But [I]131-janet want [you]131-janet to advise [me]131-janet , [Janet]131-janet . [I]131-janet 'm awfully troubled . "[131-janet]

And suddenly , [she]131-janet slipped to the floor , and laid [her]131-janet head against [Janet]131-janet 's knees , hiding [her]131-janet face .

[Janet]131-janet bent over [her]131-janet , instinctively caressing the brown hair . [She]131-janet was only three or four years older than [Rachel]129-rachel , but [she]131-janet looked much older , and the close linen cap [she]131-janet wore on butter - making afternoons , and had not yet removed , gave [her]131-janet a gently austere look , like that of [a religious]2931-a religious .

" Tell [me]2931-a religious -- [I'll]2931-a religious do [my]2931-a religious best . "[2931-a religious]

" In the first place , "[129-rachel] said [Rachel]129-rachel , in a low voice , " who do [you]131-janet think was the ghost ? "[129-rachel]

" What do [you]131-janet mean ? "[2931-a religious]

" The ghost -- was [Roger Delane]179-delane ! "[129-rachel]

[Janet]131-janet uttered an exclamation of surprise and horror -- while fact after fact rushed together in [her]131-janet mind , fitting into one explanatory whole . Why had [she]131-janet never thought of that possibility , among all [the others]893-the others ?

" Oh , [Rachel]129-rachel , have [you]129-rachel ever seen [him]4160-him ? "[2931-a religious]

" Twice . [He]4160-him stopped [me]2931-a religious on [the road]3145-the road , when [I]2931-a religious was coming back from [Millsborough]43-millsborough on [Armistice Day]110-armistice day . "[2931-a religious]

" [I]131-janet always thought [he]4160-him was in [Canada]13-canada ? "[131-janet] said [Janet]131-janet , in bewilderment . " What did [he]4160-him want ? Have [you]131-janet told [Captain Ellesborough]149-ellesborough ? "[131-janet]

" No , [I]2931-a religious have n't told [George]198-ellesborough . [I]2931-a religious do n't know whether [I]2931-a religious shall . [Roger]179-delane wanted money -- as usual . [I]2931-a religious gave [him]4160-him some . "[2931-a religious]

" _ [You]131-janet gave [him]4160-him some ! [Rachel]129-rachel ! _ "[131-janet]

" [I]2931-a religious had to -- [I]2931-a religious had to buy [him]4160-him off . And [I]2931-a religious 've seen [John Dempsey]194-dempsey also without [your]129-rachel knowing . And [I]2931-a religious 've had to bribe [him]194-dempsey too . "[2931-a religious]

[Rachel]129-rachel was now sitting up , very hard and erect , [her]129-rachel hands round [her]129-rachel knees . [Her]129-rachel first object seemed to be to avoid emotion , and to prevent [Janet]131-janet from showing any . [Janet]131-janet had gone very pale . The name " [Dick Tanner]201-tanner "[131-janet] was drumming in [her]131-janet ear .

" [I]129-rachel know [you]131-janet ca n't understand [me]129-rachel , [Janet]131-janet , "[129-rachel] said [Rachel]129-rachel , after a pause , " [you]131-janet could never do what [I]129-rachel 've done . [I]129-rachel dare say when [you]131-janet 've let [me]129-rachel tell [you]131-janet the story [you]131-janet 'll not be able to forgive [me]129-rachel . [You]131-janet 'll think [I]129-rachel ought never to have let [you]131-janet settle with [me]129-rachel -- that [I]129-rachel told a lie when [I]129-rachel said [I]129-rachel was n't [a bad woman]3278-a bad woman -- that [I]129-rachel 've disgraced [you]131-janet . [I]129-rachel hope [you]131-janet wo n't . That -- that would about finish it . "[129-rachel] [Her]2933-her voice shook at last .

[Janet]131-janet was speechless . But instinctively [she]131-janet laid a hand on [Rachel]129-rachel 's shoulder . And at the touch , in a moment , the story came out .

Confused and hardly intelligible ! For [Rachel]129-rachel [herself]129-rachel could scarcely now disentangle all the threads and motives of it . But certain things stood out -- the figure of [a young artist]2934-a young artist , sensitive , pure - minded , sincere , with certain fatal weaknesses of judgment and will , which had made [him]2934-a young artist a rolling stone , and the despair of [[his]2934-a young artist best friends]2935-his best friends , but , as compared with [Roger Delane]179-delane after six months of marriage -- [Hyperion]265-hyperion to [a satyr]2936-a satyr ; then the attraction of [such a man]2937-such a man for [[his]2934-a young artist neighbour]1271-his neighbour , [a young wife]2939-a young wife , brought up in [a refined home]2940-a refined home , [the child of [a saint and dreamer]2942-a saint and dreamer , outraged since [her]2939-a young wife marriage in every fibre by the conduct and ways of [[her]2939-a young wife husband]1294-her husband , and smarting under the sense of [her]2939-a young wife own folly]2941-the child of a saint and dreamer , outraged since her marriage in every fibre by the conduct and ways of her husband , and smarting under the sense of her own folly ; [their]2944-their friendship , so blameless till its last moment , with nothing to hide , and little to regret , [a woman]3156-a woman 's only refuge indeed from hours of degradation and misery ; and finally the triumph of something which was not passion , at least on [Rachel]129-rachel 's side , but of mere opportunity , strengthened , made irresistible , by [the woman]924-the woman 's pain and despair : so the tale , the common tale , ran .

" [I]129-rachel did n't love [him]2937-such a man , "[129-rachel] said [Rachel]129-rachel at last , [her]129-rachel hands over [her]129-rachel eyes--"I do n't pretend [I]129-rachel did . [I]129-rachel liked [him]2937-such a man -- [I]129-rachel was awfully sorry for [him]2937-such a man -- as [he]2937-such a man was for [me]129-rachel . But -- well , there it is ! [I]129-rachel went over to [[his]2937-such a man house]2220-his house . There was silence a little . [Janet]131-janet 's thoughts were in a tumult . [Rachel]129-rachel began again :

" Now , why am [I]129-rachel telling [you]131-janet all this ? [I]129-rachel need never have told [anybody]3236-anybody -- at least up to a few days ago . [She]129-rachel turned sharply upon [Janet--]267-janet--

" Except [this man who turned up here in [[George]198-ellesborough 's own camp]4173-george 's own camp]4172-this man who turned up here in george 's own camp -- and in [the village]304-the village , two months ago , but whom [I]129-rachel never saw till this week--_this week_--Armistice Day -- [John Dempsey]194-dempsey . [I]129-rachel was -- well , just that evening , [I]129-rachel was awfully happy . [I]129-rachel expected nothing . And then -- within twenty minutes-- "[129-rachel]

And at that [her]129-rachel composure broke down .

" Why did [I]129-rachel do it ? "[129-rachel] [she]129-rachel said wildly , springing to [her]129-rachel feet . " It was idiotic ! Because it is true!--_it 's true!_--and [I]129-rachel 'm terrified . If [I]129-rachel lost [George]198-ellesborough , [I]129-rachel should kill [myself]129-rachel . [I]129-rachel never thought [I]129-rachel should be -- [I]129-rachel could be -- in love with [anybody like this]4178-anybody like this . And now [I]129-rachel 've found [him]3820-somebody -- and -- Do [you]131-janet know what that is ? "[129-rachel]

[She]2949-i pulled a letter out of [her]2949-i pocket , and looked at [Janet]131-janet through a mist of despairing tears .

" It 's a letter from [George]198-ellesborough . It came this morning . [He]198-ellesborough wants [me]2949-i to marry [him]198-ellesborough at once -- next week . [He]198-ellesborough 's got some new work in [France]27-france , and [he]198-ellesborough saw that [I]2949-i was miserable because [he]198-ellesborough was going away . And why should n't [I]2949-i ? _ Why should n't [I]2949-i ? _ [I]2949-i love [him]198-ellesborough . There 's nothing wrong with [me]2949-i , except that wretched story . Well , there are two reasons . [First"--she]268-first"--she[2949-i] spoke with slow and bitter emphasis--"I do n't believe for a moment [Roger]179-delane will keep [his]198-ellesborough word . [I]2949-i know [him]198-ellesborough . [He]198-ellesborough is frightfully ill . [He]198-ellesborough says [he]198-ellesborough 's dying . [He]198-ellesborough may die -- before [he]198-ellesborough 's got through this money . That would be the best thing that could happen to [me]2949-i -- wouldn't it ?
