[She]2950-she sank down again on the floor , kneeling , and put [her]2950-she hands on [Janet]131-janet 's knees .

" [You]131-janet see , [Janet]131-janet , do n't [you]131-janet ? [You]131-janet see ? "[2950-she]

It was the cry of a soul in anguish .

" [You]131-janet poor , poor thing ! "[2950-she]

[Janet]131-janet , trembling from head to foot , bowed [her]131-janet head on [Rachel]129-rachel 's , and [the two]1806-the two clung together , in silence , broken only by two deep sobs from [Rachel]129-rachel . Then [Janet]131-janet disengaged [herself]131-janet . [She]131-janet was pale , but no longer agitated , and [her]131-janet blue eyes which were [her]131-janet only beauty were clear and shining .

" [You]131-janet 'll let [me]131-janet say just what [I]131-janet feel , [Rachel]129-rachel ? "[131-janet]

" Of course . "[131-janet]

" [You]131-janet ca n't marry [him]4183-him without telling [him]4183-him . No , no -- [you]131-janet could n't do that ! "[131-janet]

[Rachel]129-rachel said nothing . [She]129-rachel was , sitting on the floor , [her]131-janet eyes turned away from [Janet]131-janet .

" [You]131-janet could n't do that , [Rachel]129-rachel , "[131-janet] [Janet]131-janet resumed , as though [she]131-janet were urgently thinking [her]131-janet way ; " [you]131-janet 'd never have a happy moment . "[131-janet]

" Oh , yes , of course , "[129-rachel] said [Rachel]129-rachel , throwing up [her]129-rachel head with a half scornful gesture . " [One]279-one says that -- but how do [you]131-janet know ? [I]129-rachel might never think of it again -- if [Roger]179-delane and [that man]3736-that man [Dempsey]194-dempsey were out of the way . It 's dead -- it 's _ dead _ ! Why do [we]4186-we trouble about such things ! "[129-rachel]

" It would be dead , "[131-janet] said [Janet]131-janet in a low voice , " if [you]131-janet 'd told [him]3736-that man -- and [he]3736-that man 'd forgiven ! "[131-janet]

" What has [he]3736-that man to do with it ? "[129-rachel] cried [Rachel]129-rachel , stubbornly , " it was before [he]3736-that man knew [me]129-rachel . [I]129-rachel was [a different being]4187-a different being . "[129-rachel]

" No -- it is always the same self , which [we]4186-we are making , all the time . Do n't [you]131-janet see -- [dear]3609-dear , dear Rachel!--it 's [your]131-janet chance now to put it all behind [you]131-janet -- just by being true . Oh , [I]129-rachel do n't want to preach to [you]131-janet -- but [I]129-rachel see it so clearly ! "[129-rachel]

" But it is n't as [a man]3155-a man would see it -- [a man like [George]198-ellesborough]4190-a man like george , "[129-rachel] said [Rachel]129-rachel , shaking [her]129-rachel head . " Look there"--she[129-rachel] pointed to a little bundle of letters lying on the table--"there are letters from [[his]3736-that man people]1196-his people which [he]3736-that man brought [me]129-rachel this morning . It 's awful!--how [they]1196-his people take [me]129-rachel at [his]3736-that man valuation -- just because [he]3736-that man loves [me]129-rachel . [I]129-rachel must be everything that 's good , because [he]3736-that man says so . And [you]4192-you can see what kind of people [they]1196-his people are -- what [they]1196-his people think of [him]3736-that man -- and what [they]1196-his people imagine about [me]129-rachel -- what [they]1196-his people think [I]129-rachel _ must _ be -- for [him]3736-that man to love [me]129-rachel . [I]129-rachel do n't mean [they]1196-his people 're [prigs]4193-prigs -- [they]1196-his people are n't a bit . It 's just [their]1196-his people life coming out , quite naturally . [You]4192-you see what [they]1196-his people are -- quite simply -- what [they]1196-his people ca n't help being , and what [they]1196-his people expect from [him]3736-that man and [the woman [he]3736-that man marries]4194-the woman he marries . And [he]3736-that man 's got to take [me]129-rachel [home]3185-home to [them]1196-his people -- some time -- to present [me]129-rachel to [them]1196-his people . The divorce is difficult enough . "[129-rachel]

" What have [they]1196-his people to do with it ? "[131-janet] interrupted [Janet]131-janet . " It 's only [George]198-ellesborough that matters -- [no other person]4197-no other person has any right whatever to know ! [You]131-janet need n't consider [anybody else]2760-anybody else . "[131-janet]

" Yes -- but think of _ [him]3736-that man _ . It 's bad enough that [I]129-rachel should know something [he]3736-that man does n't know -- but at least _ [he]3736-that man 's _ spared . [He]3736-that man can take [me]129-rachel [home]3185-home to [[his]3736-that man mother]986-his mother -- whom [he]3736-that man adores -- and if _ [I]129-rachel _ know that [I]129-rachel 'm [a cheat and a sham]4201-a cheat and a sham -- [he]3736-that man does n't --it will be all easy for [him]3736-that man . "[129-rachel]

[Janet]131-janet was silenced for the moment by the sheer passion of the voice . [She]131-janet sat , groping a little , under the stress of [her]131-janet own thought , and praying inwardly -- without words -- for light and guidance .

" And think of _ [me]129-rachel _ , please ! "[129-rachel] [Rachel]129-rachel went on . " If [I]129-rachel tell [him]3736-that man , it 's done -- for ever . [He]3736-that man 'll forgive [me]129-rachel , [I]129-rachel think . [He]3736-that man may be everything that 's dear , and good , and kind"--her[129-rachel] voice broke--"but it 'd hit [him]3736-that man dreadfully hard . [A man like that]4202-a man like that ca n't forget such a thing . When [I]2952-i 've once said it , [I]2952-i shall have changed everything between [us]4203-us . [He]3736-that man must think -- some time -- when [he]3736-that man 's alone -- when [I]2952-i 'm not there--'It was [Dick Tanner]201-tanner once -- it will be [some one else]3969-some one else another time ! ' [I]2952-i shall have been pulled down from the place where [he]3736-that man puts [me]2952-i now -- even after [he]3736-that man knows all about [Roger]179-delane and the divorce -- pulled down for good and all -- however much [he]3736-that man may pity [me]2952-i -- however good [he]3736-that man may be to [me]2952-i . It will be love perhaps -- but another kind of love . [He]3736-that man ca n't trust [me]2952-i again . [No one]570-no one could . And it 's that [I]2952-i ca n't bear -- [I]2952-i ca n't _ bear _ ! "[2952-i]

[She]2952-i looked defiantly at [Janet]131-janet , and [the little room]2953-the little room with [its]2953-the little room simple furnishings seemed too small a stage for such an energy of fear and distress .

" Yes -- that [you]2952-i could bear , "[131-janet] said [Janet]131-janet quietly , " with [him]3736-that man to help [you]2952-i -- and [God]176-god . It would all straighten out in the end -- because the first step would be right . "[131-janet]

[Rachel]129-rachel turned upon [her]131-janet .

" Now that [I]129-rachel 've told [you]131-janet , "[129-rachel] [she]129-rachel cried , " can _ [you]131-janet _ ever think the same of [me]129-rachel again ? [You]131-janet know [you]131-janet ca n't ! "[129-rachel]

[Janet]131-janet caught [her]129-rachel cold hands , and held them close , looking up to [her]129-rachel .

" Not the same -- no , not the same ! But if [I]131-janet cared for [you]129-rachel before , [Rachel]129-rachel -- [I]131-janet care for [you]129-rachel ten thousand times more now . Do n't [you]131-janet see?--it will be the same with [him]4206-him ? "[131-janet]

[Rachel]129-rachel shook [her]129-rachel head .

" No -- [a _ man]4207-a _ man 's _ different , "[129-rachel] [she]129-rachel repeated , " [a man]3155-a man 's different ! "[129-rachel]

" Anyway , [you]129-rachel _ must _ , "[131-janet] said [Janet]131-janet resolutely , " [you]129-rachel know [you]129-rachel must . [You]129-rachel do n't need [me]131-janet to tell [you]129-rachel . "[131-janet]

[Rachel]129-rachel wrenched [herself]129-rachel away with a little moan and hid [her]129-rachel face in [her]129-rachel hands as [she]129-rachel leaned against the mantelpiece . [Janet]131-janet , looking up , and transfigured by that spiritual energy , that ultimate instinctive faith which was the root force in [her]131-janet , went on , pleading .

" [Dear Rachel]129-rachel , [one]279-one goes on living side by side -- doing [one]279-one 's daily work -- and thinking just [one]279-one 's ordinary thoughts -- and all the time [one]279-one never speaks of the biggest things of all -- the only things that matter , really . Is n't it [God]176-god that matters -- and the law in [our]4213-we hearts ? If [we]4213-we break it -- if [we]4213-we are n't true -- if [we]4213-we wrong those that love [us]4213-we -- if [we]4213-we injure and deceive -- how will it be when [we]4213-we grow old -- when [we]4213-we come to die ? Whatever [our]4213-we gain -- [we]4213-we shall have lost [our]4213-we souls ? "[131-janet]

" [You]129-rachel think [I]129-rachel should injure [him]4214-him by marrying [him]4214-him ? "[129-rachel] cried [Rachel]129-rachel .

" No -- no ! A thousand times , no ! But by deceiving [him]4214-him -- by not trusting [him]4214-him -- with all [your]129-rachel heart , and all [your]129-rachel life -- that would be the worst injury . "[131-janet]

" How do [you]129-rachel know all there may have been in [his]4214-him life ? "[129-rachel] said [Rachel]129-rachel , vehemently--"I do n't ask . "[129-rachel]

" [I]131-janet think [you]129-rachel do know . "[131-janet]

[Rachel]129-rachel considered the words , finally dropping [her]129-rachel face again out of sight .

" Well , [I]129-rachel dare say [I]129-rachel do ! "[129-rachel] [she]129-rachel said wearily . " Of course [he]4214-him 's a hundred times too good for [me]129-rachel . "[129-rachel]

" Do n't turn it off like that ! It 's for [oneself]4215-oneself [one]279-one has to think -- [one]279-one 's own fulfilling of the law . Love--_is _ the fulfilling of the law . And love means trust -- and truth . "[131-janet]

[Janet]131-janet 's voice sank . [She]131-janet had said [her]131-janet say . [Rachel]129-rachel was silent for some time , and [Janet]131-janet sat motionless . The clock and the fire were the only sounds . At last [Rachel]129-rachel moved . With a long sigh , [she]129-rachel pressed back the ruffled hair from [her]129-rachel temples , and standing tiptoe before a small mirror that hung over the mantelpiece , [she]129-rachel began to pin up some coils that had broken loose . When that was done , [she]129-rachel turned slowly towards [Janet]131-janet .

" Very well . That 's settled . How shall it be done ? Shall [I]129-rachel write it or say it ? "[129-rachel]

[Janet]131-janet gasped a little between laughing and crying . Then [she]131-janet caught [Rachel]129-rachel 's cold unresisting hand , and laid it tenderly against [her]131-janet own cheek .

" Write it . "[131-janet]

" All right . "[2954-an automaton] The voice was that of [an automaton]2954-an automaton . " How shall [I]131-janet send it ? "[131-janet]

" Would [you]131-janet -- would [you]131-janet trust [me]131-janet to take it ? "[131-janet]

" [You]131-janet mean -- [you'd]129-rachel talk to [him]198-ellesborough ? "[131-janet]

" If [you]131-janet gave [me]131-janet leave . "[131-janet]

[Rachel]129-rachel thought a little , and then made a scarcely perceptible sign of assent . A few more words passed as to the best time at which to find [Ellesborough]198-ellesborough at leisure . It was decided that [Janet]131-janet should aim at catching [him]198-ellesborough in the midday dinner hour . " [I]131-janet should bicycle , and get [home]3185-home before dark . "[131-janet]

" And now let 's talk of something else , "[129-rachel] said [Rachel]129-rachel , imperiously .

[She]129-rachel found some business letters that had to be answered , and set to work on them . [Janet]131-janet wrote up [her]131-janet milk records and dairy accounts . The fire sank gently to its end . [Janet]131-janet 's cat came with tail outstretched , and rubbed itself sociably , first against [Janet]131-janet 's skirts , and then against [Rachel]129-rachel . No trace remained in [the little room]2953-the little room , where [the two women]763-the two women sat at [their]763-the two women daily work , of the scene which had passed between [them]763-the two women , except in [Rachel]129-rachel 's pallor , and the occasional shaking of [her]129-rachel hand as it passed over the paper .

Then when [Janet]131-janet put up [her]131-janet papers with a look at the clock , which was just going to strike ten o'clock , [Rachel]129-rachel too cleared away , and with that instinct for air and the open which was a relic of [her]131-janet Canadian life , and made [any closed room]2957-any closed room after a time an oppression to [her]131-janet , [she]131-janet threw a cloak over [her]131-janet shoulders , and went out again to breathe the night . There was a young horse who , on the previous day , had needed [the vet]2958-the vet . [She]131-janet went across [the yard]610-the yard to [the stable]488-the stable to look at [him]2958-the vet .

All was well with the horse , whose swollen hock had been comfortably bandaged by [Hastings]127-miss henderson before [he]2958-the vet left . But as [she]131-janet stood beside [him]2958-the vet , close to the divided door , opening on [the hill]369-the hill , of which both the horizontal halves were now shut , [she]131-janet was aware of certain movements on the other side of the door -- [some one passing it]2962-some one passing it -- footsteps . [Her]131-janet nerves gave a jump . Could it be?--_again _ ! Impetuously [she]131-janet went to the door , threw open the upper half , and looked out . Nothing -- but the faint starlight on [the hill]369-the hill , and [the woods crowning]2964-the woods crowning [it]369-the hill .

[She]131-janet called .

" Who 's there ? "[131-janet] But [no one]570-no one answered .

Fancy , of course . But with the knowledge [she]131-janet now had , [she]131-janet could not bring [herself]131-janet to go round [the farm]345-the farm . Instead [she]131-janet carefully closed the stable shutter , and ran back across [the yard]610-the yard into [the shelter of [the house]337-the house]2968-the shelter of the house , locking the front door behind [her]131-janet , and going into [the sitting - room]447-the sitting - room and [the kitchen]3239-the kitchen , to see that the windows were fastened .

[Janet]131-janet was waiting for [her]131-janet at the top of the stairs . [They]2972-they kissed [each other]460-each other gravely , in silence , like [those who feel that the time for speech]2974-those who feel that the time for speech is done . Then [Rachel]129-rachel went into [[her]129-rachel room]2975-her room , and [Janet]131-janet heard [her]129-rachel turn the key . [Janet]131-janet [herself]131-janet slept intermittently . But whenever [she]131-janet woke , it seemed to [her]131-janet that there was some slight sound in [the next room]2976-the next room -- a movement or a rustle , which showed that [Rachel]129-rachel was still awake -- and up ?

It was a night indeed which left [Rachel]129-rachel with that sense of strange illuminations , of life painfully enlarged and deepened , which love and suffering may always bring to [the woman who is capable of love and suffering]2977-the woman who is capable of love and suffering . [She]131-janet had spent the hours in writing to [Ellesborough]198-ellesborough , and in that letter [she]131-janet had unpacked [her]131-janet heart to its depths , [Janet]131-janet guessed . When [she]131-janet received the letter from [Rachel]129-rachel on the morrow , [she]131-janet handled it as a sacred thing .

XV

The frost held . A sun of pearl and fire rose over [the hill]369-the hill , as the stars finally faded out in the winter morning , and a brilliant rime lay sparkling on all [the pastures]2979-the pastures and on [the slopes of the down]2980-the slopes of the down . The brilliance had partly vanished from the lower grounds when [Janet]131-janet started on [her]131-janet way ; but on [the high commons]2981-the high commons , winter was at its gayest and loveliest . [The distant woods]2982-the distant woods were a mist of brown and azure , encircling the broad frost - whitened spaces ; the great single beeches and oaks under which [Spenser]270-spenser or [Sidney]271-sidney -- [the great Will]2983-the great will [himself]2983-the great will -- might have walked , shot up , magnificent , into a clear sky , proudly sheltering the gnarled thorns and furze - bushes which marched beside and round them , like dwarfs in a pageant .

Half way up [the hill]369-the hill , [Janet]131-janet came across [old Betts]182-betts bringing down a small cart - full of furze for fodder , and [she]131-janet stopped to speak to [him]182-betts . A little later on , nearer to [the camp]3224-the camp [she]131-janet overtook [Dempsey]194-dempsey , who rather officiously joined [her]131-janet , and assuming at once that [she]131-janet was in quest of [the Camp Commandant]2986-the camp commandant , directed [her]131-janet to a short cut leading straight to [[Ellesborough]198-ellesborough 's quarters]2987-ellesborough 's quarters . There was a slight something in the manner of [both men]308-both men that jarred on [Janet]131-janet -- as though [their]308-both men lips said one thing and [their]308-both men eyes another -- furtive in the case of [Betts]182-betts , a trifle insolent in that of [Dempsey]194-dempsey . [She]131-janet with [her]131-janet tragic knowledge guessed uncomfortably at what it meant . [Dempsey]194-dempsey -- as [she]131-janet had made up [her]131-janet mind after ten minutes ' talk with [him]194-dempsey -- was a vain gossip . It had been madness on [Rachel]129-rachel 's part to give [him]194-dempsey the smallest hold on [her]129-rachel . Very likely [he]194-dempsey had not yet actually betrayed [her]129-rachel -- [his]194-dempsey hope of favours to come might have been sufficient to prevent that . But [his]194-dempsey self - importance would certainly show itself somehow -- in a hint or a laugh . [He]194-dempsey had probably already roused in [the village]304-the village mind a prying curiosity , a suspicion of something underhand , which might alter [Rachel]129-rachel 's whole relation to [[her]129-rachel neighbours]2057-her neighbours . For once give [an English country - side]2991-an english country - side reason to suspect a scandal , and it will pluck it bare in time , with a slow and secret persistence .

Well , after all , if the situation became disagreeable , [Rachel]129-rachel would only have to choose [[Ellesborough]149-ellesborough 's country]2992-ellesborough 's country as [her]129-rachel own , and begin [her]129-rachel new life [there]377-there .

_ Supposing that all went well ! _ [Janet]131-janet 's mind went through some painful alterations of confidence and fear , as [she]131-janet walked [her]131-janet bicycle along the rough forest - track leading to [[Ellesborough]198-ellesborough 's hut]2994-ellesborough 's hut . [She]131-janet believed [him]194-dempsey to be deeply in love with [Rachel]129-rachel , and the spiritual passion in [her]131-janet seemed to realize in [the man]3153-the man 's inmost nature , behind all [his]194-dempsey practical ability , and [his]194-dempsey short business manner , powers of pity and tenderness like [her]131-janet own . But if [she]131-janet were wrong ? If this second revelation put too great a strain upon one brought up in an exceptionally strict school where certain standards of conduct were simply taken for granted ?

Mystic , and puritan as [she]131-janet was , there were moments when [Janet]131-janet felt [her]131-janet responsibility almost unbearable . [Rachel]129-rachel deserted -- [Rachel]129-rachel in despair -- [Rachel]129-rachel turning on [the woman who had advised [her]131-janet to [her]131-janet undoing]2996-the woman who had advised her to her undoing -- all these images were beating on [Janet]131-janet 's tremulous sense , as [the small military hut where [Ellesborough]198-ellesborough and two of [[his]198-ellesborough junior officers]2998-his junior officers lived]2997-the small military hut where ellesborough and two of his junior officers lived came into view , together with [that wide hollow of [the forestry camp]3000-the forestry camp where [he]198-ellesborough and [Rachel]129-rachel had first met]2999-that wide hollow of the forestry camp where he and rachel had first met . The letter in [her]131-janet pocket seemed a living and sinister thing . [She]131-janet had still power to retain it -- to keep it imprisoned .

[A lady in the dress of [the Women 's Forestry Corps]3002-the women 's forestry corps]3001-a lady in the dress of the women 's forestry corps appeared on another path leading to [[Ellesborough]198-ellesborough 's hut]2994-ellesborough 's hut . [Janet]131-janet recognized [Mrs. Fergusson]143-mrs. fergusson , and was soon greeted by a shout of welcome .

" Well , so [Miss Henderson]127-miss henderson 's engaged to [[our]3004-our Captain]4219-our captain ! "[143-mrs. fergusson] said [Mrs. Fergusson]143-mrs. fergusson , with a smiling countenance , as [they]3004-our shook hands . " [The girls here]4220-the girls here , and [I]143-mrs. fergusson , are awfully interested . [The camp]3224-the camp began it ! But do [you]131-janet want [the Captain]847-the captain ? [I]143-mrs. fergusson 'm afraid [he]847-the captain is n't [here]3217-here . "[143-mrs. fergusson]

[Janet]131-janet 's countenance fell .

" [I]131-janet thought [I]131-janet should be sure to find [him]847-the captain in the dinner hour . "[131-janet]

" No , [he]847-the captain went up to [town]450-town by [the first train]4225-the first train this morning on some business with [the Ministry]4226-the ministry . [We]3004-our expect [him]847-the captain back about three . "[143-mrs. fergusson]

It was not one o'clock . [Janet]131-janet pondered what to do .

" [You]143-mrs. fergusson wanted to see [him]847-the captain ? "[143-mrs. fergusson] said [Mrs. Fergusson]143-mrs. fergusson , full of sympathy .

" [I]143-mrs. fergusson brought a letter for [him]847-the captain . If [I]143-mrs. fergusson leave it , will [he]847-the captain be sure to get it directly [he]847-the captain returns ? "[143-mrs. fergusson]

" [[His]847-the captain servant]4227-his servant 's in [the hut]2695-the hut . Let 's talk to [him]847-the captain . "[143-mrs. fergusson]

[Mrs. Fergusson]143-mrs. fergusson rapped at the door of [the hut]2695-the hut , and walked in . [An elderly batman]3006-an elderly batman appeared .

" [I]131-janet have a letter for [Captain Ellesborough]149-ellesborough -- an important letter -- on business , "[131-janet] said [Janet]131-janet . " [I]131-janet was to wait for an answer . But as [he]847-the captain is n't here , where shall [I]131-janet leave it , so that [he]847-the captain will be certain to get it ? "[131-janet]

" On [his]847-the captain table , if [you]131-janet please , [ma'am]4006-ma'am , "[3007-the soldier] said [the soldier]3007-the soldier , opening the door of [the Captain]847-the captain 's small sitting - room--"I'll see that [he]847-the captain gets it . "[3007-the soldier]

" It 'll be quite safe ? "[131-janet] said [Janet]131-janet anxiously , placing it [herself]131-janet in a prominent place on the writing - table .

" Lor , yes , [ma'am]4006-ma'am . [Nobody]3230-nobody comes in here but [me]3007-the soldier , when [the Captain]847-the captain 's away . [I]3007-the soldier 'll tell [him]847-the captain of it directly [he]847-the captain comes [home]3185-home . "[3007-the soldier]

" May [I]3009-the servant just write a little note [myself]3009-the servant ? [I]3009-the servant expected to find [Captain Ellesborough]149-ellesborough in . "[3009-the servant]

[The servant]3009-the servant handed [her]131-janet a sheet of paper . [She]3009-the servant wrote--"I brought [Rachel]129-rachel 's letter , and am very disappointed not to see [you]131-janet . Come at once . Do n't delay . [Janet Leighton]131-janet . "[3009-the servant]

[She]131-janet slipped it into an envelope , which [she]131-janet addressed and left beside the other . Then [she]131-janet reluctantly left [the hut]2695-the hut with [Mrs. Fergusson]143-mrs. fergusson .

" [I]3011-that lady am so sorry [you]131-janet did n't find [him]4234-him , "[3011-that lady] said [that lady]3011-that lady . " Was it something about the wedding ? "[3011-that lady] [she]3011-that lady added , smiling , [her]3011-that lady feminine curiosity getting the better of [her]3011-that lady .

" Oh , no -- not yet , "[131-janet] said [Janet]131-janet , startled .

" Well , [I]143-mrs. fergusson suppose it wo n't be long , "[143-mrs. fergusson] laughed [Mrs. Fergusson]143-mrs. fergusson . " [He]4234-him 's desperately in love , [you]131-janet know ! "[143-mrs. fergusson]

[Janet]131-janet smiled in return , and [Mrs. Fergusson]143-mrs. fergusson , delighted to have the chance , broke out into praises of [[her]143-mrs. fergusson Commandant]3012-her commandant .

" [You]131-janet see , [[we]4235-we women who are doing all this new work with [men]3205-men]4236-we women who are doing all this new work with men , [we]4235-we know a jolly deal more about [them]3205-men than [we]4235-we ever did before . [I]143-mrs. fergusson can tell [you]131-janet , it searches [us]4235-we out , this joint life -- [both women]4238-both women and [men]3205-men . In [this camp]4240-this camp [you]131-janet ca n't hide what [you]131-janet are -- [the sort of man]4241-the sort of man -- or [the sort of woman]4242-the sort of woman . And there is n't [a woman in [this camp]4240-this camp]4243-a woman in this camp , if [she]4243-a woman in this camp 's been [here]3217-here any time , who would n't trust [the Captain]847-the captain for all [she]4243-a woman in this camp 's worth -- who would n't tell [him]847-the captain [her]4243-a woman in this camp love - affairs , or [her]4243-a woman in this camp debts -- or march up to a machine - gun , if [he]847-the captain told [her]4243-a woman in this camp . In a sense , [they]4247-they 're in love with [him]847-the captain , because -- as [you]131-janet 've no doubt found out , [he]847-the captain has a way with [him]847-the captain ! But [they]4247-they all know that [he]847-the captain 's never been anything to [them]4247-they but the best of [Commandants]272-commandants , and [a good friend]4248-a good friend . Oh , [I]143-mrs. fergusson could never have run [this camp]4240-this camp but for [him]847-the captain . [He]847-the captain and [I]143-mrs. fergusson 'll go together ! Of course [we]4250-we 're shutting up very soon . "[143-mrs. fergusson]

So [the pleasant Irishwoman]3013-the pleasant irishwoman ran on , as [she]3013-the pleasant irishwoman walked beside [Janet]131-janet and [her]131-janet bicycle to [the top of [the hill]369-the hill]2776-the top of the hill . [Janet]131-janet listened and smiled . [Her]131-janet own mind said ditto to it all . But nevertheless , the more [Ellesborough]149-ellesborough was set on a pinnacle by [this enthusiastic friend]3016-this enthusiastic friend and spectator of [his]149-ellesborough daily life , the more [[Rachel]129-rachel 's friend]1645-rachel 's friend trembled for [Rachel]129-rachel . [A lover]1652-a lover " not too bright and good "[1652-a lover] to understand -- and forgive -- that was what was wanted .

[She]3013-the pleasant irishwoman reached [the farm]345-the farm - gate about two o'clock , and [Rachel]129-rachel was there , waiting for [her]3013-the pleasant irishwoman . But before [they]3020-they met , [Rachel]129-rachel watching [her]3013-the pleasant irishwoman approach , saw that there was no news for [her]3013-the pleasant irishwoman .

" [He]149-ellesborough was n't [there]377-there ? "[129-rachel] [she]129-rachel said , drearily , as [Janet]131-janet reached [her]129-rachel .

[Janet]131-janet explained , and [they]3020-they walked up [the farm lane]2467-the farm lane together .

" [I]131-janet would have waited if [I]131-janet could , "[131-janet] [she]131-janet said in distress . " But it would have looked strange . [Mrs. Fergusson]143-mrs. fergusson would have suspected something wrong . "[131-janet]

" Oh no , [you]131-janet could n't have waited , "[129-rachel] said [Rachel]129-rachel , decidedly . " [Well!"--she]273-well!"--she[129-rachel] threw [her]129-rachel arms out in a great stretch--"it 's done . In half an hour [he]149-ellesborough 'll be reading the letter . It 's like waiting for [one]279-one 's execution , is n't it ? Nothing can stop it ; [I]129-rachel may be dead before tea ! "[129-rachel] [She]129-rachel gave a wild laugh .

" [Rachel]129-rachel ! "[131-janet]

" Well , that 's how [I]129-rachel feel . If [he]149-ellesborough gives [me]129-rachel up , it will be death -- though [I]129-rachel dare say [I]129-rachel shall go on fussing round [the farm]345-the farm , and [people]880-people will still talk to [me]129-rachel as if [I]129-rachel were alive . [But!"--she]274-but!"--she[129-rachel] shrugged [her]129-rachel shoulders .

" [He]149-ellesborough wo n't give [you]129-rachel up-- "[131-janet] said [Janet]131-janet , much troubled--"because -- because [he]149-ellesborough 's [a good man]2501-a good man . "[131-janet]

" All the more reason . If [I]3022-i were [he]149-ellesborough , [I]3022-i should give [me]3022-i up . Shall [I]3022-i tell [you]129-rachel a queer thing , [Janet]131-janet ? [I]3022-i hate [Roger]179-delane , as much as [I]3022-i can hate [anybody]3236-anybody . It would be a great relief to [me]3022-i if [I]3022-i heard [he]149-ellesborough were dead . And yet at the same time [I]3022-i see -- oh yes , [I]3022-i see quite plainly -- that [I]3022-i treated [him]149-ellesborough badly . [He]149-ellesborough told [me]3022-i so the other night -- and it is so -- it 's _ true _ . [I]3022-i never had the least patience with [him]149-ellesborough . And now [he]149-ellesborough 's dying -- at least [he]149-ellesborough says so -- and though [I]3022-i hate [him]149-ellesborough -- though [I]3022-i pray [I]3022-i may never , never see [him]149-ellesborough again , yet [I]3022-i 'm sorry for [him]149-ellesborough . Is n't that strange ? "[3022-i]

[She]3022-i looked at [Janet]131-janet with a queer flickering defiance , which was also a kind of remorse , in [her]3022-i eyes .

" No , it is n't strange . "[3022-i]

" Why not?--when [I]3022-i hate [him]149-ellesborough ? "[3022-i]

" [One]279-one can be sorry even for those one hates . [I]131-janet suppose [God]176-god is , "[131-janet] [Janet]131-janet added , after a pause .

[Rachel]129-rachel made a little face of scorn .

" Why should [God]176-god hate [any one]3450-any one ? [He]176-god made [us]4259-us . [He]176-god 's responsible . [He]176-god must have known what [He]176-god was doing . If [He]176-god really pitied [us]4259-us , would [He]176-god have made [us]4259-us at all ? "[129-rachel]

[Janet]131-janet made a little protesting sound -- a sound of pain .

" Does it give [you]129-rachel the shivers , [old woman]4260-old woman , when [I]129-rachel talk like that ? "[129-rachel] [Rachel]129-rachel slipped [her]129-rachel hand affectionately through [Janet]131-janet 's arm . " Well , [I]129-rachel wo n't , then . But if-- "[129-rachel] [she]129-rachel caught [her]129-rachel breath a little--"if [George]198-ellesborough casts [me]129-rachel off , do n't expect [me]129-rachel to sing psalms and take it piously . [I]129-rachel do n't know [myself]129-rachel just lately -- [I]129-rachel seem quite strange to [myself]129-rachel . "[129-rachel]

And [Janet]131-janet , glancing at [her]131-janet sideways , wondered indeed where all that rosy - cheeked , ripe bloom had gone , which so far had made the constant charm of [Rachel Henderson]129-rachel . Instead a bloodless face , with pinched lines , and heavy - lidded eyes ! What a formidable thing was this " love , "[129-rachel] that [she]129-rachel [herself]129-rachel had never known , though [she]129-rachel had had [her]129-rachel quiet dreams of [husband]3023-husband and [children]1021-children , like [[her]129-rachel fellows]3025-her fellows .

[Rachel]129-rachel , however , would not let [herself]129-rachel be talked with or pitied . [She]129-rachel walked resolutely to [the house]337-the house , and went off to [the fields]3144-the fields to watch [Halsey]244-old halsey cutting and trimming a hedge .

" If [he]244-old halsey does n't come before dark , "[129-rachel] [she]129-rachel said , under [her]129-rachel breath , to [Janet]131-janet , before setting off--"it will be finished . If [he]244-old halsey does-- "[129-rachel]

[She]129-rachel hurried away without finishing the sentence , and was presently taking a lesson from [old Halsey]244-old halsey , in what is fast becoming one of the rarest of the rural arts . But in little more than half an hour , [Janet]131-janet bringing in the cows , saw [her]129-rachel return and go into [the house]337-the house . The afternoon was still lovely -- the sky , a pale gold , with thin bars of grey cloud lying across it , and [the woods]485-the woods , all delicate shades of brown and purple , with their topmost branches clear against the gold . The old red walls and tiled roofs of [the farm]345-the farm , [the fields]3144-the fields , the great hay and straw stacks , were all drenched in the soft winter light .

[Rachel]129-rachel went up to [[her]129-rachel room]2975-her room , and sat down before the bare deal dressing - table which held [her]129-rachel looking - glass , and the very few articles of personal luxury [she]129-rachel possessed ; a pair of silver - backed brushes and a hand - glass that had belonged to [an aunt]3033-an aunt , a small leather case in which [she]129-rachel kept some modest trinkets -- a pearl brooch , a bracelet or two , and a locket that had been [her]129-rachel mother's -- and , standing on either side of the glass , two photographs of [[her]129-rachel father]735-her father and [mother]991-mother .

There was a clock on the mantelpiece . " Nearly four o'clock-- "[129-rachel] [she]129-rachel thought--"I'll give it an hour . [He]735-her father 'd send -- if [he]735-her father could n't come , and [he]735-her father wanted to come -- but if nothing happens -- [I]129-rachel shall know what to think . "[129-rachel]

As this passed through [her]129-rachel mind , [she]129-rachel opened one of the drawers of the dressing - table , in which [she]129-rachel kept [her]129-rachel gloves and handkerchiefs . Suddenly [she]129-rachel perceived at the back of the drawer a small leathern case . The colour rushed into [her]129-rachel face . [She]129-rachel took it out and ran quickly down [the stairs]3036-the stairs to [the kitchen]3239-the kitchen . [Janet]131-janet and [the girls]3326-the girls were busy milking . [The coast]2804-the coast was clear .

A bright fire which [Janet]131-janet had just made up was burning in [the kitchen]3239-the kitchen . [Rachel]129-rachel went up to it and thrust the leathern case into the red core of it . Some crackling -- a disagreeable smell -- and the little thing had soon vanished . [Rachel]129-rachel went slowly [upstairs]439-upstairs again , and locked the door of [[her]129-rachel room]2975-her room behind [her]129-rachel . The drawer of the dressing - table was still open , and there was visible in it the object [she]129-rachel was really in search of , when the little leathern case caught [her]129-rachel eye -- a small cloth - bound book marked " Diary . "[129-rachel]

[She]129-rachel took it out , and sat with it in [her]129-rachel hand , thinking . How was it [she]129-rachel had never yet destroyed that case ? The Greek cameo brooch [it]3043-it held -- [Dick Tanner]201-tanner 's gift to [her]129-rachel -- how vividly [she]129-rachel recalled [her]129-rachel first evening alone at [the farm]345-the farm , when [she]129-rachel had dropped it into [the old well]3045-the old well , and had listened to the splash of it in the summer silence . [She]129-rachel remembered thinking vaguely , and no doubt foolishly , that the cameo would drop more heavily and more certainly without the case , which was wood , though covered with leather , and [she]129-rachel had therefore taken the brooch out , and had probably put back the case absently into [her]129-rachel pocket . And thence it had found its way back among [her]129-rachel things , how [she]129-rachel did not know .

The little adventure had excited and unnerved [her]129-rachel . It seemed somehow of evil omen that [she]129-rachel should have come across that particular thing at this moment . Opening the diary with a rather trembling hand , [she]129-rachel looked through it . [She]129-rachel was not orderly or systematic enough to keep a diary regularly , and it only contained a few entries , at long intervals , relating mostly to [her]129-rachel married life -- and to the death of [[her]129-rachel child]1737-her child . [She]129-rachel glanced through them with that strange sense of unreality -- of standing already outside [her]129-rachel life , of which [she]129-rachel had spoken to [Janet]131-janet . There were some blank pages at the end of the book ; and , in [her]129-rachel restlessness , just to pass the time and to find some outlet for the storm of feeling within , [she]129-rachel began to write , at first slowly , and then very rapidly .

" [He]4261-he must have got [my]3047-i letter by now . [I]3047-i sent it by [Janet]131-janet this morning . [He]4261-he was n't [there]377-there -- but by now [he]4261-he must have got [home]3185-home -- [he]4261-he is probably reading it at this moment . Whatever happens to [me]3047-i -- [I]3047-i want just to say this -- to write it down now , while [I]3047-i can -- [I]3047-i shall never blame [George]198-ellesborough , and [I]3047-i shall always love [him]198-ellesborough -- with all [my]3047-i heart , with all [my]3047-i soul . [He]4261-he has the right to say [he]4261-he ca n't trust [me]3047-i -- [I]3047-i told [him]4261-he so in [my]3047-i letter this morning -- that [I]3047-i am not fit to be [[his]4261-he wife]466-his wife . [He]4261-he has the right -- and very likely [he]4261-he will say it . The terrible thing is that [I]3047-i do n't trust [myself]3047-i . If [I]3047-i look forward and ask [myself]3047-i -- shall [I]3047-i always feel as [I]3047-i do now?--I ca n't honestly be sure . There is something in [me]3047-i that wants change -- always something new -- some fresh experience . [I]3047-i ca n't even imagine the time when [I]3047-i should n't love [George]198-ellesborough . The mere thought of losing [him]198-ellesborough is awful -- unspeakable . But yet -- [I]3047-i will write it down frankly!--nothing has ever lasted with [me]3047-i very long . It is like [the farm]345-the farm . [I]3047-i used to love every minute of the day , every bit of the work , however dull and dirty it was ; and now -- [I]3047-i love it still -- but [I]3047-i seem already -- sometimes -- to be looking forward to the day when [I]3047-i shall be tired of it .[3047-i]

" Why am [I]3047-i made like that ? [I]3047-i do n't know . But [I]3047-i ca n't feel that [I]3047-i am responsible .[3047-i]

" Perhaps if [George]198-ellesborough forgives [me]3047-i , [I]3047-i shall be so happy that everything will change -- [my]3047-i own character first of all . That is [my]3047-i hope . For though [I]3047-i suppose [I]3047-i am vain -- though [I]3047-i like [people]880-people to admire [me]3047-i and make much of [me]3047-i -- [I]3047-i am not really in love with [myself]3047-i at all . If [I]3047-i were , [I]3047-i could n't be in love with [George]198-ellesborough -- [we]4267-we are so different .[3047-i]

" [I]3047-i do n't feel yet that [I]3047-i know [him]198-ellesborough . Perhaps now [I]3047-i never shall . [I]3047-i often find [myself]3047-i wishing that [he]198-ellesborough had something to confess to [me]3047-i . [I]3047-i would hardly let [him]198-ellesborough -- [he]198-ellesborough should never humble [himself]198-ellesborough to [me]3047-i . But to feel that [I]3047-i _ could _ forgive [him]198-ellesborough something , and that [he]198-ellesborough would owe [me]3047-i something -- would be very sweet , very heavenly . [I]3047-i would make it so easy for [him]198-ellesborough . Is [he]198-ellesborough feeling like that towards [me]3047-i ? ' [Poor child]4268-poor child -- [she]4268-poor child was very young -- and so miserable ! '[3047-i]

" [I]3047-i must n't write like this -- it makes [me]3047-i cry . There is a beautiful yellow sunset outside , and [the world]474-the world seems very still . [He]198-ellesborough must be here soon -- or [a messenger]2920-a messenger . [Janet]131-janet asked [him]198-ellesborough not to wait .[3047-i]

" After all , [I]3047-i do n't think [I]3047-i am so changeable . [I]3047-i have just been running [myself]3047-i down -- but [I]3047-i do n't really believe [I]3047-i could ever change -- towards [him]198-ellesborough . Oh , George!--George!--my George!--come to [me!--don't]4271-me!--don't give [me]3047-i up . [George]198-ellesborough , [darling]3832-darling , [you]198-ellesborough could do anything with [me]3047-i [you]198-ellesborough liked -- don't despair of [me]3047-i ! In the Gospel , it was [the bad women who were forgiven because [they]4273-the bad women who were forgiven because they loved ' much loved ' much]4273-the bad women who were forgiven because they loved ' much . ' Now [I]3047-i understand why . Because love makes new . It is so terribly _ strong _ . It is either a poison -- or life -- immortal life . [I]3047-i have never been able to believe in the things [Janet]131-janet believes in . But [I]3047-i think [I]3047-i do now believe in immortality -- in something within [you]198-ellesborough that ca n't die -- when once it has begun to live . "[3047-i]

* * * * *

And then [she]3047-i laid [her]3047-i pencil down -- and sat with the book on [her]3047-i knee -- looking towards the gold and grey of the sky -- the tears running quietly down [her]3047-i cheeks .

* * * * *

Meanwhile , [Hastings]127-miss henderson had come hurriedly into [the shippen]1839-the shippen , where [Janet]131-janet and [the two girls]729-the two girls were milking . [He]3050-he came to stand beside [her]131-janet , silent , but fidgeting so , that [she]131-janet presently looked up in astonishment .

" Did [you]3050-he want [me]3050-he ? "[3050-he]

" [I]3050-he wanted to tell [you]131-janet something , "[3050-he] [he]3050-he said in a low voice , stooping over her--"Don't let [the girls]3326-the girls hear . But [that man]3736-that man 's been seen again . [The tramp]4276-the tramp . "[3050-he]

[Janet]131-janet started . [She]131-janet jumped up , asked [Betty]141-betty , who had finished , to take [her]141-betty place , and went with [Hastings]127-miss henderson out of [the barn]2887-the barn .

" There are [two or three people]4277-two or three people think [they]4277-two or three people 've seen [him]3736-that man lately , "[3050-he] [he]3050-he said hurriedly . " A man from [Dobson]275-dobson 's [farm"--(the[3050-he] farm which lay between [Great End]48-great end and the village)--"who]4278-farm"--(the farm which lay between great end and the village)--"who was on [the hill]369-the hill yesterday evening , just before dark , was certain [he]3736-that man saw [somebody]3820-somebody hanging about the back of [the farm]345-the farm in a queer way-- "[131-janet]

" Last night ? "[131-janet] echoed [Janet]131-janet .

" Yes . And there are [two people who remember meeting [a man on [the X -- road]4284-the x -- road who said [he]3736-that man was going to [Walton End]111-walton end]4283-a man on the x -- road who said he was going to walton end]4282-two people who remember meeting a man on the x -- road who said he was going to walton end . And [the police]1861-the police have been inquiring , but [nobody at]4286-nobody at [Walton End]111-walton end knows anything about [such a man]2937-such a man . However , [they]1861-the police have a description of [him]3736-that man at last . [A tall , dark fellow -- gentlemanly manners]4288-a tall , dark fellow -- gentlemanly manners -- seems delicate . [I]131-janet do n't like the look of it , [Miss Janet]131-janet . Seems to [me]131-janet as though it were n't just [a tramp]4289-a tramp , hanging about for what [he]3736-that man can steal . Do [you]131-janet know of anybody who has a down on [Miss Henderson]127-miss henderson -- who'd like to frighten [her]127-miss henderson , or put blackmail on [her]127-miss henderson ? "[131-janet]

[Janet]131-janet considered . [She]131-janet was tempted to take [the faithful fellow]3052-the faithful fellow to some extent into [her]131-janet confidence , but [she]131-janet rapidly decided against it . [She]131-janet suggested that [he]3052-the faithful fellow should [himself]3052-the faithful fellow sleep for a few nights at [the farm]345-the farm , and carefully examine the neighbourhood of [it]345-the farm , last thing ; and that [she]131-janet should bicycle over to [Millsborough]43-millsborough at once , and have some further talk with [the Superintendent of Police]3054-the superintendent of police [there]377-there .

" Besides -- [I'd]131-janet like to be out of the way , "[131-janet] [she]131-janet thought . " [They]3056-spectators wo n't want [anybody]3236-anybody hanging round ! "[131-janet]

For there was steadily growing up in [her]131-janet a blissful confidence that all would be once more settled and settled for good , before the night fell . [Spectators]3056-spectators were entirely out of place ! Nor would [she]131-janet disturb [Rachel]129-rachel 's mind by any talk just then of what seemed to be a fresh attempt at terrorism on the part of [[her]131-janet wretched husband]3057-her wretched husband . [Hastings]127-miss henderson would be in charge for the moment , and [Ellesborough]198-ellesborough would be on the spot for consultation before darkness had really set in .

So as before , [she]131-janet told [Hastings]127-miss henderson not to alarm [Miss Henderson]127-miss henderson . But [he]3057-her wretched husband was not to leave [the farm - buildings]3058-the farm - buildings , and possibly [the Superintendent of Police]3054-the superintendent of police would return with [her]127-miss henderson . " And then -- either [Rachel]129-rachel or [the Captain]847-the captain will have to tell [the police]1861-the police the truth ! "[131-janet] Just as [she]131-janet was starting , [Rachel]129-rachel came [downstairs]1078-downstairs in some surprise .

" Where are [you]127-miss henderson off to ? "[129-rachel]

" [I]129-rachel have forgotten something [I]129-rachel wanted from [Millsborough]43-millsborough . [I]129-rachel shall be back in an hour or so . "[129-rachel]

[Rachel]129-rachel abstractedly nodded assent . The golden light from the west transfigured [her]131-janet , as [she]131-janet stood in the doorway . [She]131-janet was pale , but it seemed to [Janet]131-janet that [she]131-janet was no longer excited -- that there was in [her]131-janet too something of the confidence which had sprung up in the heart of [[her]131-janet friend]519-her friend . [She]131-janet had the look of one for whom [the Valley of the Shadow]3062-the valley of the shadow is past , and [her]131-janet beauty had never struck [Janet]131-janet as it struck [her]131-janet at that moment . [Its]3063-its grosser elements seemed all refined away . The girlish look was quite gone ; [she]131-janet seemed older and graver ; but there breathed about [her]131-janet " a diviner air . "[131-janet]

[Janet]131-janet , who was much the shorter , mounted on the step to kiss [her]131-janet . Caresses were not at all common between [them]3064-them , but [Rachel]129-rachel returned it , and [their]3064-them eyes met in a quiet look which said what [her]129-rachel lips forbore . Then [Janet]131-janet departed , and [Rachel]129-rachel waved to [her]131-janet as [she]131-janet passed through the gate .

[Hastings]127-miss henderson crossed [the yard]610-the yard , and [Rachel]129-rachel called to [him]3066-him .

" Are [you]3066-him off soon ? "[129-rachel]

" No , [Miss.]4293-miss. [I]129-rachel shall sleep over [the stable]488-the stable . That horse wants looking after . "[129-rachel]

[Rachel]129-rachel acquiesced , with a vague feeling of satisfaction , and [Hastings]127-miss henderson disappeared within [the stable opposite]3067-the stable opposite .

[She]129-rachel went back into [the sitting - room]447-the sitting - room , which was still flooded with the last reflections from the western sky beyond [the fields]3144-the fields , though the light was fading rapidly , and the stars were coming out . What a strange effect it was -- [she]129-rachel suddenly noticed it afresh -- that of the two large windows exactly facing each other in so small [a room]2190-a room ! One had an odd sense of being indoors and out , at the same time ; the down on one side , [the farm - yard]430-the farm - yard on the other , and in the midst , the fire , the table and chairs , the pictures , and the red carpet , seemed all parts of the same scene .

[She]129-rachel made up the fire . [She]129-rachel brought in a few Xmas roses , from a border under the kitchen window , and arranged them in a glass on the table . It was then time to draw the blinds . But [she]129-rachel could not make up [her]129-rachel mind to shut out the saffron sky , or the view of [the road]3145-the road .

Something in the [distance!--an approaching figure]3073-distance!--an approaching figure , and the noise of [a motor - bicycle]1581-a motor - bicycle . [She]129-rachel caught at a chair a moment , as though to steady [herself]129-rachel ; and then [she]129-rachel went to the window , and stood there watching . [He]3075-he saw [her]129-rachel quite plainly in the level light , and leaving [his]3075-he bicycle at the gate , [he]3075-he came towards [her]129-rachel . There was [no one]570-no one in [the yard]610-the yard , and before [he]3075-he entered [he]3075-he stood a moment , bare - headed , gazing at [her]129-rachel , as [she]129-rachel stood framed in the window . Everything that [she]129-rachel wished to know was written in [his]3075-he face . A little sob broke the silence of [the sitting - room]447-the sitting - room .

Then [he]3075-he opened the doors and closed them behind [him]3075-he . Without a word [she]129-rachel seemed to glide over [the room]431-the room towards [him]3075-he ; and now , [she]129-rachel was on [his]3075-he breast , gathered close against [the man]3153-the man 's passionately beating heart . [Neither]3081-neither spoke -- [neither]3081-neither was able to speak .

Then -- suddenly -- a crash of breaking glass -- a shot . [The woman [he]3075-he was holding]3083-the woman he was holding fell from [Ellesborough]198-ellesborough 's arms ; [he]3075-he only just caught [her]129-rachel . Another shot -- which grazed [his]3075-he own coat .

" [Rachel]129-rachel ! "[3075-he]

It was a cry of horror . [Her]129-rachel eyes were closing . But [she]129-rachel still smiled at [him]3075-he , as [he]3075-he laid [her]129-rachel on the floor , imploring [her]129-rachel to speak . There was a stain of blood on the lips , and through [them]3084-them came a few shuddering gasps .

[Hastings]127-miss henderson rushed into the room--

" Good God , [Sir]4295-sir ! "[127-miss henderson]

" A doctor!--Go for [a doctor]908-a doctor ! "[198-ellesborough] said [Ellesborough]198-ellesborough hoarsely--"No -- [she]129-rachel 's gone ! "[198-ellesborough]

[He]3075-he sank down beside [her]129-rachel , putting [his]3075-he ear to [her]129-rachel lips . In vain . No sound was there . The smiling mouth had settled and shut . Without a murmur or a sigh , [Rachel]129-rachel had passed for ever from [this warm world]3085-this warm world and the arms of [[her]129-rachel lover]1714-her lover , at the bidding of [the " fierce workman Death]4297-the " fierce workman death . "[4297-the " fierce workman death]

When [Janet]131-janet , [a doctor]908-a doctor , and [the Superintendent of Police]3054-the superintendent of police arrived , it was to find [Ellesborough]198-ellesborough sitting motionless beside the body , while [the two girls]729-the two girls , [a blanched and shivering pair]3090-a blanched and shivering pair , watched for [Janet]131-janet at the door .

" Can [you]3091-the superintendent throw any light upon it , [Sir]4295-sir ? "[3091-the superintendent] said [the Superintendent]3091-the superintendent , respectfully , at last , when [the Doctor]2704-the doctor had finished [his]2704-the doctor examination , and still [Ellesborough]198-ellesborough did not speak .

[The Captain]847-the captain looked up .

" [[Her]131-janet husband]1294-her husband did it"--he[847-the captain] said , [quietly--"the man who was [[her]131-janet husband]1294-her husband]4300-quietly--"the man who was her husband . "[847-the captain]

A shudder of surprise ran through [the room]431-the room .

" Did [I]3091-the superintendent hear [you]3091-the superintendent right , [Sir]4295-sir ? "[3091-the superintendent] said [the Superintendent]3091-the superintendent . " [Miss Henderson]127-miss henderson passed for unmarried . "[3091-the superintendent]

" [She]131-janet married [a man called [Roger Delane]179-delane in [Canada]13-canada]4303-a man called roger delane in canada , "[198-ellesborough] said [Ellesborough]198-ellesborough , in the same monotonous voice . " [She]131-janet divorced [him]4303-a man called roger delane in canada -- for cruelty and adultery -- two years ago . A few days since [he]4303-a man called roger delane in canada waylaid [her]131-janet in the dark , and threatened [her]131-janet . [I]198-ellesborough did n't know this till [she]131-janet wrote to [me]198-ellesborough to - day . [She]131-janet said that [she]131-janet was afraid of [him]4303-a man called roger delane in canada -- that [she]131-janet thought [he]4303-a man called roger delane in canada was mad -- and [I]198-ellesborough came over at once to see how [I]198-ellesborough could protect [her]131-janet . [We]4304-we were engaged to be married . "[198-ellesborough]

[The Superintendent]3091-the superintendent drew a furtive hand across [his]3091-the superintendent eyes . Then [he]3091-the superintendent produced [his]3091-the superintendent note - book , and took the evidence in order . [Hastings]127-miss henderson came in from a lantern search of [the farm - buildings]3058-the farm - buildings , [the hill - side]779-the hill - side , and [the nearest fringes of wood]3099-the nearest fringes of wood , to report that [he]3091-the superintendent had found no trace of [the murderer]1921-the murderer . The news , however , had by this time spread through [the village]304-the village , and [the kitchen]3239-the kitchen was full of [persons who had hurried to [the farm]345-the farm]3103-persons who had hurried to the farm -- [Old Halsey]244-old halsey and [John Dempsey]194-dempsey among [them]3103-persons who had hurried to the farm -- to tell what [they]3103-persons who had hurried to the farm knew , and had seen . [Ellesborough]198-ellesborough roused [himself]198-ellesborough from [his]198-ellesborough stupor , and came to assist [the police]1861-the police in the preliminary examination of [witnesses]3106-witnesses and inspection of [the farm]345-the farm . Once [he]198-ellesborough and [Janet]131-janet passed [each other]460-each other , but [they]460-each other did not attempt to speak . [Each]541-each indeed shrank from the other . A word of pity would have been merely a deepened agony .

But [the farm]345-the farm emptied at last . [A body of police]3111-a body of police had been sent out to scout [the woods]485-the woods , to watch [the roads]3113-the roads and [the railway stations]3114-the railway stations . [Ellesborough]198-ellesborough and [Hastings]127-miss henderson had lifted [the dead woman]3115-the dead woman upon a temporary bier which had been raised in [the sitting - room]447-the sitting - room . Then [Hastings]127-miss henderson had drawn [Ellesborough]198-ellesborough away , and [Janet]131-janet , with [a village mother]3117-a village mother , had rendered [the last offices]3118-the last offices .

When [Ellesborough]198-ellesborough re - entered , [he]198-ellesborough found a white vision , lying in [a bare room]3119-a bare room , from which all traces of ordinary living had been as far as possible cleared away . Only the Christmas roses which [Rachel]129-rachel had gathered that afternoon were now on [her]129-rachel breast . [Her]129-rachel hands were folded over them . [Her]129-rachel beautiful hair lay unbound on the pillow -- [Janet]131-janet 's trembling hands had refused to cut it .

At sight of [Ellesborough]198-ellesborough , [Janet]131-janet rose from [her]131-janet kneeling posture beside the dead , as white and frozen almost as [Rachel]129-rachel [herself]129-rachel -- with something in [her]131-janet hand -- a small book . [She]131-janet held it out to [Ellesborough]198-ellesborough .

" [The Superintendent]3091-the superintendent asked [my]131-janet leave to go into [[her]129-rachel room]2975-her room -- in case there was anything which could help [them]4307-them . [He]3091-the superintendent brought [me]131-janet this . [She]129-rachel had been writing in it -- [He]3091-the superintendent asked [me]131-janet to look at it . [I]131-janet did -- just enough to see -- that [no one]570-no one had any right to it -- but [you]198-ellesborough . [She]129-rachel wrote it [I]131-janet think about an hour before [you]198-ellesborough came . It was [her]129-rachel last word . "[131-janet]

" [I]198-ellesborough have [her]129-rachel letters also"--said[198-ellesborough] [Ellesborough]198-ellesborough , almost inaudibly , as [he]198-ellesborough took the book--"You brought it -- [[you]131-janet kind woman]4309-you kind woman ! [You]131-janet were [[her]129-rachel good angel]4310-her good angel -- [God]176-god reward [you]131-janet ! "[198-ellesborough]

Then at last a convulsion of weeping showed in [Janet]131-janet 's face . [She]131-janet laid [her]131-janet hand in [his]198-ellesborough , and went noiselessly away .

[Ellesborough]198-ellesborough sat beside [[his]198-ellesborough dead love]3120-his dead love all night . [The farm]345-the farm was peaceful again after that rush of the Furies through it , which had left this wreck behind . [Rachel]129-rachel 's diary and letter lay before [him]198-ellesborough . They were as [her]129-rachel still living voice in [his]198-ellesborough ears , and as the words sank into memory they pierced through all the rigidities of a noble nature , rending and kneading as they went . [He]198-ellesborough recalled [his]198-ellesborough own solitary hour of bitterness after [her]129-rachel letter reached [him]198-ellesborough . The story it contained had gone very hard with [him]198-ellesborough , though never for one moment had [he]198-ellesborough even in thought forsaken [her]129-rachel . There was some comfort in that . But the memory which upheld [him]198-ellesborough , which alone kept [him]198-ellesborough from despair , was the memory of [her]129-rachel face at the window , the sense still lingering in [his]198-ellesborough own physical pulses of [her]129-rachel young clinging life in [his]198-ellesborough arms , of the fluttering of [her]129-rachel poor heart against [his]198-ellesborough breast , the exquisite happiness of [her]129-rachel kiss -- the kiss which death cut short .

No -- [he]198-ellesborough had not failed [her]129-rachel . That was all [he]198-ellesborough had to live by . And without it , it seemed to [him]198-ellesborough , [he]198-ellesborough could not have endured to live .

* * * * *

[The two girls]729-the two girls had sobbed [themselves]729-the two girls to sleep at last . But [Janet]131-janet did not sleep . Tears came naturally as the hours went by -- tears and the agonized relief of prayer to [one for whom prayer was a daily need of the soul]3123-one for whom prayer was a daily need of the soul . And in the early morning there flooded in upon [her]131-janet a strange consciousness of [Rachel]129-rachel 's spirit in [hers]131-janet -- a strange suspicion that after all [the gods]1622-the gods had not wrought so hardly with [Rachel]129-rachel . A few days before [she]131-janet had attended the funeral in [the village church]3143-the village church , of [a young wife just happily married , who had died in three days , of virulent influenza]3126-a young wife just happily married , who had died in three days , of virulent influenza . Never had the words of the Anglican service pleased [her]131-janet so little . What mockery -- what fulsome mockery -- to thank [God]176-god because " it hath pleased [Thee]176-god to deliver [[this]4311-this [our]4313-our sister]4312-this our sister , out of the miseries of [this troublesome world]4314-this troublesome world . "[3412-a god] But the words recurred to [her]131-janet now -- mysteriously -- with healing power . Had it been after all " deliverance "[129-rachel] for [Rachel]129-rachel , from [this " troublesome world]4315-this " troublesome world , "[129-rachel] and the temptations that surround [those who are not strong enough for the wrestle that Fate]3127-those who are not strong enough for the wrestle that fate sets [them]3127-those who are not strong enough for the wrestle that fate -- that [a God]3412-a god appoints [them]3127-those who are not strong enough for the wrestle that fate ? [She]131-janet had met [[her]131-janet lover]1714-her lover -- after fear and anguish ; and had known [him]1714-her lover [hers]131-janet , utterly and wholly [hers]131-janet , for one supreme moment . And from that height -- that perfection -- [God]176-god had called [her]131-janet . No lesser thing could ever touch [her]131-janet now .

Such are the moments of religious exaltation which cheat even the sharpest griefs of [men]3205-men and [women]3203-women . [Janet]131-janet would decline from [her]131-janet Pisgah height only too soon ; but , for the time , thoughts like these gave [her]131-janet the strength to bear .

When [the house]337-the house began to move again , [she]131-janet went down to [Ellesborough]198-ellesborough . [She]131-janet drew [him]1714-her lover into [the kitchen]3239-the kitchen -- made a fire , and brought [him]1714-her lover food . Presently [she]131-janet found calm enough to tell [him]1714-her lover many details of the previous days . And [the man]3153-the man 's sound nature responded . Once [he]1714-her lover grasped [her]131-janet hand , and kissed it -- as though [he]1714-her lover thanked [her]131-janet dumbly again , for [himself]1714-her lover and [Rachel]129-rachel . It seemed to [Janet]131-janet indeed , as [she]131-janet sat by [him]1714-her lover , that [Rachel]129-rachel had left [her]131-janet a trust . [She]131-janet took it up instinctively -- from this first desolate morning . For there are [women set apart for friendship]3135-women set apart for friendship -- [Janet]131-janet was one of [them]3135-women set apart for friendship -- as others are set apart for love .

* * * * *

And with the first break of light on the new November day , the search parties in [the hills]3216-the hills came upon what [they]3137-they sought . [Some one]2287-some one remembered [the deserted hut]3139-the deserted hut -- and from that moment the hunt was easy . Finally in the dripping heart of the wood [the pursuers]3140-the pursuers found [the murderer]1921-the murderer lying face downwards in front of the dead fire , with the revolver beside [him]1921-the murderer with which [he]1921-the murderer had taken first [Rachel]129-rachel 's life , and then [his]1921-the murderer own . Some sheets of paper were scattered near [him]1714-her lover , on which [he]1714-her lover had written an incoherent and grandiloquent confession . But of such acts there is no real explanation . They are the product of that black seed in human nature which is born with [a man]3155-a man , and flowers in due time , through devious stages , into such a deed as that which destroyed [Rachel Henderson]129-rachel .
